loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married, and has five children.

In 1997, Hamza opened a workshop, selling spare parts for cars. He has long experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to make a sliding door and to purchase additional inventory (car accessories and tools). He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and to purchase additional inventory (car accessories and tools).

loans.name: Fotemogoban  A Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN A sont tous des femmes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivent avec leurs maries et enfants à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur premier cycle de prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire leurs besoins en moyen de production et en intrant agricole. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du pois sucré, du maïs, d’arachide etc.
FARIMA, qui est assise l’enfant en main, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Après les récoltes les produits sont stockés pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendus à des clients venant un peu de partout de la région de Sikasso. Le pois est surtout vendu à des industrielles qui le transforme en jus pour la vente sur place et pour l’exportation. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.000 à 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Les 10 membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN A sont tous des femmes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivent avec leurs maries et enfants à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur premier cycle de prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire leurs besoins en moyen de production et en intrant agricole. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du pois sucré, du maïs, d’arachide etc.
FARIMA, qui est assise l’enfant en main, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Après les récoltes les produits sont stockés pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendus à des clients venant un peu de partout de la région de Sikasso. Le pois est surtout vendu à des industrielles qui le transforme en jus pour la vente sur place et pour l’exportation. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.000 à 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et payer les frais de labours

loans.name: Abbia

texts.en: Abbia is a thirty-eight-year-old married woman with two children, and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been raising goats and selling popcorn and palm oil, and this has facilitated her rearing her children. Her vision is to own a ranch and to educate her children. Abbia wants the loan money to buy goats for resale.

loans.use: To buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new goods for her husband's mini-market.

loans.name: Akossiwa Délali

texts.fr: Femme d’un pasteur, AKossiwa vend des tissus pour chemises et pantalons. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Lomé et revend à Baguida. Elle a 30ans et est à son premier crédit. Elle a commencé en 2007.
texts.en: A pastor's wife, Akossiwa sells fabric for shirts and pants. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé and resells in Baguida. She is 30 years old and on her first loan. She got her start in 2007.

loans.use: to buy fabric for shirts and pants.

loans.name: Fotemogoban  B Group

texts.fr:
FOTEMOGOBAN B est un regroupement de  10 femmes toutes mariées, qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 30  ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. EIles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur premier cycle de prêt de campagne afin de satisfaire leurs besoins en moyen de production et en intrant agricole. Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du pois du sucré, du maïs, d’arachide  comme les autres femmes du village. 
NAHAWA, qui est assise en troisième position, autrement dit assise au milieu,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs d’urée, 1 sac de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour car elle a à sa disposition des bras valide pour les activités de sarclage.
Après les récoltes  sont stockées pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendues à des clients venant un peu de partout de la région de Sikasso. Le pois est surtout vendu à des industrielles qui le transforme en jus pour la vente sur place et pour l’exportation. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30.000 à 45 000 FCFA qui seR. utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:

Ces clientes sont à leur premier cycle de prêt de campagne afin de satisfaire leurs besoins en moyen de production et en intrant agricole. Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du pois du sucré, du maïs, d’arachide  comme les autres femmes du village.

Après les récoltes  sont stockées pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendues à des clients venant un peu de partout de la région de Sikasso. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30.000 à 45 000 FCFA qui seR. utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et payer les frais de labours

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is 43 years old and lives in New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children. She has a retail store that sells a variety of products, such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap. She has had this business for just this year. 

She requested a loan to purchase more of a variety of products, such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap. Merla has been a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase more of a variety of products, such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap.

location.town: New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Lazarus

texts.en:
Lazarus is 35 years old and married with two children.  He has been selling secondhand clothes for three years.  He runs his business in a crowded area so he attracts many customers.  

Since Lazarus joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business and improved his standard of living.  He has requested 70,000 KES to buy more clothes to sell.  He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Farid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, single, and lives with one family member.

Farid has had a food market since 2007. He sells vegetables, fruit, cheese, juices, bread, daily use items and dairy products. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2700 loan to buy two freezers and one refrigerator and to purchase additional foodstuffs for his market. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy two freezers and one refrigerator and purchase additional foodstuffs for his market.

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn is married with 4 children. She is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Anelyn is a farmer and grows different kinds of livestock to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

Anelyn has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Pour renforcer son activité (vente de tôles, tuyaux, fils) Kodjo achète ses marchandises à SOTOTOLES (une usine spécialisée dans la vente de ses produits) et revend dans son magasin. Il a commencé en 2009. Soucieux de l’avenir de sa famille (père d’01 enfant) il veut ajouter d’autres activités à la première. Sa femme est revendeuse.
texts.en:
To strengthen his business (sale of metal sheets, pipes and wires) Kodjo purchases his products from Sototoles (a factory specializing in selling these products) and resells in his shop. He got his start in 2009.
Mindful of his family's future (he is father to one son), he wants to add other activities to the former. His wife works as a reseller.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and pipes.

loans.name: Fotemogoban C Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 femmes du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN  C sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans, et  en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent avec leurs maries et leurs enfants à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur 1er cycle  de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles ont décidés de travailler avec Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de rentabiliser leur exploitation agricole. 
Le prêt sera destiné à l’achat d’une quantité importante de semences, d’intrants et de petits matériels constitués de dabas, de tamis pour la récolte du pois sucré qui est leur principale source de revenu.
NAMINATA, la présidente du groupe, qui est au premier rang des femmes debouts avec une écharpe rouge,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs d’urée, 1 sac de complexe céréale un tamis et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25.000 à 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:

Ces clientes sont à leur 1er cycle  de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles ont décidés de travailler avec Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de rentabiliser leur exploitation agricole. 
Le prêt sera destiné à l’achat d’une quantité importante de semences, d’intrants et de petits matériels constitués de dabas, de tamis pour la récolte du pois sucré qui est leur principale source de revenu.
NAMINATA, la présidente du groupe, qui est au premier rang des femmes debouts avec une écharpe rouge,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs d’urée, 1 sac de complexe céréale un tamis et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25.000 à 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de petits matériels agricoles  et payer les frais de labours

loans.name: Lateifa

texts.en:
Lateifa is a 27-year-old woman. She and her mom live with her married brother as they have no other family left to live with or take care of them. Lateifa takes care of her sick mother hence she can't go to work. Lateifa's brother is employed at a clothes store.

Lateifa took out a loan from FATEN as the family live in the Noor Shams refugee camp and the house, like most of the refugee camp houses, needs a lot of maintenance. The house floor is made out of concrete.

 Lateifa, who appears in the picture, wants to replace it with tiles and fix water lines as well.

loans.use: to pay for tiles and construction material to fix up her house in the refugee camp.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 45 years old, married, and has three children.

Bushra has been a tailor since 2002; she makes and repairs women's and kids' clothing. She gained experience from her father. She has a good reputation and she is well known in her area.

She is requesting a $2400 loan. She is aiming to earn more profit so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy two tailoring machines and a generator.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 38 years old and a single mother of three. She is able to raise her children with the income she gets from her retail shop.  She has been operating the business for three years. She was able to get capital to start the business through the support of Faulu Kenya. Previously, she was selling second-hand clothes.

Susan has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.  She hopes that one day she will grow her business into a wholesalers.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is 45 years old and lives in Dipolog City. She is married with two children.

Isidra works in the fish industry catching and selling fish for a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more fish to sell.

Isidra has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Kouame

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 27ans et père d’1 enfant, Kouame est technicien de profession. Il veut assurer un avenir radieux à ses famille c’est pour cela il a ajouté à son activité principale en 2008 la vente des articles scolaires. Ce premier prêt qu’il sollicite lui servira à acheter plus de marchandises pour répondre à la demande. Sa femme est revendeuse. Son approvisionnement se fait à Lomé et la revente dans sa boutique dans un quartier de la place.
texts.en: Kouame is 27 years old, with one child, and is a technician by trade. He would like to ensure a bright future for his family and so began to sell school supplies in 2008. This is the first loan that he has sought and he will use it to purchase more goods to meet growing customer demand. His wife also sells goods at retail for a living. Kouame sources his goods from Lomé and sells them from his shop in his town quarter.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies

loans.name: Fakhriddin

texts.ru: Фахриддин проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 31 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена, домохозяйка. Сам Фахриддин занимается торговлей на рынке. У него имеется магазин, где он продает стройматериалы. В этой области он работает уже три года. Кредит берет для приобретения новых материалов. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Fakhriddin lives in Vahdat.  He is 31 years old, married, and has three children,  His wife is a housewife,  Fakhriddin trades at the market.  He has a shop where he sells construction materials.  He has been doing this work for three years.  He is taking out a loan to acquire new materials.  He wants to increase the variety of his wares.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Fotemogoban  D Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN D sont tous des femmes mariées, qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 31  ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. EIles vivent avec leurs maries et enfants à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur premier cycle de prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et font la culture du pois sucré, du maïs, d’arachide et leurs  ventes font l’objet d’une activité rentable dans la zone.
ANCHATA, qui est en deuxième position des femmes debouts en tenue  bleu, compte utiliser de façon suivante son prêt : Achat de  3 sacs d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Après les récoltes sont stockées pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendues à des clients venant un peu de partout de la région de Sikasso. Le pois est surtout vendu à des industrielles qui le transforment en jus pour la vente sur place et pour l’exportation.  Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30.500 à 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et payer les frais de labours

loans.name: Kouélé

texts.fr: Revendeuse de riz à la devanture de sa maison, Akouélé a 48ans. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des condiments (riz, huile haricot, mais…) Notons qu’elle a commencé en 2005. Elle est mère de 02enfants et son mari est enseignant et fondateur d’école. Elle vend aussi des tomates, piment et des épices.
texts.en: Akouélé is 48 years old and has sold rice from her home since 2005. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase condiments (rice, vegetable oil, and corn...). She has two children and her husband is a teacher and founder of a school.  She also sells tomatoes, pepper and spices.

loans.use: to purchase rice, vegetable oil and corn

loans.name: Ma. Nida

texts.en:
Ma. Nida is married with 3 children. Ma. Nida is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Ma. Nida is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 21 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers for her plantation of vegetables.

Ma. Nida has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her plantation of vegetables.

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
Ariunaa is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a house in Tuv province, Mongolia. Her older son is a student while the younger three attend secondary school.

She manages a tire repair business in her town, with the help of her husband. She started her business in 2005 and gained much experience. In addition, she also conducts a welding service at her workshop. Her workshop is located near the main road of her province. Therefore, she has been able to build a strong customer base. During the summertime, her children help with the family business.

She is planning to operate a car wash service, too. She is a polite woman who says, "All I want is to get my children educated and to be better people." She is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase cleaning products for her car wash business.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning products

loans.name: Dorene

texts.en:
Dorene, a married lady with four children, has been running a green grocery to earn a living for three years. Operating in a very competitive environment, she is able to retain her customers because of the good service she provides. She also relies on her husband, who is employed, for financial support. Since joining Faulu Kenya, Dorene has grown her business, resulting in improved family living standards.

Dorene is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cereals, vegetables, potatoes and fruits. She hopes to build a permanent business premise in the future.

loans.use: to buy cereals, vegetables, potatoes and fruits.

loans.name: Glen

texts.en: Glen, a 26-year-old married mother of two children, lives in Plaridel where she has a business making living room and dining furniture. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month.  A member of PMPC for two years, Glen is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials needed to make her products.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make new products.

loans.name: Fotemogoban  E Group

texts.fr:
FOTEMOGOBAN E est un regroupement de 10 femmes toutes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 33  ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. EIles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles  à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur premier cycle de prêt de campagne font la culture du pois sucré, du maïs, d’arachide  comme la majorité des femmes du village. 
BARAKISSA, la présidente du groupe, debout au milieu avec une écharpe,  compte acheter, 1 sac d’urée, 1 sac de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de désherbage.
Après les récoltes sont stockées pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendues à des clients venant un peu de partout de la région de Sikasso. Le pois est surtout vendu à des industrielles qui le transforment en jus pour la vente sur place et pour l’exportation. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25.000 à 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et payer les frais de labours

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is 39 years old, married, and has three children. They live in the Philippines. Arlene is a farmer and raises different livestock to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She is requesting a loan to  purchased livestock feeds and other supplies.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feeds and other supplies

loans.name: Limata

texts.fr:
Limata est une femme âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée à un agent de douane en retraite. Ils ont un enfant. 
Limata a travaillé comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend des produits d'alimentation générale dans une petite boutique à la maison. Elle achète les produits au Grand Marché de Lomé. 
Limata a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 2 cartons de lait, 2 cartons de sardines, 3 cartons de tomates, 8 cartons de macaroni, de la mayonnaise et du lait concentré.
texts.en: Limata is a 42 year-old mother of one who is married to a retired customs officer. She has sold food products from a small shop at her home since 2008.  She sources her goods from the large market at Lomé. She is seeking her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase 2 cartons of milk, 2 tins of sardines, 3 tins of tomatoes, 8 tins of macaroni, mayonnaise and evaporated milk.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Nakyesa Naffe Tuveyo Group

texts.en: Jaiia is 47 years old, divorced, and has seven children. She is full of energy, optimism, and determination. For the last two years, Jaiia has been expanding her poultry business, which she took over from her former husband. She operates her business from Kayunga district. Before Jaiia got involved in this enterprise, she was running a grocery business. Her weekly profits are 150,000 shillings. Jaiia is requesting a loan to enable purchase more layer chickens.

loans.use: to purchase of layer chickens.

loans.name: Fotemogoban  F Group

texts.fr:
FOTEMOGOBAN F est constitué de 10 femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34  ans,  4 enfants et  vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur premier cycle de prêt de campagne avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire leurs besoins en moyen de production et en intrant agricole. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du pois sucré, du maïs, d’arachide etc 
AFOU, qui est la présidente du groupe, la première debout avec une écharpe blanche,  compte acheter, 3 sacs d’urée et le reste comme frais de labour, de sarclage et de récolte car la récolte du pois sucré est  une activité très difficile pour les femmes. Après les récoltes les produits sont stockés pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendus à des clients venant un peu de partout de la région de Sikasso. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000 à 
40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
FOTEMOGOBAN F est constitué de 10 femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34  ans,  4 enfants et  vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur premier cycle de prêt de campagne avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire leurs besoins en moyen de production et en intrant agricole. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du pois sucré, du maïs, d’arachide etc 
AFOU, qui est la présidente du groupe, la première debout avec une écharpe blanche,  compte acheter, 3 sacs d’urée et le reste comme frais de labour, de sarclage et de récolte car la récolte du pois sucré est  une activité très difficile pour les femmes. Après les récoltes les produits sont stockés pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendus à des clients venant un peu de partout de la région de Sikasso. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000 à 
40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et payer les frais de labours et de récolte

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 50 years old and married with three children. To earn a living, he operates a taxi business. He has been in the business for eleven years. John also practices mixed farming to generate more income. He says that since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve how he manages his business thanks to management trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya.  

John is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to repair his vehicle. In the future, he hopes to have his own company.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 36 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason. She is married with two children. For the past year, Gemma has sold a variety of products, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste, to earn a living. She earns a monthly income of 3,000 PHP for her work. 

Gemma joined PMPC this year. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste to sell.

loans.use: to purchase products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste to sell

location.town: Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is 43 years old and married with three children between the ages of 15 and 20. She runs a boutique in Tengbeh Town, just outside of Freetown. Salamatu has been in this business for five years and sells shoes, bags, clothes, and hair products at her store. Her business helps increase her savings and improve the family income. Salamatu says that her main business challenge is inflation. 

Salamatu is requesting a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more boutique items. She says that the extra income from her loan will help her educate her children. In the future, Salamatu would like to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boutique items, such as shoes, bags, and dresses

loans.name: Marcialisa

texts.en:
Marcialisa is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. To earn a living, Marcialisa is a livestock farmer. She has been doing this for nine years. Marcialisa has been a member of PMPC for two years.

Marcialisa is requesting a loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and supplies

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married lady with three children. She sells fabric to earn a living and has been operating her business for two years. Hellen’s business is in the slums and most of her customers are low-income earners. She employs one person.

Hellen has been able to boost her business with a previous loan from Faulu Kenya.  She is requesting another loan of 20,000 KES to buy more fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 41 years old, married, and has three children. They live in Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del norte. To earn a living, Jenelyn has a business selling tobacco to her customers in different areas in town. She earns about 3,000 PHP a month. Jenelyn is requesting loan to purchase fertilizers.

Jenelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Jenelyn would like to have her own motorcycle for the delivery of her tobacco.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Torkunbubu's Group

texts.en:
Torkunbubu is the leader of this group. She is 49, married to a driver, and has four children. The older son is a farmer, the second son studies at university, and the other children attend school. The family breeds livestock to earn money. This year in order to earn additional money to meet their daily needs Torkunbubu started to sell Kyrgyz national drink, “Kumys” (horse milk). She is requesting a loan because she needs additional funds for expanding the business. Part of the loan will be used to purchase more “Kumys” and the other part will be used to purchase livestock for breeding. In the future, Torkunbubu wishes to purchase a big house in the village.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Malakeh

texts.en:
Malakeh is 33 years old, married and the mother of two children. For the past six years, she has worked selling clothes. She sold clothes from her house until three years ago when she received a loan from Al Majmoua that helped her open her own clothing shop in 2008. Malakeh is well-known in her region and is liked by most of her customers because she has good taste, chooses the best collections, and provides perfect customer service.

Malakeh is requesting a loan to buy a new summer collection to increase her income. She is a borrower in good standing and a smart businesswoman who works hard to provide the best living for her children. In the future, Malakeh hopes to expand her shop to provide a greater selection for her customers.

loans.use: to buy a new summer collection

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 36 years old and married with seven children. She lives in Tangub City. For the past ten years, Anecita has worked in the fish industry and she sells fish for a living. She has been a member of PMPC for two years.

Anecita is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh and dried fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Fotemogoban G Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres  de FOTEMOGOBAN G sont des femmes mariées, avec une moyenne d’âge de 33  ans, et 5 enfants en moyenne. EIles vivent avec leurs maries et leurs enfants à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Le groupe est à son premier cycle de prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire leurs besoins en moyen de production et en intrant agricole. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du pois sucré, du maïs, d’arachide etc. 
MARATOU, la première assise en T-shirt et foulard blanc, compte acheter, 2 sacs d’urée, 1 sac de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Après les récoltes, les produits sont stockés pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendus à des clients venant un peu de partout de la région de Sikasso. Le pois est surtout vendu à des industrielles qui le transforment en jus pour la vente sur place et pour l’exportation. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000 à 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et payer les frais de labours

loans.name: Eustiquia Group

texts.en:
Eustiquia is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a widow with five children. For the past ten years, Eustiquia has been a farmer and she grows corn to earn a living. She has been a member of PMPC for two years.

Eustiquia is the group leader of this six-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member has her own business. Eustiquia is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer to increase her corn production.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to increase corn production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Kutfiniso

texts.en:
Kutfiniso is an honest and hardworking woman who is married with four children. She works producing and selling dried fruit. Kutfiniso purchases fresh fruit from the villages of Isfara city which she dries and resells. She spends about five or six thousand TJS to purchase enough fruit to make five or six tons of dried fruit. 

Kutfiniso is requesting a loan of 5,000 TJS to purchase and dry fruit to sell and make a good profit.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Atamurat

texts.ru: Атамурат проживает в Яванском районе. Ему 57 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его сын занимается строительными работами по найму. Сам Атамурот более 14 лет занимается животноводством. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота. Он хочет увеличить количество скот и получить больше дохода.
texts.en: Atamurat lives in Yavan.  He is 57 years old, married, and has six children.  His son is a day laborer in construction.  Atamurat has worked in animal husbandry for more than fourteen years.   He makes a living by raising cattle.  He is taking out a loan to buy small livestock (sheep or goats).  He would like to expand his flocks and receive a greater income.

loans.use: to buy small livestock (such as sheep or goats).

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Kokou est un homme âgé de 34 ans. Il est marié å une couturière. Ils ont un enfant. 
Kokou a travaillé comme revendeur depuis 2001. Il achète et vend des portable au port autonome. Il achète les portables au Nigeria aussi. 
Kokou a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du stock de portables.
texts.en:
Kokou is a man of 34. He is married to a seamstress. They have one child. Kokou has worked selling goods since 2001. He buys and resells cell phones at the Port in his town. He also buys cell phones in Nigeria. 
 
Kokou has requested his second loan from WAGES to stock up on cell phones.

loans.use: to buy cell phones.

loans.name: Fotemogoban  H Group

texts.fr:
Les 8 membres de FOTEMOGOBAN H sont tous des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31  ans, 4 enfants et vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Le groupe est à son premier cycle de prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro et fait la culture du pois sucré, du maïs, d’arachide etc.
BAGNINI, la deuxième debout avec un foulard jaunâtre et une chemise blanche, compte acheter,  2 sacs d’urée, 1 sac de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Après les récoltes sont stockées pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendues à des clients venants de tous les coins du pays puisque ce produit est cultivé dans la région de SIKASSO seulement au Mali. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000 à 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:

Après les récoltes sont stockées pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendues à des clients venants de tous les coins du pays puisque ce produit est cultivé dans la région de SIKASSO seulement au Mali. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000 à 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et payer les frais de labours

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is a 42 year-old married woman with two children who lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. For the past four years, Lan and her husband have earned money by making soya bean cakes. 

Lan is requesting a loan to buy more soya beans to increase production and enabL. her to earn more money to provide for her family's expenses. Lan hopes that in the future she can save more money to improve her family's living conditions and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy soya beans and produce soya cakes

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe CONFIANCE sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, en moyenne  3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles monogames à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur treizième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
KADI, qui est la présidente du groupe et la première debout à droite, de blanc vêtue, fait le commerce de  condiments à travers ce groupe de femmes CONFIANCE. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 3 cartons de cube Maggi, 25kg de sel gemme, 100kg d’oignons, 2 paniers de choux frais, 3 paniers de tomates fraiche, 2 paniers de jakatou et 2 colis de divers autres  petits condiments, au grand marché de la ville  de Sikasso et dans les villages avoisinants.
 Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso  à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Pour acheter des condiments.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet is a 46-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Her husband supports the family through the income that he earns as a laborer. Tuyet has been supporting her family by earning an income raising and selling pigs for the past 15 years. She would like to take out a loan to buy more pigs to increase the size of her business. 

She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs for raising and selling

loans.name: Danaya. Group

texts.fr:
Les  6 membres du groupe DANAYA sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
KAMBA, qui est debout en deuxième position à gauche, enfant au dos,  fait le commerce de  pagnes wax dans ce groupe de femmes DANAYA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 3 balles de pagnes wax au prix d’en gros au grand marché de la ville  de Sikasso et souvent à Bamako.
 Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso  de façon ambulante et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.

loans.use: Pour acheter des pagnes wax

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed is a 35-year-old farmer. He has been working in farming and  producing dairy products for a long time. Majed has a goat farm; he raises them and use their milk to produce milk, yogurt and cheese.

Majed wants to increase production and start covering areas outside Jenin therefore he took out a loan from FATEN to purchase four goats. The new goats will increase production and profit noticeably.

Majed is photographed in the picture here.

loans.use: to purchase goats to increase milk production.

loans.name: Khidirnazar

texts.ru: Хидирназар проживает в районе Яван. Ему 55 лет. Он женат. Имеет 5 детей. У него среднее образование. Он занимается животноводством. Разводит мелко - рогатый скот у себя дома. Он в основном разводит скот для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Khidirnazar lives in Yavan.  He is 55 years old, married, and has five children.  He has a secondary education.  He works in animal husbandry,  He raises small livestock (sheep or goats) at home.  He raises them primarily for sale.  He has been doing this work for ten years. He is taking out a loan to buy more livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Benkadi  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe BENKADI 1 sont toutes mariées et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sieurs  etc  à NIARADOUGOU. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, au moins 4 enfants. NIARADOUGOU est un village qui est un chef lieu de commune situé à environ 23 km  de la ville de Sikasso troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali.  
Elles exercent la culture du maïs, du gombo (telle avec SALI) et du poivron,  qui sont des produits vendus sur les marchés de Sikasso et dans d’autres communes de la région. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs activités agricoles, les membres du groupe ont donc décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a plus de 5 ans. Le groupe est à son sixième cycle de prêt de campagne. Les cinq  prêts antérieurs ont tous été correctement remboursés.
SALI  qui est la présidente de ce groupe, est debout au milieu et tient un enfant,  compte acheter , 2 sacs d’urée et 10 sacs de complexe. Ces intrants seront achetés au grand marché de Sikasso. Après les récoltes en fin de campagne, les produits sont stockés pendant un certain  temps pour qu’ils aient de la valeur avant d’être vendus  au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso en détail (souvent en gros) à divers client.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25.000 à 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.

loans.use: Pour l’achat des intrants agricole.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh is a 21-year-old hardworking single man. He owns a van which he uses to sell coffee in the Tyre region. He describes it as a mobile delivery cafe. Saleh owns an espresso machine, which gives his coffee a special taste compared to others'. Saleh started his business in 2004. These seven years of experience helped lay a foundation for him, bringing him loyal customers and a special position in his business. This is Saleh's first time requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, and it's because he wants to increase his sugar and coffee capital, in addition to paying for painting his house and pasting new floor tiles. Saleh hopes to expand his business and to have a beloved family of his own in the future.

loans.use: to buy extra coffee and sugar with special prices

loans.name: Shonazar

texts.en:
Shonazar is a hardworking man. He is married and the father of two children. He sells household goods, such as flashlights, batteries, chargers, and toys. Shonazar tries to improve his living condition and educate his children. Shonazar would like to expand his business and increase the assortment of his goods. He is requesting a loan of $3,000 USD to purchase an assortment of new goods in order to increase the quantity of his products.

loans.use: to buy new goods

loans.name: Benkadi  2 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 2 est un regroupement de 10 femmes toutes mariées qui vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sœurs  etc. Âgées d’au moins  31 et ayant  5 enfants en moyenne, elles résident à NIARADOUGOU, village est situé à environ 23 km  de la ville de Sikasso troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali.  
Elles exercent la culture du maïs, du gombo et du poivron, ces produits sont vendus sur les marchés de Sikasso et dans d’autres communes de la région. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs activité agricoles, les membres du groupe ont donc décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a 5 ans. Le groupe est à son sixième cycle de prêt de campagne. Les prêts antérieurs ont tous été correctement remboursés.
MAMINATA qui est la deuxième debout à droite et tout de bleu vêtue,utilisera son prêt pour acheter, des semences, des intrants et des petits matériels agricoles. Ces matériels et intrants seront achetés au grand marché de Sikasso. Après les récoltes en fin de campagne, les produits sont stockés pendant un certain  temps pour qu’ils aient de la valeur avant d’être vendus  au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso en détail (souvent en gros) à divers client.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish the new apartment (installing wash bowls, sinks, etc.) before his wedding date.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is married and has one adult son. She sells women’s clothing in the market. Fotima started this business 10 years ago. She would like to increase the assorted inventory in her kiosk and improve her sales as well. Today she is requesting a loan of 9,300 Tajikistani somoni (TJS) to restock her inventory. She is hoping to obtain a stable source of income and continue developing her business. A committed wife and mother, Fotima works tirelessly to improve the quality of life for her family. We are hoping that her eye for market trends and customer needs will help her maintain consistent growth in her business and reach success.

loans.use: to purchase more boutique items, shoes, bags, and dresses

loans.name: Benkadi  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe BENKADI 3 sont toutes mariées et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sœurs, à NIARADOUGOU. Âgées d’au moins  30 elles ont  6 enfants en moyenne, elles sont très courageuses et très expérimentées.
Elles exercent la culture du maïs du gombo et du poivron, ces produits sont vendus sur les marchés de Sikasso et dans d’autres communes de la région. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs activité agricoles, les membres du groupe ont donc décidés d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a plus de 5 ans. Les prêts antérieurs ont tous été correctement remboursés.

loans.name: Sevindj

texts.ru:
Sevindj 42 qoda. Ona zamujem i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Sevindj Yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Zengilan region  ,seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Uje 6 let kak ona zanimayetsya prodajey obuvi tapochek a takje chaynix servisov v odnom magazine. 
Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomecheniye, tak kak ona xochet so vremenem nachat prodaju raznoy posudi ne tolko servisov i tem samim razvit i uludshit svoy business.
texts.en:
Sevindj is 42 years old.  She is married and has one child. Sevindj  is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from the Zengilan region who now lives in the Absheron region with her family.  For six years she has been selling slippers and tea services in her shop.
 
Now she needs 2000 AZN to expand her shop.  She would like to begin selling other dishes, not just tea services, and thereby expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her shop.

loans.name: Souhaila

texts.en: Souhaila is a 47-year-old married woman living in Tyre with her husband and three children. She opened a grocery store two years ago to help her husband in covering their expenses and to improve their living conditions. Souhaila works hard to improve her business, buying products with special offers most of the time. She has requested a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner in order to increase her business capital and to pay for her daughter's medical surgery. Her customers are relatives, neighbors, and friends. She's honest and a woman with good customer service. She hopes to expand her business more and continue providing healthy living to her family.

loans.use: To increase her business capital and pay for her daughter's surgery

loans.name: Benkadi  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe BENKADI 4 sont tous des femmes mariées  qui vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sœurs  etc. Âgées d’au moins  30 et ayant  5  enfants en moyenne, elles résident dans le village de NIARADOUGOU  situé à environ 23 km  de la ville de Sikasso troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali.  
Elles exercent la culture du maïs, du gombo et du poivron, ces produits sont vendus sur les marchés de Sikasso et dans d’autres communes de la région. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs activité agricoles, les membres du groupe ont donc décidés d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso comme leur collègue il y’a plus de 5 ans. Le groupe est à son sixième cycle de prêt de campagne. Les prêts antérieurs ont tous été correctement remboursés.
ASSETOU, est la présidente de ce groupe, elle se tient debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo, compte acheter, 1 sac d’urée et le reste comme frais de labours. L’intrant sera acheté au grand marché de Sikasso. Après les récoltes en fin de campagne, les produits sont stockés pendant un certain  temps pour qu’ils aient de la valeur avant d’être vendus  au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso en détail (souvent en gros) à divers client.
ASSETOU envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 12.000 à 17 500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.

loans.use: Pour l’achat d’intrant agricole et frais de labours

loans.name: Sinignessigui Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI IV sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans,  en moyenne  6 enfants et vivant  dans des familles traditionnelles à NIARADOUGOU, un village situé à environ 23 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ce groupe de producteurs est à son deuxième cycle de prêt  dans la production  du maïs avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction, c’est pourquoi ils ont espérés sur un nouveau prêt cette année.   . 
Le responsable du groupe est ABOU qui se trouve au milieu en position debout. 
Le groupe fait la culture du maïs et sa vente depuis plusieurs années, ce qui est une activité rentable dans la zone.
ABOU compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, de 3 sacs d’urée; 2 sacs de complexe céréale, 2 litres d’herbicide et le reste comme frais de labour.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80.000 FCFA utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Il ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Pour l’achat des intrants agricole et frais de labours

loans.name: Jamshedjon

texts.en:
Jamshedjon is 29 years old. He is married and has four children. Her wife is a housekeeper and Jamshedjon's business is the main source of income for his large family. Jamshedjon has provided transportation services for the last 10 years. Each day, he transports different goods for his clients in his truck. Jamshedjon dreams that all of his children be well-educated so he is working hard. As a result, the business generates a significant income allowing him to support his large family. In order to provide better service for his clients and earn more, Jamshedjon needs to make major repairs to his truck. He believes that this will make his business more profitable. For this purpose he requests 10000 TJS.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Marziya

texts.en:
Marziya is hard-working woman who is married and the mother of two children. She sells fresh fruit and vegetables in the market and makes a good profit. Marziya would like to expand her business and improve her living conditions. For this purpose, Marziya has requested a loan of 5000 TJS.

loans.use: to purchase concrete and tools to start a bakery.

loans.use: To buy more food items and drinks for his bar and restaurant

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.en:
Rahmatullo has been in the business of cattle ranching for the last 30 years. The breeding business requires a lot of dedication and effort since it requires the strict control of every one of the animals, including feed and care for those that are older. Through this business, Rahmatullo is able to support his spouse and his four children. He is soliciting a loan through IMON International to buy more animals to raise and sell in the market.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise

loans.name: Mamoud

texts.en:
Mamoud is 39 years old and single with one child who is 18 years old. He runs a stationery and office supply store in Tengbeh, which is near Freetown.

Mamoud has owned this business for five years and sells books, pens, rulers and pencils at his store.  His business is the only source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is inflation. 

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more office supply  items. Mamoud says that the extra income from this loan will help him change the standard of living of his family. In the future, he would like to export and import goods from a neighboring country.

loans.use: To purchase more office supplies: books, pens, pencils and rulers, etc.

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.en:
Ibrohim is dedicated to agriculture and livestock raising, which he does in his home where he lives together with his family, made up of his wife and four children. His strength in work is raising livestock.

 Ibrohim has always been dedicated to giving technical assistance to his crops through fumigation and care to obtain a good harvest. Now Ibrohim needs to acquire economic resources to invest in his livestock business such as the purchase of cows to raise and to obtain milk for sustenance and for commercialization. For this reason he seeks support from IMON International to be a beneficiary of a loan that will allow him to succeed in his business.

loans.use: to purchase young cattle.

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif  is 51 years old. He is married with three children. Yusif is dedicated to his livestock breeding business. Having little knowledge in the beginning in 2005, he had to learn a lot about farming. As of now, he has acquired a fair experience in agriculture. 

Yusif is very happy with his three children who are the motivation for his desire to grow his business. His first two loans from AqroInvest allowed Yusif to develop his business and purchase more cattle. And now this is the third time he has applied to AqroInvest Credit Union to obtain a loan to buy three cattle and fodder. 

As summer is the high season for wedding parties and meat is a  main course, Yusif will do his best to increase his turnover and put aside some savings for the rest of the year. This will enable him to expand his herd and to take care of his children and his home.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more materials and hire a new assistant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three calves.

loans.name: Gulsunoy

texts.en:
Gulsunoy is married and has a grown daughter. She lives in Khujand, Tajikistan and runs a small business selling children's clothing in several markets. Gulsunoy owns three vending facilities and has been in this trade for six years. Her inventory is characterized by uniqueness and high quality. She tries to choose good quality merchandise which will always be in demand and sell well.

 Gulsunoy is requesting a loan of 7000 Somoni to increase her stock of goods for the summer season. She believes her conscientious efforts and persevering work will help her expand her business even more and boost her sales. Gulsunoy is ready to invest in her family's well-being and is planning to work hard to ensure a stable future for them.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi comes from village Krasnoe, Marneuli District, West Georgia. This district is well known in the country for its agriculture, in particular vegetable- and fruit-growing. 

Giorgi is requesting a loan to increase the stock in trade in his small greengrocery located in his village. Giorgi is 32 years old and lives with his wife Tamara, his mother and his grandmother. He is the only income provider in the family. He purchases fruits and vegetables in Marneuli at wholesale prices and sells them with a price mark-up in the village. 

The total average monthly income of the family amounts to 990 Laris, including the pension of Giorgi’s grandmother. In the summer period there are a variety of fruits and vegetables and Giorgi’s existing cash isn’t enough to supply all of them for his store. With the requested credit he will increase the assortment of products and encourage greater turnover in the store. This will positively impact his profit. Giorgi plans to reinvest about half of the profit in his business and the other half will be used to cover daily family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for his greengrocery store.

loans.name: Golib

texts.en:
Golib makes a living using his taxi to transport people around Spitamen region and surrounding areas in Northern Tajikistan. Personal vehicles are too expensive for most people to afford in Tajikistan. Transportation services such as buses and minivans like Golib’s provide a valuable means of getting around for many, many people. 

Golib currently makes around $15 per day--enough for him to support his family. Golib has requested a loan of $1200 to help him with some maintenance on his taxi. He has been in business for three years and has put a lot of kilometers on his car. Eventually he’d like to purchase spare parts for his car to keep his vehicle in good working order. With part of the loan he will also buy young cattle.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for maintenance of his minivan.

loans.name: Chingiz

texts.en:
Chingiz  is 35 years old. He is married with two children.  Seven years ago Chingiz, with his mechanic's skills, started to do work for his neighbors and acquaintances. He learned this skill at another shop, until he had the opportunity to begin his own business. With all faith and enthusiasm, his auto mechanic business started to grow little by little.

Villagers who use trucks and tractors for their business always come to have their machines repaired by him. Now, Chingiz is finding that the tools and spare parts that he has are not enough to work at his job at full speed. For this reason, he is seeking a loan of 1000 AZN. This loan will be used to buy tools and spare parts used to repair autos. With this loan, Chingiz will be able to provide his children with better living conditions and improve the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to purchase tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Bozorboy

texts.en:
Bozorboy is a hard-working man. He is married and has three children. Bozorboy sells daily products as a juices, tea, sweets and chocolates. He wants to expand his business and improve his living conditions. He would like to get a loan of 4500 TJS to purchase new goods in order to increase the assortment of goods in his store. 

 More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new goods for resale.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 28-year-old mother of two daughters and one son. Her husband is a construction worker in the land behind the Wall\ Green Line. Rania and her husband are building a house that they are investing in with all their savings.

Rania and her husband need $3,000 to finish the house and move in by the end of summer 2011. Rania took out the loan from FATEN to cover the finishing expenses.

Rania's husband is a partner in a goat farm which adds to their income.

Rania is a conservative woman therefore her brother is photographed instead of her.

loans.use: to pay the wages of construction workers who are finishing Rania's house.

loans.name: Justino

texts.pt:
nasceu na Provincia de Maputo, tem 39 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de 3 filhos de 9 aos 12 anos todos vão a Escola. Fez  a 7ª classe não concluiu porque teve que cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com sua familia, responsabiliza se pelos seus irmãos que vivem na cidade enviando lhes em cada 3 meses 1.000.00mt.

Após ter cumprido o serviço militar obrigatòrio consegue aranjar um emprego na G4S como segurança, é trasferido para o Distrito de Namaacha onde fixa sua residência com a familia. Trabalha ha mais de 6 anos no periodo da manhã das 7h as 17h e no peiodo da noite das 17h as 7h do dia seguinte, auferindo mensalmente 2.932 que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra. Também conta com ajuda da sua mulher que é  funcionaria da fabrica de sumos no mesmo Distrito.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende compra de meterial de construção( cimento, areia, barrotes e mais)para dar continuidade da sua obra, ele tem vantagem porque constroi pessoalmente a sua casa.  trabalha com o BIM  e paga cem problema, conhece a hluvuku atraves dos colegas que são clientes da instituição.
texts.en:
Justino was born in Maputo Province. He is 39 years old, is married and has 3 children between 9 and 12 years old. All the children go to school. Justino finished 7th grade but did not finish school because he had to complete his obligatory military service. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his siblings, who live in the city, by sending them 1,000 meticais every three months.

After finishing his obligatory military service, he was able to get a job at G4S [translator's note: Group Four Securicor security company] as a security guard, and he was transferred to Namaacha District where he made his home with his family. For more than six years he has worked the day shift from 7:00 am until 5:00 pm and the night shift from 5:00 pm until 7:00 am the next day. Justino earns 2,932 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses and for his construction project. He also relies on his wife's help; she works in the juice factory in the same District.

This is Justino's first loan with Hluvuku. He is asking for 10,000 meticais, which he will use to buy construction materials (cement, sand, beams and more) to continue work on his home. He has an advantage because he built his house himself. He has worked with BIM and made his payments with no problems. Justino learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are customers of this institution.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, sand, beams, etc.).

loans.name: Nicaise

texts.fr:
Homme de 47ans, marié, père de 2enfants dont l’âge varie de 18 à 27 ans. Il a appris la maçonnerie et s’est spécialisé dans fabrication des buses, des poteaux, des balustres, pavés, des latrines pour w.c. et des briques. Il a fait preuve de bon comportement durant les remboursements, vice-président du groupe, il a aussi dirigé ses membres sans difficultés. 
Le premier et second prêt lui avait permis d’acheter : du sable, du ciment, du gravier, des fers à béton, du ciment blanc. 

Avec ses vente journalières de 70.000f, il veut passer au troisième prêt et compte acheter plus de matériel comme 4 tonne de ciment; demi tonne du ciment blanc, fers de 10, 90 m3 de sable pour améliorer la qualité de son travail. Il compte fabriquer des buses, des pavés, des latrines turcs en ajoutant des colories et décorations. 

Très entreprenant, il compte acheter du matériel tel moule bétonnière ainsi que former plus des jeunes pour élargir son activité afin de générer plus de revenus, et veut que cela contribue aussi à l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
A man of 47, married, the father of two children aged 18 and 27. He learned masonry and is specialized in fabricating culverts, posts, balustrades, paving stones, latrines for W.C. and bricks. He has given proof of good credit behavior. As the vice-president of a group he also led his group members without difficulty. 

His first and second loans allowed him to buy sand, cement, gravel, rebar, white cement, etc. With his daily sales of 70,000 francs, he would like to move to his third loan and intends to buy more materials: four tons of cement, a half-ton of white cement, rebar and sand to improve the quality of his work. 

He intends to fabricate culverts, paving stones, Turkish toilets, adding coloring and decorations. A very enterprising man, he intends to buy material such as molds for concrete and also to train more young people so that he can expand his business and generate more income. He wants to use this to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy sand, grey cement, and white cement.

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz is married and has two children. His family lives in Bilasuvar, an Internally Displaced Settlement. 

Mubariz has a grocery store and sells food items. His business boasts fresh groceries, reasonable prices, flexible and quality customer service, and uniqueness and variety of merchandise. Mubariz works hard to develop his business and make his business profitable. 

He started with working capital of 200 USD which he borrowed from AqroInvest CU, and another two loans also helped to reach goals and bring him to his current success. Mubariz  is requesting a loan of 1300 AZN to reconstruct and modernize his grocery store to increase turnover and purchase an assortment of goods for retail sale. Mubariz is planning to use the generated profit to remodel his old house. 

Mubariz is a conscientious and focused manager of his resources and always plans his time and finances. In all his business dealings, he is guided by a sense of trust and goodwill towards others, especially toward AqroInvet CU. We believe these qualities will help him repay his loan without any delinquencies.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits génériques (paracetamol, efféralgan, nifluril). Ayaba est mère de 01 enfant. Elle a ouvert  sa boutique en 2008 pour venir en aide aux populations. Ce prêt l’aidera à renforcer son activité. Elle s’approvisionne dans une société de produits génériques.
texts.en: A retailer of generic pharmaceuticals (Paracetamol, Efféralgan, Nifluril), Ayaba is the mother of one child. She opened her shop in 2008 in order to help people. This loan will help her to bolster her business. She is supplied from a generic products company.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Mirdamat

texts.en:
Mirdamat is a single man of 21 years old. He makes a living selling foodstuffs at his grocery store. His location is very good and he serves many customers because he is willing to work more than 12 hours a day. 

Mirdamat has been in this business for three years and knows a good deal about it. He is also very punctual and detail-oriented, character traits that help him in his business. 

Mirdamat can always figure out how much stock he needs so there is enough on hand to meet customer demand yet it is always fresh. Mirdamat has applied for a loan to increase his inventory of items. He will spend the additional income made possible by this loan to improve his living conditions and put aside savings to build his house .

loans.use: to purchase more goods to increase turnover.

loans.name: Arkadi

texts.en:
Arkadi is a 28-year-old farmer from village Poga, Ninotsminda District. He lives with his wife Nozeli, their two sons (9 and 7 years old) and his parents. The children go to school and the rest of the family makes a living working in agriculture. In particular, they have a dairy farm with six cows and two calves and sell approximately 150 kg cheese per month. Along with the dairy, they have a pig farm with six pigs. Piglets are sold seasonally.

 Also in late spring and summer, Arkadi is busy with fishing. He fishes in lakes which are located nearby and sells approximately 100 kg of fish per month. All products are sold in Ninotsminda and Akhalkalaki, towns in the district. Arkadi doesn’t own a car and has to rent one for transportation of products. Renting the car is quite expensive and not cost-efficient. 

With the requested credit Arkadi will purchase a car. He won’t have to rent one anymore and his expenses for transportation will decrease, thus the profit will grow. With the increased income family, their living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to purchase a car for transportation of agricultural products and fish.

loans.name: Juvencio

texts.pt:
nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, vive maritalmente é pai de um menino de 4 anos de idade não vai a Escola. Fez a 11ª classe não concluiu devido a distância que o separa de casa a Escola no periodo da noite. Consegue por mês poupar 500.00mt 

Aproxima se a Hluvuku solicitando empréstimos para dar continuidade da obra. é funcionario permanente na Escola Secundária da Namaacha ha mais de 8 anos trabalha como Assistente Tecnico auferindo mensalmente 2.969.40mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa, mas também conta com ajuda da sua esposa que é funcionaria da água da Namaacha. 

Ja teve empréstimo no BIM. Este é seu quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, blocos e barrotes) para ampliação da sua sala devido ao espaço que é menor. Os anteriores de (5.000.00, 6.000.00 e 6.000.00)mt para habitação.

Tem como objectivo continuar com os estudos e formar se proficionalmente, pretende pagar antes do tempo previsto para aceder a outros créditos no futuro.
texts.en:
Juvencio was born in the Namaacha district of Maputo province,  in southern Mozambique.  He is married and the father of a 4 year old, who is not going to school.  He went to school until 11th grade but could not finish due to the distance from his home to school in the evening. He manages to save 500.00mt a month.

He has approached Hluvuku requesting a loan to continue his home improvements.  He is a permanent employee of the Namaacha school, and has been for over 8 years. Working as an assistant coach, he earns 2.969.40mt monthly, which he applies to household expenses. He also relies on his wife's help from her job as a public water worker in Namaacha.   

He already has a loan from BIM. This is his fourth loan from Hluvuku in the amount of 15.000.00mt, with which he will buy construction materials (cement, bricks and beams) to expand his living room as the space currently is very small.  His previous loans of 5,000.00, 6,000.00 and 6,000.00mt, respectively were also for his house.   

Juvencio has the intention of continuing his studies and professional training and wants to repay his loan ahead of time in order to request loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, bricks and beams)

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Mère de 02enfants, Ama réside à Avédji lieu où elle exerce son activité (vente de la tomate, du riz, huile végétale). Elle achète au Grand Marché. C’est une ancienne cliente de WAGES  mais elle est à son premier crédit. Elle veut assurer un avenir radieux à ses enfants et aider son mari qui est comptable financier.  Elle a une ambition avoir une boutique pour exposer ses produits, et plus tard  faire du commerce IMPORT- EXPORT. Elle a démarré en 2003.
texts.en: The mother of two children, Ama resides in Avédji, where she has a business selling tomatoes, rice, and vegetable oil. She makes her purchases at the Grand Market. Ama is a previous client of WAGES, but she is on her first loan. She wants to ensure a brilliant future for her children and to help her husband, who is an accountant. Her ambition is to have a boutique for displaying her products and, later on, to have an import-export business. She started off in 2003.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa a 46 ans et mère de 02 enfants. Elle achète des habits (l’activité qu’elle exerce) au marché de Hédzranawoé et revend de façon ambulante à ses différents clients depuis 2009. Ce second prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 02 bals de friperie.
texts.en: Kossiwa is 46 years old and the mother of two children. She has been purchasing items of clothing (the business she operates) at the Hédzranawoé market since 2009 and re-selling them door-to-door to her various customers. This second loan she is requesting will enable her to buy two bales of second-hand clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Ivunamba Development Group

texts.en:
41-year-old Gorreti says the nine years she has spent in her greengrocery business in Jinja have been years of hard work, perseverance, determination and reflection. She says laying to heart the different experiences that have come with running this business has been momentous. In a nutshell, she says reflecting on her chequered experiences has helped her plan for her business in a more systematic and organized manner.
