Mr. Arcenio is from Paraguay, single, and 24 years old.  He lives in a rented house in the city of Curuguaty where he has a workshop named "Taller de motos Rubinho".  It is located in the Centro neighborhood, on Eusebio Ayala street, next to Super Tigre.

He worked in the R.D. motorcycle workshop for five years where he gained a lot of experience that he now puts to use in his own motorcycle workshop.  He started his business with the help of his parents in 2009, in the same location where he is now.

He has more than seven years' experience in this sector and has a set customer base, and a busy shop because of its location near the Banco Nacional de Fomento and several busy commercial firms.

loans.use: To buy repair parts and tools.

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es: Lisbeth es una joven madre de familia, natural de la zona rural de Huancayo que en la actualidad vive en casa de un familiar  con su pequeño hijo. Hace 1 año decidió tener su negocio de venta de helados que elabora en su misma casa, con ayuda de su nevera que adquirió  con unos ahorros que disponía, fruto de sus trabajos anteriores. Desde entonces aprovecha cada época de verano, donde tiene mayores ventas. Actualmente ha mejorado la calidad de sus helados, y eso le ha generado más ventas, asimismo produce chupetes de crema y de hielo porque ha visto que hay mayor preferencia de su clientes por estos productos. Sus principales consumidores son los escolares de los distintos centros educativos. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito con MFP,  la cual considera que es de suma importancia para el crecimiento de su negocio, con ello espera mejorar sus implementos y herramientas de trabajo. Es por ello que espera la colaboración de todos ustedes. Por esta razón el dinero lo invertirá en la reparación y mantenimiento de su nevera.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is a young mother from the rural area of Huancayo and she currently lives with a relative together with her young son.  A year ago she decided to set up a business selling home-made icecream.  She bought a refrigerator with the savings she had from previous jobs.  Since then she takes advantage of the summer season for high volume sales.  She has been in the process of improving the quality of her icecream and this has generated more sales.  She also makes cream popsicles since these are preferred by her customers.

Her main consumers are the students from the schools in the area.  This is her first loan through MFP and she feels it is very important for her business growth.  She hopes to improve her work supplies and equipment and is counting on your support.  She plans to use the loan to repair and maintain her refrigerator.

loans.use: To send her refrigerator to a mechanic for repair.

loans.name: Carmen Leonor

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 38 años de edad, ella es soltera y no tiene hijos, ella vive en casa de la madre la cual está ubicada en una zona rural del distrito de Túcume, su vivienda  cuenta con servicios de agua y luz y el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 300  familias.

Carmen se dedica a la a criar y a vender animales menores, esta actividad la realiza desde hace varios años, su negocio esta situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección este negocio, para el cual tiene corrales amplios donde cría sus cerdos. A demás cuenta con ingresos extras de sus producción y venta chicha (producto oriundo del Perú, preparada en base a maíz y jora).   

Carmen está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para invertir en compra de aves menores para engorde, alimento balanceado para aves y cerdos.

Carmen es una persona tranquila, las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Carmen is 38 years old, single, and has no children. She lives at her mother’s house, which is located in the rural section of the District of Túcume. Her home has water and electricity services. The place where she lives is a small community with approximately 300 families.

Carmen raises and sells small animals. She has been in this business for several years. Carmen operates her business from home and learned this trade from her parents. She is known for being a perfectionist in her business and has ample space for raising pigs. To earn extra income, Carmen prepares and sells “chicha” (a Peruvian beverage made from corn and maize).

Carmen is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that she can invest in poultry to fatten and balanced feed for her chickens and pigs.

Carmen is a peaceful individual. The people who know her consider her to be an enterprising person who has great desire to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and feed for her chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Jose Neftali

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta de accesorios eléctricos, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 15, 12 y 9 años de edad, tiene casa propia, y administra el negocio desde hace 8 años, lo heredo de un tío quien le enseño a realizar el trabajo. 
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales eléctricos, como cables de todo tamaño con estradas y salidas, tomas de corriente, y más productos que son necesarios para él, con esta inversión estará cumpliendo con uno de sus objetivos que es surtir el negocio y ser competente.
El segundo objetivo es atraer a clientes, ofreciéndole lo mejor en electrónica y de esta manera mejorar su condición de  vida.
texts.en:
Jose sells electrical accessories.  He lives with his wife and three children, ages 15, 12 and 9, in his own house.  For eight years he has been managing the business that he inherited from his uncle who taught him the trade.

He is requesting a loan to buy electrical materials such as cables in assorted sizes and with different connectors, electrical plugs and other products he needs.  With this investment he will be meeting one of his goals of stocking his business to be competitive.  His second goal is to attract customers by offering them the best in electronics, so he can improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy electrical materials such as cables in assorted sizes and different connectors.

loans.name: 28 De Noviembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “28 DE NOVIEMBRE” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la señora  Alison.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción, cultivo, venta de comida y servicios
 
La señora Alison indica que es la primera vez que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que aprendió de su familia.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra de mercadería (compra de fideo, arroz, aceite, etc.) insumos que utilizará para la elaboración de la comida, que posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto de la ceja. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.
texts.en:
The '28 de Noviembre' community bank is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of executives which is led by Alison.  The businesses that the members of the bank carry out are varied and include: commerce, production, farming, selling meals, and services. 

Alison tells us that this is the first time she has belonged to a Pro Mujer community bank and she joined through an invitation from a friend.  She currently has a business selling food which is something she learned from her family.

Alison will use her loan to buy merchandise (noodles, rice, oil, etc.) which she will use to make her food that she will then sell on her stall in La Ceja.  This work enables Alison to make money with which to support her family.  She lives with her common-law husband and has three children.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Benno Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benno est créé en Septembre 2007  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 23 femmes qui toutes issues du même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou  (assise en cinquième  position de la  gauche vers la droite) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 42 ans, est mariée et mère de 05 enfants.

Elle vend des légumes activité qu’elle pratique depuis  1997.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter des légumes pour la revente.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner  et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Benno group was created in September 2007, on the same day that the Banc Vaillageois was inaugurated. The group is made up of 23 women, all from the same neighborhood. Their main activity is small-scale retail. 

Mrs. Fatou (seated, 5th from the left) is the group's leader. She is 42, married and the mother of 5 children. She has been selling vegetables since 1997. With this loan, she plans to buy vegetables for resale. Profit from this business will allow her to save, and to help her husband in paying for schooling for the children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 54 años D. edad, no tiene  hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, junto a su hija la cual trabaja. Su domicilio esta ubicado en el en distrito D. Cata-cos en el departamento D. Piura, al norte del Perú

Julia cuenta con una pequeña bodega en su vivienda, allí ofrece en venta a sus clientes y vecinos diversos productos D. primera necesidad, así como también la venta D. cerveza. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, es decir cuenta con clientela fija. Esta actividad la realiza desD. hace aproximadamente 4años, realizándola D. lunes a domingos, conoce a la perfección el rubro.

Julia está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles  para comprar  mercadería. Julia  podrá  satisfacer su demanda D. clientes ya que en los últimos meses se ha incrementado.

Julia desea  incrementar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos, espera hacerse más conocida a través D. su trabajo y esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Julia is 54 years old and has no children under her care. She lives in her own home and works with her daughter. Her house is located in the District of Cata-cos in the Department of Piura, in northern Peru.

Julia has a store in her home where she offers her customers and neighbors different products of basic necessity. She also sells beer. This business has been well-received and has accumulated an established customer base. Julia has been in business for approximately four years and operates her store from Monday through Sunday. She is known for being a perfectionist in her work.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 so that she can buy merchandise. Julia wants to satisfy the demand from her customers since it has increased in recent months. She hopes to increase her sales and generate more income. As a result of her work and effort, Julia hopes to become better-known.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, sugar, noodles, etc. for her grocery store

loans.name: Ajuntha Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 19 novembre 2009. Le groupe est  constitué de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère sans enfants. Mais elle à la charge de trois enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de Fruits. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle  pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement des enfants qui lui sont confiés) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The solidarity group was set up on 19th November 2009 and is made up of eleven women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is small-scale trading.

Mariama, who is on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is in charge of the group. She is 53 years old, married and is a mother, though she has no children of her own. She has three other children entrusted to her by her relatives.

She sells fruit and is very experienced in this field as she has been carrying it out for several years. This loan will enable her to strengthen her capital and build up her business. The profit she makes will enable her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.) and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: La señora Olga tiene 2 hijos  menores D. edad,   su negocio es la venta y cultivo D. flores  desD.  hace 5 años  también se  dedica a la elaboración D.  bordados D. blusas y  tejidos D. güipiles   necesita un crédito para la inversión  D. flores  que son los respaldos  D. los arreglos floreales   y ahora en el mes del D. mayo  ella tiene bastante demanda en sus ventas, también se va a dedicar a la venta D. arreglos   en su casa  y D. algunos pedidos, otra parte del crédito lo va invertir en la compra D. hilos   para los güipiles que realiza    y para  la compra D. telas para bordar  su mayor deseo es poder sacar a delante  a sus hijos  y poder cultivar mas flores como la compra D. una bomba para su cultivo.
texts.en:
Sra. Olga has two young children. For the past five years, she has managed a business of growing and selling flowers. She also makes embroidered blouses and woven skirts. Olga needs a loan to invest in flowers for making floral arrangements. She has plenty of demand for her products in the month of May, so she plans to sell arrangements at home and from a few orders. Part of her loan will be invested in the purchase of thread for making skirts and fabrics for her embroideries.

Her greatest wishes incluD. moving her children forward, cultivating more flowers, and purchasing a water pump for her flower business.

loans.use: to purchase thread for weaving, fabrics for embroidering, and flowers for floral arrangements.

loans.name: Maria Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros tiene  29 años de edad, ella es soltera y sin hijos, vive con sus padres, dicha vivienda la casa está ubicada en el caserío Wiracocha  en el distrito de Tambogrande en  Piura. Milagros vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y no cuenta con servicios básicos.

Milagros Se dedica a trabajar vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo, ella vende estos productos entre sus vecinos y amistades, diariamente se esfuerza por captar más clientes ya que mientras más pedidos realice la empresa que le provee de productos le otorga mayores ingresos. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar a sus padres en el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar.

Milagros  desea ampliar su negocio con la instalación de un puesto de venta de productos cosméticos en su domicilio, así sus clientes tendrán productos al alcance de la mano y no tendrán que esperar a fin de mes que es cuando llega el pedido, para ello necesita adquirir más productos y para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Milagros is 29 years old, single, and does not have children. She lives at her parents’ house which is located in the village of Wiracocha in the District of Tambogrande, Piura. Milagros lives in the rural part of the district and does not receive basic services.

She sells cosmetics through catalogs. Milagros sells these products to her neighbors and friends. Every day she strives to attract more customers and generate more orders for her products so that she can earn a better income. This business helps her with covering her personal expenses and assisting her parents with the household finances.

Milagros wants to expand her business by establishing a retail outlet for selling cosmetics out of her home. Her customers will be able to view the products she has on hand and not have to wait as long as a month before receiving their orders. In order to do this, she needs to acquire more products. To accomplish this goal, Milagros is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics so that she can set up a shop in her home.

loans.name: Luzlinda

texts.es:
Luzlinda  tiene 30 años  ella vive con su esposo y su  menor hijo en casa propia en un sector perteneciente al distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz apocos minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo en el departamento de Lambayeque.

Luzlinda cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su propio domicilio, este negocio es atendido por ella misma. Allí ofrece en venta a sus clientes de la zona diversos productos comestibles como golosinas y gaseosas, entre otros productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, con esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Luzlinda ha venido experimentando una fuerte demanda en su negocio, debido a esto ella piensa  ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles, para lograr sus objetivos

Luzlinda es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por los pobladores de la zona en donde reside. Las personas que le conocen la consideran alguien tranquila y bastante responsable.
texts.en:
Luzlinda is 30 years old. She lives with her husband and her youngest child in their own home, located in a neighborhood within the district of José Leonardo Ortiz just a few minutes from the city of Chiclayo in the department of Lambayeque.

Luzlinda owns a small grocery store situated in her home. She attends to the store herself. At the store she offers her local customers an array of food products like sweets and sodas among other basics needs items and groceries. The business is very well received and through the business she helps her husband to financially support their family.

Luzlinda has experienced a lot of demand at her business and therefore she is thinking about expanding her business by acquiring more products. That is why she thought it was a good idea to request a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to achieve her goals.

Luzlinda is very well known and respected by the residents of the area she lives in. The people who know her consider her to be quiet and very responsible.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise to offer to her customers.

loans.name: New Hope Solidarity Group

texts.en: The New Hope Solidarity Group is composed of three members from the city of Ibarra, Ecuador. Elizabeth, Consuelo, and Cristian are the members of the group. Elizabeth, 20, is the president of the group. She is married and lives with her husband and one-year-old daughter in Ibarra. She describes herself as an agricultural person and she takes care of her animals from her home. She started her business with only one pig and has already acquired two more. She is requesting this loan to grow her pig-raising business. Elizabeth believes this loan will help her very much in her goal to increase her business. In the future, she wants her to help her family with their costs of living and continue to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs for her pig-raising business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luz  Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNITA DE BELEN CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ccorao, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella junto con su hermana venden artesanía en la ciudad de Cusco en un centro artesanal, la socia también trabaja como profesora del nivel primario en la provincia de Paucartambo,por medio de este negocio y este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere terminar de construir su casa y mejorar el negocio de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena y yeso.
                                                           
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the "Reynita de Belen Ccorao" community bank which is located in Ccorao district, in Cusco province and department.

Luz Marina is 35 years old, single, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling handicrafts.  Together with her sister, she sells handicrafts in a craft center in the city of Cusco.  She also works as an elementary school teacher in Paucartambo province.  Through her business and her job, Luz Marina gets her children ahead in life.

Luz Marina would like to finish building her house and also improve her handicrafts business.  She is requesting this loan to buy construction supplies such as cement, sand and plaster.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies such as cement, sand and plaster

loans.name: Constantino

texts.es: Constantino D. 59 años convive con Leonarda D. 48 años con quien tiene 6 hijos, juntos  residen en el centro poblado D. Canayre ubicado en L. majestuosa selva ayacuchana donD. tienen su casa propia. A pesar D. no tener una profesión, los conocimientos lo adquirió con los años D. experiencia, por algo ya lleva casi 45 años en L.  actividad agrícoL., donD. aprendió las técnicas D. cosecha y post cosecha y el manejo agronómico y esto es gracias a sus padres y por tal los agradece eternamente. Actualmente cultiva y comercializa cacao y café a los grandes mayoristas, negocio que le esta dando buenos resultados económicos, pero sabe que aún hay por continuar explotando en este negocio. Generalmente el trabaja por cuenta propia durante 12 horas diarias, pero en ocasiones recibe L. ayuda D. sus familiares. Sus planes a futuro es D. aperturar una tienda D. abarrotes, con el propósito D. tener una ventaja competitiva con respecto a las demás comerciantes, además D. aplicar estrategias D. venta como ofrecer productos D. calidad a un bajo precio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que el se compromete a ser puntual en el pago D. sus cuotas. Constantino se siente a gusto con el trabajo D. su banco comunal ya que todos lo acogieron con mucha cordialidad. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles, Constantino desea invertir en su siguiente siembra, por ello va a fertilizar y arar L. tierra.
texts.en:
Constantino is 59 years old and lives with his partner, 48 year-old Leonarda.  The couple have six children and live together in their own home, in the village of Canayre, which is located in the majestic Ayacucho jungle.

In spite of not having a profession, Constantino has gained knowledge through years of experience.  He has been farming for almost 45 years now.  He learned how to manage his crops, harvest his crops and deal with them once harvested from his parents and for this he is eternally grateful to them.  Constantino currently grows and sells cacao and coffee to big wholesalers.  His business is providing him with good financial results but he knows that there is always still work to be done in this business.  Generally, Constantino works by himself for 12 hours a day but sometimes he receives help from his family members.  His plan for the future is to open a grocery store with the aim of having a competitive advantage over the other store owners, applying sales strategies such as offering good-quality products at a low price. 

This is Constantino's first loan from MFP and he pledges to be punctual in making his repayments.  He feels happy with the work of his community bank since they all welcomed him with a lot of warmth.  Constantino would like to invest his 1,000 Peruvian soles in his upcoming sowing season when he will fertilize and plow the earth.

loans.use: to buy manure to fertilize his land

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
MARGARITA
Quien se dedica  desde hace 8 años a la venta de producto medicinal de forma natural el cual es muy consumido por las personas, ha sido muy activa  y mayorista en este negocio por la cual ella promueve a otras personas para ser vendedoras de este producto con lo que ella manifiesta le es de gran ayuda para el apoyo a su familia. Ella se siente muy alegre ya que ha tenido la oportunidad de recibir capacitaciones que la  ayudan como mujer y pequeña empresaria y madre de sus hijos
Su anhelo es seguir trabajando y prepara un camino mejor para sus hijos.
esta solicitando este credito para la compra de medicina natural.
texts.en:
Margarita has been selling natural medicinal products for eight years. These products are widely consumed by many people. She has been very active as a wholesale merchant since she also recruits other people to become sales representatives of this product. Margarita says that this business has been a great help in supporting her family. She feels very pleased with the opportunity to receive training that helps her as a woman, a small business owner, and a mother.

Her wish is to continue working so that she can prepare a better path for her children. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy natural medicines.

loans.use: to purchase natural medicines.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Primitiva; tiene 34 años de edad; la socia es casada tiene 5 hijos y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar; la socia se dedica a la venta de adobe, ella tiene a su cargo la elaboración de adobes y la socia contrata peones para la elaboración a base de barro, agua, arcilla y paja los adobes para la contruccion de diferentes casas, la socia se encarga de hacer las contrataciones y de vender. La socia desea el crédito para la compra de materiales y pago a sus peones; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de adobes.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Primitiva is a member of the "Sr. de Tayancani" community bank.  She lives in Ocongate district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Primitiva is 34 years old, married, and has five children.  She divides her time between her household activities and her business selling adobe bricks.  She is in charge of the adobe making and hires laborers to make the adobe bricks from mud, water, clay and straw.  They are used in making houses.  Primitiva is in charge of hiring workers and selling her products.  She would like this loan to buy materials and pay her laborers.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying materials for making adobe bricks.

Primitiva appreciates the loan that she has been granted and is infinitely grateful for it as it will enable her to grow her business and improve her quality of life.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying materials for making adobe bricks

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es: Feliciana de 42 años convive co Roberto de 47 años, juntos tienen 2 hijos, Jonatan de 22 años, Yeison de 7 años; ellos viven en su casa propia en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Feliciana desde muy niña siempre estuvo inquieta, no le gustaba estar sin hacer nada, ella cuanta oportunidad se presentaba los ayudaba a sus padres en los quehaceres de su hogar. Desde hace 25 años se dedica en la venta de ropa, para todo público en general. Recuerda que en su primer año le fue difícil, en el  segundo año se empezó a nivelar, después de los años siguientes fue muy bendecida, por que sus ventas se incrementaban. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia. Para el futuro espera ampliar su tienda con la finalidad de posicionarse en el mercado. Este será su primer empréstito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles desea adquirir más prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Feliciana is 42 years old and lives with her partner, 47 year-old Roberto.  They have two children: 22 year-old Jonatan and 7 year-old Yeison.  The family live in their own home in the village of Canayre, in Llochegua district.  Feliciana has always been restless since she was a little girl; she never liked sitting around not doing anything.  When the opportunity presented itself, she would help her parents with their household chores.

For 25 years now, Feliciana has been selling clothes to the general public.  She recalls that her first year was difficult, in her second year she started to get things on an even keel and from then on she was very blessed because her sales increased.  In general, she works on her own but she sometimes receives help from her family.  In the future, she hopes to expand her store with the goal of positioning herself in the market.

This will be Feliciana's first loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual in making her repayments.  She would like to use the 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy more clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia y un hijo de un año de edad, él administra una tienda, desde hace dos años, vende productos como arroz, frijoles, pan, huevos, condimentos, boquitas, con sus vecinos y amigos, su horario es de 6:00am a 7:00pm., este negocio lo tiene en su casa.
Él solicita un préstamo, para la compra de productos de primera necesidad, como embutidos, galletas, pollo, azúcar, sal, papel Higiénico, esta inversión le ayudara a tener fortalecido su negocio, a contar con productos que son muy necesarios para sus clientes.
Para José, su propósito es crecer en el negocio, ya que de este obtiene todos los ingresos que le permiten alimentar a su familia, y lograr mejores condiciones económicas a su esposa y su hijo.
texts.en: Jose lives with his 1yr old child and his family.  He has been running a store for 2 years, there he sells products such as: rice, beans, bread, eggs, condiments, and snacks to his friends and neighbors.  His working hours are from 6AM - 7PM; this business has him working from home.  He is soliciting this loan to purchase necessary products like: sausage, cookies, chicken, sugar, salt, and toilet paper.  Such an investment would help him keep a stronghold on his business by being able to rely on products that are very necessary for his clients.  Jose's objective is to grow the business since this is where he obtains the income necessary to feed his family and also improve his wife and kid's economic condition.

loans.use: To purchase sausage, cookies, chicken, sugar, salt, and toilet paper

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
For four years now, Juliana has been married to a mason and together they have six dependants. She has been through senior high school. 
Juliana cooks wakye at a village called Tayido near Abura. Her income is used to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. The loan, when received, will be used to purchase rice, beans and other ingredients to prepare wakye to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Juliana plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans and other ingredients to prepare wakye to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
TERESA
Esta socia quien es una pequeña comerciante, se dedica  a la venta de producto medicinal natural muy conocida de la empresa OMNILIFE, desde ya hace 8 años, ella manifiesta que gracias a este negocio ha podido salir adelante en la educación y mantención de sus 6 hijos, ya que hace varios años su esposo abandono su familia, pero se ha esforzado bastante y ha contado con  la ayuda de FAPE. Para  la compra de sus productos. Hace poco empezó con otra actividad que es la destaza de pollo con la que obtiene un ingreso mas para sus hijos, a quienes les brinda educación y les desea sean personas preparadas para el futuro ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de medicina natural.
texts.en:
Teresa is a small businesswoman who sells a well-known brand of natural medicinal products made by OMNILIFE. She has been in business for eight years. Thanks to this venture, Teresa says that she has been able to get ahead so that she can support her six children and provide them with an education. Several years ago her husband abandoned the family, but she has strived to move forward with the help from FAPE by being able to buy her products.

Just recently, Teresa started another business butchering chickens so that she could earn additional income for her children. She wants to provide them an education so that they can be prepared for the future. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy natural medicines.

loans.use: to purchase natural medicines.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 39 años de edad, ella tiene 03 hijos bajo su responsabilidad.  Ella vive cerca de la casa de sus padres en el distrito de Reque, a 20 minutos dela ciudad de Chiclayo. La zona donde vive es rural y la actividad principal es la agricultura, seguido de la ganadería.

Santos se dedica a la venta de leche  el cual se encarga de venderla a los pobladores de la zona y en mercados pues ella cuenta con varios años de experiencia en este negocio, esta actividad le genera buenos ingresos y además la realiza desde de su casa.

Santos está solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales(vacas) para la cría y producción de leche. 

Santos es una persona  hogareña y estimada por las personas que la conocen la describen como un persona amable y trabajadora en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Santos is 39 years old and she is responsible for three children. She lives close to her parents’ house in the district of Reque, 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. The region where she lives is rural and her principle activity is agriculture, followed by animal husbandry.

Santos sells milk for a living. she sees to the sale of the milk to the residents in the area and in markets. She has several years of experience in this business. This business generates a good income for her, plus she runs the business from her house.

Santos is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals (cows) for breeding and milk production.

Santos is a home-loving person and is respected by the people that know her. They describe her as friendly and hard-working in her community.

loans.use: to buy more cows for milk production.

loans.name: Karina Lizzette

texts.es:
Karina, vive con su esposo, no tienen hijos, viven en familia, su negocio es la venta de ropa y oro, visita distintas zonas, cantones y pueblos, cercanos, ofreciendo su mercadería y comprando oro para la reventa.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa, adquiriendo blusas, faldas, pantalones, con esta mercadería su negocio estará surtido, para ofrecer nuevos estilos y modas a los clientes, generando más ganancias.
El sueño de ella es algún día comprarse su propia casa, donde vivir con su esposo y en un futuro tener sus hijos.
texts.en:
Karina lives with her husband. They have no children and live with family. Her business is selling clothes and gold. She goes to different areas, cantons and towns nearby offering her merchandise and buying gold to re-sell.

She is asking for a loan to buy clothes and acquire blouses, skirts, and pants. With this merchandise, her business will be supplied to offer new styles and fashions to her customers, generating more income.

Her dream is to one day buy her own house where she can live with her husband and in the future have children.

loans.use: to buy clothes: blouses, skirts and pants.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells children's wear, omo (detergent) and soaps in Abura, which she has done for 10 years. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. She has received a junior high education. Ama uses her income to support her husband in paying utility bills and other household expenses. 

Ama will use the loan to buy more soap for resale. Her future plan is to plow her profit back into the business for further increase.

loans.use: to buy more soap for resale.

loans.name: Musa E.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the Kakajama Technical Vocational Institute, based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of SLL 5,000,000 to meet their various personal financial needs. Some of them will invest their loans in businesses, some will use their loan to pay school fees for their children, others will buy house building materials and some will buy pieces of furniture such as a bed or chairs. 

Musa is a school teacher and leader of this group. Fifty-five-year-old Musa was born in Kenema; he is married with 3 children – 1 in primary school and 2 in nursery school. Musa has been in the teaching profession for 15 years now. He has requested this loan to invest in his wife’s business. His wife has been selling clothes for 3 years.

loans.use: to invest in his wife’s clothes selling business

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has four children. Ekua cooks banku, which is made from corn, at Abura. She serves the banku with fried fish and hot pepper sauce. The income she makes from her sales is used to assist her husband to feed, clothe and educate her children. Ekua will add the loan to her capital to buy additional bags of corn as the price of maize keep increasing. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save towards building a food joint.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of corn as the price keeps increasing.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 40 years old and is married with 2 children aged 15 and 12. He runs a building material store in Kissy, a neighborhood in Freetown.

Ali has been in this business for 10 years and sells paints, cement, nails and brushes at his store. He also earns income from another business (taxi transport). He says that the main challenge to his business is inflation.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cement, saws, binding wire, metal pans and nails. Ali says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his standard of living. In the future, he would like to build big shops and make his business well-established.

loans.use: To purchases more cement, saws, binding wire and metal pans

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a hairdresser. She also sells cosmetics at Abura. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a mason. As part of her responsibilities, she helps her husband to educate her child. Her loan will allow her to buy more hair products and cosmetics to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more hair products and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí de 30 años de edad convive con Amílcar  de 25 años, y juntos tienen 2 hermosos hijos, Nadin de 10 y Naomi de 3 meses de nacido. Esta familia vive en una casa alquilada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de llochegua en la majestuosidad de la selva ayacuchana. Perseverante y trabajadora, cuando era niña sus padres querían que solo se dedicase a los estudios. Hoy al tener su familia, sabe que necesita de más entrada económica para salir adelante, es por ello que ha logrado abrir una tienda de abarrotes. Lleva 4 años en este negocio, y hasta el momento le ha sido muy rentable, por otro lado también cultiva cacao, pero en pequeñas parcelas, para generar ingresos extras. Generalmente trabaja sola, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposo, ya que le ayuda en la comercialización de cacao en la misma comunidad. En el futuro espera comprar terrenos para cultivar diferentes productos y en grandes volúmenes. Por tal razón Noemí  recurre a MFP a solicitar su primer crédito por lo que ella se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Por ello pide la colaboración de ustedes para que pueda salir adelante. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles Noemí comprará mas productos para implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Noemí is 30 years old and lives with her partner, 25 year-old Amílcar.  They have two beautiful children: 10 year-old Nadin and 3 month-old Naomi.  The family live in a rental house in the village of Canayre, in Llochegua district, in the majestic Ayacucho jungle.

Noemí is persistent and hard working.  When she was a little girl her parents wanted her to concentrate only on her studies.  Now she has her own family and she knows that she needs more income in order to get ahead in life.  For this reason, she opened a grocery store.  She has been in this business for four years and, up to now, it has been very profitable.  Noemí also grows cacao, on small plots of land, in order to make extra income.  She generally works alone but occasionally she receives help from her husband who helps her to sell the cacao in their community.

In the future, Noemí hopes to buy land so that she can grow different crops in large volumes.  For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from MFP and pledges to be punctual in making her repayments.  She is requesting your cooperation so that she can get ahead.  Noemí will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy more products with which to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is divorced and currently taking care of a child. She operates a food joint where she cooks food like banku with okra stew, rice with stew and fufu with soup. Ekua wants to increase the quantity of food cooked so she needs a loan from Kiva to buy more ingredients. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to build a better place where people can come and eat.

loans.use: to buy more food stuffs to cook to sell.

loans.name: Moises Arahon

texts.es:
Moisés, es casado, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 15, 17 y 21 años de edad, él es agricultor, se dedica a sembrar maíz y frijol, desde hace 20 años, él trabajo lo aprendió de su padre, y todos los días realiza labores que demanda la agricultura de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para comprar abono, fertilizantes, e insecticidas, estos materiales son para iniciar la siembra de maíz y frijol, esta compra le ayudara a tener todos los insumos, dar un cuido adecuado al cultivo y con la esperanza de recibir una buena cosecha.
Su objetivo es formar académicamente a sus hijos y a través de su trabajo, también dar el sustento necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Moisés is married and lives with his wife and three children aged 15, 17 and 21.  He is a farmer who has been growing corn and beans for 20 years.  He learned this work from his father and he carries out his farming work every day, from 6.00am to 3.00pm.

Moisés is requesting this loan to buy manure, fertilizers and insecticides.  He will use these materials when he starts sowing his corn and beans.  This purchase will help him to have available all the supplies he needs.  He will be able to care properly for his crops and hopefully enjoy a good harvest.

Moisés' goal is for his children to receive an education and, through his work, to support his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is divorced and has one child. She buys fish from the market and then cleans and smokes it for resale. Her income is used to see to the well-being of the home. Hannah will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to save towards the education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is divorced and has 2 children. She sells kenkey and fish at Abura, and has done so for five years. Ama uses her income to pay for her children's school fees and utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase maize to prepare kenkey and fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to invest in her children's education. In this picture she is standing close to the oven she uses to smoke the fish.

loans.use: to purchase maize to prepare kenkey and fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan Alberto tiene más de 6 años en su negocio, por lo que se siente muy independiente al obtener este medio de ingreso. Su negocio es la venta de medicamentos naturales, pues tiene una gran variedad de clientes que le solicitan diferentes pedidos de medicamentos, el vive en el municipio de la Virgen en donde la mayoría de sus clientes saben que el precio de sus medicamentos son muy favorables. Con este crédito el comprara vitaminas, suplementos, pastillas, pomadas, inyecciones entre otros productos que le solicitan.
texts.en: Juan Alberto has been in his business for more than six years and so feels very independent with his way of earning a living.  His business is selling natural medicines.  He has a wide range of customers who make orders with him for different medicines.  Juan Alberto lives in the village of La Virgen, where most of his customers know that the prices of his medicines are very good.  He will use this loan to buy vitamins, supplements, pills, ointments, injections and other products that people are requesting.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, supplements, pills, ointments and injections

loans.name: Kuuwa

texts.en:
Kuuwa bakes bread, pie and other food in Abura. She is married and has four children. Kuuwa has been selling bread for five years. She helps her husband to take care of the home. 

Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake products for sale. Kuuwa hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake products for sale

loans.name: Mohamed's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you teachers of the Integrated Primary School, based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Teachers and workers of various institutions usually apply for loans from SMT/Kiva lenders. At the end of each month, the bursar or person in charge of paying salaries in the institution will deduct the borrowers’ monthly repayment and pay SMT on their behalf. 

This is the first loan that workers of this school have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. They have requested a loan of SLL 5,000,000. With the help of this loan, these borrowers are in a strong position to buy or invest in something that their mere salaries can not let them do.

Mohamed is the leader of the group. He is age 27. Mohamed was born in a village called Gbatoma, about 58 miles from Kenema. Mohamed is married to a housewife and has one child who is not of school-going age. Mohamed has requested a loan of SLL 1,000,000. With the help of this loan, he will buy house-building materials like iron corrugated zincs, nails, boards, etc.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron corrugated zincs, nails, boards, etc.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells tubers of yams, onions and watermelons. She is single. She wishes to increase the quantity of yams, onions and watermelon sales. A loan of 1,000 GHS will help a lot.  Aba uses her income to pay utility bills. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to invest in the sale of other fruits.

loans.use: to purchase more yams, onions and watermelons to sell

loans.name: Iruguincho Group

texts.en: Luis, Maria Angelita and Anita are the members of Iruguincho Group located near the city of Ibarra in northern Ecuador. Luis, 22, is the group leader. He is single and lives with his family. He has one son who is three -years-old. He is a hard-working man who wants to get married soon, have another child, and continue forward with his girlfriend. Luis is a farmer, currently growing beans on his parents' land. He is seeking this loan to grow corn and some more beans. He began his life as a farmer when he finished school. His father and brother brought him to the country and taught him all they knew about farming. Since then, he has dedicated himself to farming and still works alongside his father. He hopes that this loan will help change his business, his life, and the life of his family. With hard work everyday, he has hopes to build his own house and get some of his own land. His goal is to live with his family in his own house and hire workers to help him with his farming work.

loans.use: to plant corn and additional bean crops

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Diokeré Endam Group

texts.fr:
le groupement Diokeré Endam a été créé  le 14 mai 2010. Il est composé de 21 membres issus de la meme commune.Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame aminata debout à l’extrême droite est responsable du groupement.Elle est veuve et âgée de 49 ans.
Elle a 08 enfants en charge mais seuls  06 sont ses propres enfants.

Son activité principale est le petit commerce de tissus et des chaussures pour femmes,elle pratique cette activité depuis longtemps ce qui fait qu'elle dispose d'une bonne expérience.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter en stock suffisant de la marchandise tissus et chaussures  pour son commerce.

Son objectif est d' assurer une nourriture abondante à sa progéniture et une bonne santé.
texts.en:
The group Diokeré Endam was founded on May 14, 2010. It has 21 members who are from the same village. They all work together in small business.

Mrs. Aminata, standing on the far right, is the leader of the group. She is a 49 year old widow.
She takes care of eight children of which only six are her own.

Her main business is the sale of fabric and women's shoes. She has a lot of experience in this business.

The loan will allow her to purchase ample fabric and shoes as merchandise for her business.

Her goal is to supply her children with plenty of food and good health.

loans.use: acheter de la marchandise

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 36 años de edad es madre soltera vive junto a su pequeña hija Yadira de 11 años, juntas habitan en una casa alquilada ubicada en el centro poblado de natividad del distrito de Pichari. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de prendas de vestir, negocio que lo emprendió desde muy joven y conjuntamente con las ganas de salir adelante motivaron a que sea comerciantes, con el fin de cubrir las necesidades de su hija. Ella no cuenta con ningún apoyo  ya que el esposo que tuvo la abandono y desde entonces sola aprendió a sobresalir y adquirir todo lo que hasta el momento posee, que es su negocio y su capital. En un futuro muy próximo desea abrir un salón de belleza, pues para esto ella necesita un capital, por tal motivo es que desea recurrir a MFP para solicitar un crédito. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera la cooperación de cada uno de ustedes para establecer su negocio.  Con los 1.000 nuevos soles comprará algunas maquinarias y equipos para emprender y abrir su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Lidia is 36 years old.  She is a single mother and lives with her daughter Yadira who is 11.  They live together in a rental house which is located in the village of Natividad, in Pichari district.

Lidia's business is selling clothes.  She started this business when she was very young.  Her desire to get ahead in life motivated her to become a saleswoman, with the goal of providing for her daughter's needs.  Lidia does not have any support because her husband left her.  Since that time, she has learned to do well and acquired everything that she now owns: her business and her capital.  In the very near future, she would like to open a beauty salon but she needs capital to do this.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from MFP.

This will be Lidia's first loan from MFP and she hopes to receive the cooperation of each and every one of you in helping her establish her business.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy some tools and equipment to set up and open her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment to set up her beauty salon business

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells Fante kenkey (foodstuff made from femented maize dough) at Abura. Her hand is placed on the pot she uses to cook the kenkey. She is divorced and has been producing kenkey for 15 years. She is responsible for the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more maize to prepare kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Reddy Dorione Chardain

texts.fr:
Homme  âgé de 23ans, marié et père de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie de 05ans à 09ans tous scolarisé, par manque des moyens financiers il arrête ses études en classe de 5e et se lance dans la coiffure dames en fin 1997 à son domicile. Son revenu journalier est de 7000frs à 10.000frs.

 Avec ce prêt elle veut renforcer son activité en achetant des produits cosmétiques de coiffure dames comme des démêlants, défrisant, pinces et filets à chignon, mèches, tissages, gel UB et autres produits de première nécessité. 

Il  à pour stratégie de mieux faire son travail avec beaucoup de professionnalisme faire preuve d'un bon accueil et avoir du respect pour ses clients. Avec les bénéfices que son activité vont générées, elle veut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en soutenant ses enfants dans les études. 

Continuer dans cette activité est son souci  majeur, il veut à la longue ouvrir un salon plus moderne avec une salle de soins esthétique afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
Dans son milieu social il est connu parmi les hommes qui se débrouillent.
texts.en:
He is 23 years old, married and the father of three children who are between the ages of five and nine and they are all in school. He dropped out of school in fifth grade because he didn't have enough money. He started a business of doing women's hair at the end of 1997 from his home.  He makes between 7000 frs and 10.000 frs per day.

With this loan he wants to strengthen his business by purchasing essential hair products like detanglers, defrizzers, clips, hairbands, hair extensions, weaves, UB gel and other necessary products.

His strategy is to have a very professional business by properly welcoming and respecting his clients. With the profits generated from the business, he wants to improve his family's living conditions by supporting his children's schooling.

Continuing in this business is his major concern, and in the long term he wants to open a modern salon with treatments rooms to better serve his clients. His friends know him as someone who works hard.

loans.use: to purchase weaving, hair gel, hair extensions, and hair bands

loans.name: Solidario Bethlehem Group

texts.es:
Solidario Bethlehem Este grupo esta formado por Liria D. 28 años D. edad tiene 3 hijos y es casada, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa típica usada, esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. ropa tipica, también esta doña Maria D. 40 años, ella tiene 3 hijos y no tiene esposo porque la abandono, ella venD. ropa típica, además hace bordado y costura que la gente le llega a pedir en su casa desD. hace 15 años ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. ropa tipica. 

La líder del grupo, es doña Marta Alicia ella tiene 5  hijos, y se dedica a la venta D. leña D. pino y encino y también tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, desD. hace 15 años,  ella esta solicitando este nuevo crédito para comprar suficiente leña porque viene el invierno y no se consigue leña seca entonces ella tiene una galera y allí podría almacenar la leña pero la camionada D. leña tiene un precio elevado entonces ella quiere que se le otorgue este crédito para poder tener cuando no haya pero espera que fape pueda apoyarla  y asi tener mas ganancias en su negocio confía que se le pueda brindar el apoyo.
texts.en:
The Bethlehem Solidarity Group consists of the following members:

•	Liria  is 28 years old, married, and has three children.  She sells used traditional clothing.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more traditional clothes.  

•	Doña Maria is 40 years old.  She has three children but no husband since he abandoned her.  Maria sells traditional clothing, but she also embroiders and sews for other people who come to her home to submit orders.  She has been in business for 15 years.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy traditional clothing.

•	Doña Marta Alicia is the group leader.  She has five children.  Marta has a business of selling pine and oak wood.  She also manages a small store in her home.  Marta has been in business for 15 years.  She is requesting a new loan to buy enough wood for the winter season because she is not able to obtain dry wood during that time.  Marta has a storage shed where she can keep the wood, but buying wood by the truckload is expensive.  This is why she is requesting this loan.  She expects FAPE will assist her so that her business can generate more revenue.  Marta is confident of receiving the support.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel  es de la comunidad de la Trinchera, es conocido por ser una persona que le gusta cooperar con la comunidad.
El es agricultor de toda la vida, y ahorita está dedicado únicamente al producto del plátano, es por eso que don Miguel solicita un préstamo de  $200 000 (doscientos mil colones) para la compra de los insumos necesarios para el mantenimiento de su plantación de plátano.
El es socio de La empresa de Crédito Comunal La Trinchera, una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Miguel is from the community of Trinchera.  He is known as being a person who likes to work together with his community.

Miguel has been a farmer his whole life and now he is solely farming bananas.  He is requesting a loan for 200,000 colones to buy the supplies he needs to maintain his banana plantation.

Miguel is a member of the La Trinchera Community Loan Company, one of EDESA's 110 member companies in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his plantation

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Juana de oficio docente con más de veinte años dando clases, oficio que aprendió por vocación. Hoy en día es pensionada, y económicamente apoyada por sus hijos.
Atreves  de la institución ha logrado las mejoras a su vivienda, donde ha venido avanzando poco a poco, durante doce ciclos, con el crédito anterior logro levantar las paredes, y ahora con este nuevo préstamo, hará cambio de techo en la parte de atrás, que lo tiene en mala condiciones por ser ya muy viejo, lo que comprara: laminas de zinc, cuartones, madera, clavos entre otros y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Juana is a teacher by profession and she taught classes for more than twenty years.  She learned the profession as her vocation.  Juana is now retired and financially supported by her children.

Through our institution, Juana has managed to make improvements to her home.  She has been making gradual progress through twelve loan cycles.  She used her previous loan to build some walls and will use this new loan to replace the roof out the back of her home because it is very old and in a bad state of repair.  She will buy sheets of corrugated metal, beams, wood, nails and other products, and start the job.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies such as sheets of corrugated metal, wooden beams and nails so that she can replace her roof out the back of her house

loans.name: Corazon De Estaño Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZON DE ESTAÑO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Adela, está compuesta por nueve integrantes que están dirigida por una mesa directiva, donde la señora Gimena ocupa el cargo de secretaria. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de frutas, venta de hortalizas, tienda de ferreteria, venta de juguetes, tejido y cortes de mantas, tienda de ropa, venta de salchipapa.

La señora Gimena,  indica que es el primer ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer, e ingreso por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas, que inicio hace un año atrás, tejiendo para otras personas, posteriormente ella pensó iniciar su propio negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de lana para el tejido de mantas, los que comprará de la Feria de Alto Lima  y posteriormente elaborados sus productos los venderá a solicitud de una clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The 'Corazón de Estaño' community bank is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela regional office.  The group has nine members who are managed by a board of directors.  Gimena is the board secretary.  The businesses that the ladies carry out are varied and include: selling clothes, selling fruit, selling vegetables, running a hardware store, selling toys, knitting blankets, running a clothes store and selling 'salchipapa' (traditional fast food).

Gimena tells us that this is the first loan cycle that she has participated in with Pro Mujer.  She joined through an invitation.  Gimena currently has a business knitting blankets.  She started the business one year ago.  She used to knit for other people and then decided to start her own business.

Gimena will use this loan to buy yarn for knitting blankets.  She will buy her supplies in the street market in Alto Lima.  When her products are made, she will sell them to customers on request.  This work allows her to make money to support her family.  She is single and has two children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Gimena replied that she likes the training sessions.

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa has been selling soft drinks and bread for 3 years at Abura. She is divorced and has 1 child. She sees to the well-being of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more drinks and to bake bread to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to build a snack bar. She is showing some of the bread she had left.

loans.use: to buy more drinks and to bake bread to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: In the picture above, Efua has displayed some tubers of yam for sale. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a mason. Efua uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Efua will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Rosine

texts.fr:
Femme de 34ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants scolarisés âgée de 02 à 15ans. Elle débute son commerce comme ambulante des mèches au marche en 2001 et grâce à ses épargnes et vend sur une table au marché depuis 2003 avec un capital de 100.000Frs. Ses recettes journalières sont de 30000 à 50000frs. 

Avec ce prêt elle va acheter des variétés de tissage tel que (tissage naturel noble, olive, x-pression, tissage synthétique), des mèches telles que pony, olive, anglaise, afro. 

Elle fait preuve d'une bonne gestion et réserve un bon accueil à ses clients. Elle aimerait effectuer des voyages en Afrique de l'ouest afin d'importer la marchandise. 

Elle aimerait aussi renforcer les conditions de vie de ses enfants en l'offrant une bonne scolarisation et éducation. Elle est encouragée dans son entourage pour les efforts qu'elle fournit et sa motivation dans son commerce.
texts.en:
She is 34 years old, married and the mother of three children in school between the ages of two and fifteen. She started her business of selling hair extensions as a street peddler in 2001. As a result of her savings and selling from a stall in the market, she has capital of 100,000 frs. Her daily revenues are between 30,000 and 50,000 frs. 

With her loan, she is going to purchase a variety of weaves (such as natural noble weave, olive, x-pression and synthetic weaves) and hair extensions (such as pony, olive, English and afro).   

She manages her business well and properly welcomes her clients. 

She also wants to improve her children's living conditions by giving them a good education and upbringing. Her friends encourage her efforts and her motivation for business.

loans.use: to purchase weaves and hair extensions

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells fish and maize in both small and large quantities at Abura in Cape Coast. She is married and has a small boy. Her husband is a mason. She assists her husband to pay utility bills and other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells provisions at Abura. She also fries sweet potatoes for sale (as seen in the picture above). She is divorced and has 2 children. Ekua has been in this business for six years. She sees to the well-being of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more sweet potatoes to fry for sale. She anticipates reinvesting her new profit.

loans.use: to buy more sweet potatoes to fry for sale.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es de la comunidad  La Trinchera, es conocido por ser uno de los mejores constructores de la zona.

Toda su vida se dedico a la construcción, y ahorita sus principales herramientas se han deteriorad muchísimo, y es por eso que solicita un préstamo de  ₡200 000  para la compra de  herramientas para continuar su trabajo y dar un mejor servicio.  El desea mejorar sus condiciones de trabajo y por supuesto  mejorar sus ingresos.

El es  socio de la empresa de crédito Comunal de la Trinchera, una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Eduardo is from the community of La Trinchera.  He is known as being one of the best builders in his area.

Eduardo has been in the building trade all his life and now his main work tools have become very worn.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 200,000 colones to buy tools so that he can continue in his work and provide his customers with a better service.  He would like to improve his working conditions and, of course, improve his income.

Eduardo is a member of the La Trinchera community loan company, one of EDESA's 110 member companies in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy building tools.

loans.name: Andre

texts.fr:
Homme marié de 44ans ayant deux enfants dont l'âge varie entre 03ans et 21ans. Il exerce son activité depuis 1985 et avait commencé avec un capital de dix mille Francs CFA, il est vendeur des sacs de voyages, des sacs scolaires pendant la période scolaires et des sacs à main au marché Total à Bacongo, qui est le plus grand marché de Brazzaville. 

Il va utiliser ce prêt pour l'achat des grands stocks de sacs. Pour la croissance de son activité il est toujours à la recherche des produit de la dernière mode au prix bas ensuite il fait des livraisons et vente au domicile de certain client en dehors de son étalage du marché. 

Ses ambitions s'est d'aller à l'étranger pour s'approvisionner afin d'être grossiste. IL veut aussi que ses enfants fassent des grandes études et qu'ils bénéficient d'un héritage. 

IL est très ouvert et gentil avec son entourage et contribue à l'épanouissement de ses voisins.
texts.en:
He is married, 44 years old and has two children who are three and 21 years old. He has been in business since 1985 and started the business with ten thousand cfa francs. He sells luggage, school backpacks during the school year and handbags at the Total market in Bacongo, which is the largest market in Brazzaville.

He is going to use the loan to buy a large quantity of bags. In order to increase business, he is constantly looking for the latest products at a low price and also makes deliveries to certain clients outside of the market. 

His goal is to go abroad to purchase supplies so that he can be a wholesaler. He also wants his children to attend college and benefit from an inheritance.

He is very open and kind to his staff and has contributed to the success of his neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of bags

loans.name: Ashetu

texts.en: In the picture above Ashetu is in the process of preparing millet porridge for sale. She is married and has three children. Her husband is into carpentry. Ashetu assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more millet to prepare porridge for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more millet to prepare porridge for sale.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Alpha is 40 years old and married with six children between the ages of 6 and 16. He also has five additional dependents who are relatives living with him. He runs a sawmill store in Kissy, a neighborhood of Freetown.
 
He has been in this business for twelve years and sells boards at his store. He also earns income from renting a house and with his saw machine.  His business is doing well.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more boards. Alpha says that the extra income from this loan will help him purchase more goods to sell. In the future, he would like to be a timber supplier and a factory owner.

loans.use: to purchase more boards.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama smokes fish at Abura. She has received a junior high level of education. She is married and has four children.  Her husband is a mason. She responsibly supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children. She is standing close to the traditionally built oven she uses to smoke the fish.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dozens of slippers to add to his business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells cooking utensils at Abura. She is divorced and has one child. Ekua has been in this business for just two years. She sees to the well-being of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more utensils for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more utensils for resale.

loans.name: Minervas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MINERVAS” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Evelin. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio 

La señora Evelin,  indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta material educativo que inicio hace diez años con el apoyo de Pro Mujer.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital de trabajo (compra de material educativo) que comprará de las editoriales y lo venderá en una librería de 8:00 a 18:00. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud.
texts.en:
The 'Minervas' community bank is about to start its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación regional office.  The group has eight members and is managed by a board of directors which is led by Evelin.  The businesses that the members of the bank carry out are varied and include: commerce, production and services.

Evelin tells us that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for ten years.  She joined through an invitation from a friend.  Evelin currently has a business selling educational materials which she started ten years ago with the support of Pro Mujer.

Evelin will use this loan to increase her working capital, buying educational materials from publishers which she will then sell in her store from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  This work enables her to make money with which to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When we asked Evelin what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health training.

loans.use: to buy educational materials

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba sells jewelry at Tayido, a village near Abura in Cape Coast. She is a widow and has 8 children. She feeds, clothes and educates her children. Her loan will be used to buy more jewelry to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is a hairdresser. She sells hair extensions and creams at Abura. Araba has a junior high level of education. Her business is just 2 years old and she needs a loan of 400 to buy more hair products to use on her customers' hair. Her loan will be used to buy more hair extensions for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more hair extensions for sale.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married and has two children. She sells smoked fish at Abura. Her husband is a steel bender. Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for resale. Adjoa plans to plough her increased profits back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and has two children. She sells smoked fish at Abura, which she has done for eight years. Her husband is a driver. Ama uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. The loan will be used to purchase more fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Charita

texts.es: Charita, de 38 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos menores Rutger de 16 y Alith de 14 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio al que Charita se dedica es la venta de cerveza, gaseosa y agua. Su puesto esta ubicado en su misma casa, es así que cada fin de semana procura renovar y abastecerse de mercadería. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y carismática, por eso sus clientes la prefieren antes que a la competencia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que así hace más amena sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar las cajas de cerveza hacía su puesto de venta.  Su objetivo es tener una tienda donde pueda desenvolverse como comerciante, además de poder ofrecer una mejor atención a sus clientes. Este será su décimo segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el  apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para establecer su negocio. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más cajas de cerveza, ya que por estas fechas se incrementa su demanda.
texts.en:
Charita, 38 years old, is a very kind and hard-working woman, who lives in her own house with her 2 minor children, Rutger, aged 16, and Alith, 14, to whom she wishes to offer a better quality of life. Charita's business is selling beer, soft drinks, and water. Her store is located in her own house. Thus, every weekend, she attempts to renew and restock her merchandise. Charita is a very happy and charismatic vendor, and her customers prefer her to the competition.

What Charita likes best about her work is conversing with her customers; it makes her long days less tiresome. She has had her business for 4 years and what she finds most difficult is transporting the cases of beer to her store. Charita's goal is to have a better store where she can develop as a merchant, and be able to offer better service to her customers.

This will be Charita's 2nd loan through MFP, and she hopes for the help of each one of you to establish her business. With the 3,000 new sols requested, she will buy more cases of beer, since during the present epoch, demand increases.

loans.use: buy more cases of beer to sell.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: Pedro José tiene 41 años, su actividad es la venta de medicina natural. Tiene más de 6 años en su negocio. Es un hombre responsable pues tiene que hacerse cargo de sus 10 hijos a pesar de ser tantos ha logrado superar las dificultades que con ellos ha enfrentado. Todos los días Pedro tiene que tomar un autobús para empezar a vender los productos a sus diferentes clientes que a diario viajan. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de pastillas, vitaminas, cremas, pomadas, inyecciones entre otras.
texts.en: Pedro José is 41 years old and his business is selling natural medicines.  He has been in this business for more than six years.  Pedro José is a responsible man as he has to take care of his 10 children.  Although he has a lot of children, he has managed to overcome the difficulties that he has faced.  Every day, Pedro has to catch a bus to start selling his products to his different customers who travel daily.  He will use this loan to buy pills, vitamins, ointments, injections, etc.

loans.use: to buy pills, vitamins, creams, ointments, injections, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy baskets of dried/smoked fish for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married and has three children. Ama sells bowls, pegs, slippers and other things at Abura, which she has done for three years. Her husband is a court cleaner. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Ama will use the loan to purchase more slippers and pegs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and pegs to sell.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
