For the past 10 years, Nana has been cooking banku (a corn-dough dish) and fried fish at Abura for sale. Nana has received a junior high education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a customs officer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Her loan will be used to buy maize and fresh fish to cook and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy maize and fresh fish to cook and sell

loans.name: Gloria Mercedes

texts.es:
Gloria Mercedes tiene 19 años, es soltera vive con los padres, no tiene hijos vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C VIRGEN DEL HUAYCO, esta conformada por 14 socios y se encuentra en el Recinto Loma de Guacalgoto a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frejol y algunos a la comercialización ya sea de harinas o de animales.

Gloria  se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y frejol y los comercializa. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos y los intermediarios que son con los que se hace el negocio. Su sueño es llegar a culminar los estudios universitarios.

Le gusta escuchar musica y colaborar con todas las fiestas del recinto.
texts.en:
Gloria Mercedes, age 19, is single and lives with her parents.  She does not have children.  She lives in the Agua Clara precinct in the Chillanes Cantón.

The Virgen Del Huayco Communal Bank is comprised of 14 members.  It is located in the Loma de Guacalgoto precinct, 20 minutes from the Chillanes office.  The members of the communal bank devote themselves to growing corn and beans.  Some of them sell either flour or animals.

Gloria grows and sells corn and beans.  She makes her purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo.  She sells at the Sunday fair in Chillanes.

The loan will help her to buy supplies for her crops.  The loan has helped her in such a way that has increased her crop production.  She has faced challenges like insect infestation, plant diseases, and the intermediaries with whom she does business. 

Her dream is to finish her university studies.

She likes to listen to music and to participate in all of the precinct’s festivities.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua displays biscuits, bread, meat pie and bags of water on a table at Abura. She has been through junior high school. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a teacher. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to prepare meat pie, bread and water for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to prepare meat pie, bread and water for sale

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua, who is married to a driver and has two children, has been selling fish and bananas at Abura for two years. Her business helps support her husband in paying utility bills and other household expenses.

Ekua, who has a junior high education, will use her loan to buy more fruits to sell, and she hopes to use the extra profits from her business to buy other types of fruits to sell.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell.

loans.name: Cheril

texts.es: Cheril, de 28 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Luis de 11 y Cesar de 2 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El puesto de comida de Cheril es uno de los más concurridos en la ciudad de Pucallpa, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su puesto para degustar los deliciosos paltillos que prepara. Ella es una cocinera muy hábil y es que desde muy pequeña le nació el amor por la cocina y ahora se siente muy feliz realizando este trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar es por eso que lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todas las personas que visitan su puesto de comida, ya que muchas veces tiene que trabajar sola y no se da abasto.  Con el paso de los meses, espera mejorar la infraestructura de su puesto de comida y así tener más clientes. Es será su quinto crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para desarrollar su negocio. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas sillas y mesas, para adecuar mejor su puesto de comida.
texts.en:
Cheril, age 28, is a very unassuming and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her two beloved children, ll year old Luis and 2 year old Cesar.  She wishes to give them a better quality of life.

Cheril’s food stand is one of the busiest in the city of Pucallpa.  Every day her customers come together at her stand to enjoy the delicious dishes she prepares.  She is a very good cook because her love for cooking was born when she was very young.  Now, she is very happy doing this work.  What she likes the most about her work is cooking, which she does with great care.  She has been doing this for two years.

The most difficult part is taking care of all of the people who go to her stand.  Many times she has to work alone, and she cannot keep up with the demand.  As the months pass by she hopes to improve the infrastructure of her food stand and get more customers.  

This will be her fifth loan with MFP.  Thus, she hopes to have the support of each one of you in order to expand her business.  She is a very participatory member of her communal bank.

She will use the requested 3,000 soles to buy chairs and tables to better adapt her food stand.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
Jose Alfredo tiene 43 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con la hija vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C VIRGEN DEL HUAYCO, esta conformada por 14 socios y se encuentra en el Recinto Loma de Guacalgoto a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frejol y algunos a la comercialización ya sea de harinas o de animales.

Jose  se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y frejol. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar terrenos propios.

Le gusta ser una persona responsable.
texts.en:
Jose Alfredo, age 43, is married.  He lives with his wife and daughter in the Agua Clara precinct in the Chillanes canton.

The Virgen Del Huayco Communal Bank is comprised of 14 members.  It is located in the Loma de Guacalgoto precinct, 20 minutes from the Chillanes office.  The members of the communal bank devote themselves to growing corn and beans.  Some of them sell either flour or animals.

Jose grows corn and beans.  He makes his purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo, and he sells at the Sunday fair in Chillanes.

The loan will help him to buy supplies for his crops. The loan has helped him in such a way that has increased his crop production. He has faced challenges like insect infestation and plant diseases.

His dream is to buy his own land.

He likes to be a responsible person.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her business

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María, es comerciante, durante doce años ha comercializado de forma ambulante en la venta de todo lo relacionado de comidas rápidas, como hamburguesa, hotdog, fresco, golosinas, gaseosas, siendo su transporte un carretón, también vende cosméticos, de la Avon, algunos encargados, siendo de gran provecho ya que le ayudado a prosperar en su economía.
María cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo, quien labora en la construcción, y es quien ha venido construyendo toda la casa, teniendo esa gran ganancia al no gastar en mano de obra. 
Durante estos once ciclos María ha trabajado con préstamo que Afodenic ha dado mediante el financiamiento, en donde ha logrado hacer su casa toda de concreto, faltándole el techo.
Comprara láminas de zinc, perlines, golosos, soldadura entre otros que ayude terminar su casa.
texts.en:
María is a saleswoman.  For twelve years she has sold everything to do with fast food such as burgers, hot dogs, fruit drinks, candies and soda, as an itinerant street vendor.  She transports her products in a small cart.  She also sells Avon cosmetics.  Her businesses have been very beneficial since they have helped her to prosper financially.

María has the financial support of her husband, who is a construction worker.  Her husband has been building their own home which has saved them a lot of money in not having to pay labor costs.

María has been working with loans from Afodenic for eleven loan cycles.  She has managed to build her house completely from concrete but it is lacking a roof.

María will buy sheets of corrugated metal, girders, bolts, welding materials, etc. which will help her finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal, girders, bolts and welding materials to put a roof on her house so that she can move into it soon

loans.name: Duo San Francisco Ll Group

texts.es:
Duo San Francisco ll : este grupo lo integran dos señoras las cuales se dedican a la venta de ropa tipica doña Telma tiene ya barios años de dedicarse a esta actividad esta muy contenta porque su venta a aumentado y nececita mas capital para trabajar ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa tipica.
Doña Basilia,ella tambien se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica, no cuenta que sus venas a haumentado considerablemente y nececita mas capital para trabajar por eso esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa tipica.
texts.en:
The group "Duo San Francisco II" is made up of 2 women who sell traditional Guatemalan clothing.  Telma has already been doing this type of work for a number of years and is very content because her sales have increased.  She needs more working capital, and so she is requesting this loan to buy more traditional garments.

Basilia also sells traditional Guatemalan clothing.  She tells us that her sales have increased considerably, and she needs more working capital, and so she is requesting a loan to buy traditional clothing.

loans.use: to buy traditional Guatemalan clothing

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 35 years old and is married with 1 child, aged 16. She runs a clothing store in Kissy near Freetown.

Sarah has been in this business for 13 years and sells clothes, shoes, bags and jewelry at her store. Her business is her only source of income. She says that her main business challenge is that sales of clothes and other items depend on the season.   

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more shoes, bags and jewelry. Sarah says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve the standard of living of her family. In the future, she would like to import goods from overseas by container.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes, bags and jewelry

loans.name: Jose Homero

texts.es:
Jose Homero tiene 24 años, es soltewro vive con los padres, no tiene hijos vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C VIRGEN DEL HUAYCO, esta conformada por 14 socios y se encuentra en el Recinto Loma de Guacalgoto a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frejol y algunos a la comercialización ya sea de harinas o de animales.

Jose  se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y frejol. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. No ha enfrentado desafios importantes. Su sueño es estudiar y tener un titulo universitario.

Le gusta ser una persona alegre y colaboradora y hacer un poco de deporte.
texts.en:
Jose Homero is 24 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in Agua Clara, in Chillanes canton.  He does not have any children.

The Virgen del Huayco community bank has 14 members and is located in Loma de Guacalgoto, 20 minutes from our Chillanes office.  The members of this community bank work in agriculture, growing corn and beans.  Some sell flour or animals.

José is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  He makes his purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and makes his sales in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

This loan will help José to buy supplies for his crops.  The loan has supported him in increasing his crop production.  He hasn't faced any serious challenges.  His dream is to study and gain a university degree.

José enjoys being a cheerful and cooperative person and he enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, soap, charcoal, fire-wood, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira es parte de la junta directiva de la empresa de Crédito Comunal El Encanto de Pital.
Ella está solicitando en este momento un préstamo de ₡ 400 000 
(cuatrocientos mil colones)  para la compra de una computadora portátil  y de una impresora multifuncional para facilitar las operaciones de crédito de la empresita. 
Ella asegura que la demanda de crédito a aumentado muchísimo y que por eso es necesario invertir en tecnología para que la empresita crezca.
Doña Elvira asegura que la empresa ha traído muchísimas oportunidades para los habitantes de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the board of directors of the El Encanto de Pital community loan company.  She is requesting a loan for 400,000 colones to buy a laptop and a multifunction printer to facilitate the company's loan operations.

Elvira assures us that demand for loans has increased a lot and, for that reason, it is necessary to invest in technology so that the small company can grow.  She assures us that the company has brought many opportunities to the residents of her community.

loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Angelina Del Carmen

texts.es: Angelina Del Carmen tiene 20 años, su actividad es una panadería. Tiene más de 14 años, en su negocio. Es una mujer emprendedora a pesar de la edad que tiene ha sabido aprovechar las oportunidades que se le ofrecen. luego ella compraba los productos en la panadería donde el esposo trabajaba y ella los vendía, la ganancia era poca, con el tiempo pusieron su propia panadería pequeña únicamente para elaborar repostería, con los financiamientos de fundación león 2000, ha podido comprar maquinarias para trabajar y ahora elaboran panes de toda clase, y ella vende y también tiene otros vendedores. El financiamiento es para la compra de huevos, harina, mantequilla, queso, dulce entre otros.
texts.en: Angelina Del Carmen is 20, her activity is a bakery. She has over 14 years experience in business. She is an enterprising woman who despite her age has seized the opportunities offered. She used to buy the products in the bakery where her husband worked and she would resell them her profits were small but eventually they set up their own small bakery only to make pastry.  With funding from Fundación León 2000, she has been able to buy machinery to work and now produces breads of all kinds that she sells and she also has other vendors. Funding is for the purchase of eggs, flour, butter, cheese, sweets and more.

loans.use: to buy eggs, flour, butter, cheese and sweets, among others.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de 56 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija Nélida de 30 años y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo de María es la compra y venta de pescado, y lo hace de manera ambulante, es así que distribuye a sus caseros su producto, el cual vende a precios muy cómodos. Ella tiene muchos clientes, ya que vende el pescado más fresco y sabroso del mercado y es una vendedora muy alegre, que siempre saca a sus clientes una sonrisa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientas, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que los más difícil es soportar el intenso olor que sale de los pescados, ya que este se le pega en la ropa y prácticamente tiene que soportarlo todo el día, pero sabe que es parte del trabajo para poder ganar más dinero. Este será su  tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes, para continuar con su trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, por la alegría que pone en el grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más pescado, ya que últimamente esta teniendo más demanda.
texts.en:
María, 56, is a very unassuming, hard working woman living in her own home with her beloved daughter, Nélida, 30.  What she most wants is to work hard to improve her quality of life.  María is a street vendor; she sells fish.  She delivers fish door to door and sells at very affordable prices.  She has many customers because she sells the freshest and most delicious fish in the market and she is a very cheerful seller that always draws a smile from her customers.

She’s been in business for two years and considers the most difficult part of it having to stand the strong odor of the fish because it sticks to her clothes and she pretty much has to put up with it all day.  However, she knows this is part of the job she has to do to earn more money.

This will be her third loan with MFP so she is hoping to have support from each one of you in order to stay in business.  She is a very well liked member of her communal bank because if the joy she brings to the group.  She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy more fish since it’s been in higher demand lately.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Doña Elana se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva bariada para niños y mayores de edad, ella leva ya barios años de dicarse a esta actividad y se a esforzado mucho para que su negocio  prospere y lo a logrado ahora esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva ya que nececita mas capital para trabajar.
texts.en: Elena has a business where she sells a variety of new clothing for children and adults.  She has been doing this type of work for a number of years.  She has worked hard and been able to make her business prosper.  Now she is requesting a loan to buy new clothing, since she needs more capital to work with.

loans.use: to buy new clothing

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: Doña Ofelia es una persona muy buena y onesta ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva bariada desde ya hace barios años ella nos cuenta que su ganancia a aumentado pero esta luchando por extender mas su ya que tiene la oportunidad de este credito nececita comprar mas bariedad en ropa nuevos estilos y diseños ya que sus clientes le preguntan por nuevos estilos su sueño es tener un local mas grande y tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Doña Ofelia is a very good and honest person. She has earned a living by selling varied new clothing for several years now. She tells us that her earnings have increased but she is struggling to expand. Now that she has the opportunity from this loan, she needs to buy a larger variety of new clothing styles and designs since her customers are asking for new styles. Her dream is to have a larger shop and a better future.

loans.use: to buy new clothes.

loans.name: Vicente Daniel

texts.es: El Joven Vicente,de 24 años de edad,habita en la ciudad de Leon,el es dueños de una barberia, el estudio ingles tambien trabaja como traductor.El empezo a los 16 años de edad,en la barberia de un amigo ubicada en su vecindario ,le sirvio de escuela por ahi aprendio todo lo que sabe barberia ,todo esa experiencia adquirida lo motivo a el a poner su propio negocio de barberia, esto lo hizo a los 21 años de edad con capital propio.  Hoy en dia lleva tres años con este negocio.Solicito el prestamo para hacerle mejoras de infraestructura y acondicionamiento a su local.Espera darle una mejor presentacion a su negocio,aumentar su clientela.En lo futuro desea tener varias barberias con trabajadores a su cargo en toda la ciudad de Leon. Sus proximas metas son estudiar una carrera universitaria y poner una barberia mas en el centro de la ciudad de Leon.
texts.en:
Vicente, 24, lives in the city of León.  He owns a barber shop.  He studied English and also works as a translator.  He started working at the age of 16 in a friend’s barber shop located in his neighborhood.  This acted as his school and he learned everything he knows about barbering there.  All this acquired experience motivated him to set up his own barber shop which he did at the age of 21 with capital of his own.  To date, he’s been in business three years.

He requested the loan to do some improvements to the infrastructure and to the furnishings of his shop.  He hopes to make it more attractive in order to increase his customer base.  In the future, he’d like to have several barber shops with employees under his supervision throughout the city of León.  His next goals are to study a university career and to establish another barber shop in downtown León.

loans.use: to improve his business' infrastructure.

loans.name: Luz's Group

texts.en:
Luz and Espinoza are the members of this group in Otavalo, Ecuador. Luz, 40, is the president of this group. She is single and lives with her four children, aged 17, 15, 11, and 4. Luz is very concerned about the well-being of her children. 

She has a clothing business in the market. She began her small business selling grain. Thanks to a previous loan from FODEMI, she changed her business and now sells clothing. She says her business is going well and, in addition to her business, she has work cooking and ironing. 

She is soliciting this loan to buy more merchandise for her clothing business in hopes of increasing her sales. She has been getting loans for four years and, with the help of these loans, her business has changed. She has helped her children study, and she feels that her family unity has increased. 

In the future, Luz hopes that her children have their own businesses like their mother. She would also like her business to grow more.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her clothing business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Rosa Enriqueta

texts.es: Rosa Enriqueta tiene su actividad es una pulpería. Su negocio está ubicado en su vivienda que es en la comunidad bethel, ella Comenzó con muy poco capital, vendiendo Golosinas, dulces, entre otros ya que su principales clientes eran los alumnos de un colegio que esta frente a su casa, con el tiempo las personas comenzaron a pedirles otros productos y así fue comprando y aumentando su capital  de trabajo y activos fijos del negocio, con los financiamiento que ha obtenido ha mejorado su negocio, sus clientelas son mayores  y tiene un mayor inventario. El crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas y detergentes.
texts.en: Rosa Enriqueta has a grocery store located in her home which is in the community of Bethel.  She started the business with very little capital selling snacks and candy, among others, since her main customers were students at a school across from her house.  In time, people started asking for other products and this is how she eventually started buying and increasing her working capital and the fixed assets of the business.  With the loans she has gotten she’s improved the business, she has more customers and her inventory is larger.  The loan will be used to buy basic grains, soft drinks, snacks and detergents.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Duo Vista Hrmosa 1 Group

texts.es: Duo Vista Hermosa 1 : Este grupo esta conformado por dos señoras las cuales se dedican a la centa de ropa nueva y ropa tipica,Doña Vicenta se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva bariada desde hace barios años.ella nos cuenta que esta contenta porque sus clientes han aumentado y tiene la nececidad de mas capital por eso esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva,Doña Francisca Tambien se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica ella nos cuenta que es un negocio que le gusta nucho porque la gente la conocen y le compran por mayor ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa tipica el sueño de ellas es tener un local mas grande y estar mejor economicamente en un futuro.
texts.en: Duo Vista Hermosa 1 : This group is made up of two women who sell new and traditional clothing. Vicenta has sold a variety of new clothes for several years. She tells us that she is happy because her customers have increased and she needs the capital. That is why she is asking for the loan to buy new clothing. Francisca also sells traditional clothing. She tells us that she really likes the business because people know her and they buy from her wholesale. She is asking for this loan to buy traditional clothing. Their dream is to have a larger locale and to be better off financially in the future.

loans.use: to buy new clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new clothes and buy pet animals such as canaries, pigeons, etc.

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
Silvia tiene su propio negocio con más de veinte años en el comercio, una pequeña pulpería y venta de nacatamales, que realiza todos los fines de semana. Comenzando con poca inversión lo que vino a mejorar con préstamo que Afodenic ha dado en diez ciclos, aumentando las ventas y mejora  a su vivienda. 

Su esposo trabaja en construcción y ambos han apoyado  a sus hijos en todo, hoy en día independientes.

Con el crédito anterior Silvia logro el cambio de techo de su casa, hoy con este nuevo financiamiento hará un bajarete, en donde ya tiene puesta cerámica, pero cuando llueve el agua se le ha estado metiendo, por tal razón tapara  mejorando esta condición, en donde comprara: laminas de zinc, perlines, golosos, soldadura, cemento, arena y tubos para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Silvia has had her own business for over twenty years:  a small grocery store and Nacatamales sales (Nicaraguan style tamales) on the weekends.  She started with a small investment that she improved with Afodenic loans over ten cycles.  Sales have increased and she’s done some home improvements.

Her husband works in construction and both have supported their children in everything; today they are independent.

Silvia used her previous loan to replace the roof on her house and now will use the new loan to build a covered porch where she’s already installed the tile.  However, when it rains the water is seeping through so she will cover it to improve this situation.  She will buy zinc metal sheeting, purlines, screws, solder, cement, sand and tubes to start the work.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Rocio Del Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROCIO DEL AMANECER” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maria Luisa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción de verduras, producción de hortalizas, contratista de albañil, venta de verduras, comercio de mineral, venta de comida.

La señora Maria Luisa,  indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de sulfato de cobre que inicio hace treinta años con el apoyo de sus padres.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital de trabajo (compra de sulfato de cobre) que comprará de las minas de Potosí y de Coro Coro y lo venderá a empresas privadas, cuando haya pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y cinco tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y el consultorio médico.
texts.en:
The “Rocío del Amanecer” (Morning Dew) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Center.  It has nine members and is led by a governing board headed by María Luisa.  The businesses the members are involved in are varied.  Among them we have:  vegetable production, leafy green vegetable production, construction worker, vegetable sales, minerals merchant and food sales.

María Luisa indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for five years having joined thanks to an invitation from a girl friend.  Currently, she has a business selling copper sulphate which started 30 years ago with help from her parents.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase her working capital.  She will buy copper sulphate from the mines in Potosí and Coro Coro which she will then sell to private firms when they place orders.  This way of working makes it possible for her to generate income to support her family in whatever way possible because she’s married and has five three children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health training and the medical clinic.

loans.use: to buy copper sulphate.

loans.name: Duo Las Margaritas De San Bartolome Group

texts.es:
Duo margaritas de san Bartolo.
la señora maría transita de 60 años  de edad y su compañera Zoila edina de 26 años de edad, decidieron  enfrentar un nuevo reto  al solicitar un crédito a fape para engrandecer su negocio. Ambas personas se dedican al comercio, en el caso de doña transita se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, con el surtido de gran variedad de golosinas, durante los fines de semana trabaja en la venta de comida,  para poner otras variedades de comida, así como aumentar el número de raciones para la venta.
En el caso de dona Zoila edina, trabaja en una pequeña tienda de su propiedad, de autorizarse el crédito, pondrá más variedad de artículos para el consumo diario, doña zoila al igual que doña transita se dedica a la venta de comida como actividad secundaria, solo que su especialidad son los antojitos, como chuchitos, tostadas, rellenitos y atoles, los fines de semana por las tardes, como también trabaja en pedidos para determinadas personas, ambas personas trabajan en su domicilio por su propia cuenta.
texts.en:
Duo Margaritas de San Bartolo ("Saint Bartolo's Daisies Duo"). Maria Transita is 60 years old and her partner Zoila Edina is 26 years old. They decided to tackle a new challenge by requesting a loan to FAPE to expand their businesses. Both of them work in commerce. Maria Transita sells fruit and vegetables, as well as an assorted variety of sweets. At the week-end she also sells cooked food. She wants to offer new kinds of food and increase the number of portions she is able to sell. 

Zoila Edina runs a small shop of her property. If the loan is authorised she will be able to offer a greater variety of daily staples for sale. Zoila, just like Transita, also sells food as secondary activity in the afternoons during the week-end, only her specialties are snacks such as tamales, toast, stuffed pasties and atole drinks. She also works on orders for some private individuals. Both of them are self-employed and work from home.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables and to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: El Progreso Del Vallecito Group

texts.es:
“El Progreso del Vallecito “es una Nueva Alcancía Comunal que está conformada por 07 mujeres animadas con el Programa Prosperidad.
Esther fue elegida presidenta gracias a sus compañeras que depositaron su confianza en ella. La Sra.: Esther tiene 35 años de edad  es conviviente con 2 hijos que dependen de ella y de conyugue, ella nos manifiesta que   se dedica a la venta de comida en un mercado de su comunidad donde lleva 6 meses laborando, su negocio comenzó con la idea de mejorar sus ingresos en beneficio de su familia, también cuenta con  una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Esther es una mujer trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido educar a sus 02  hijos y de lograr tener el servicio de luz propia en su domicilio  ya que en su zona no cuentan con ese servicio. El deseo de Esther es construir su casa y de contar con los servicios básicos como es el agua y desagüe. Con el préstamo que solito ella piensa surtir su pequeña bodega con productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, etc.  La Alcancía Comunal “El Progreso del Vallecito” están  agradecidas por la  confianza puesta en ellas y en sus negocios y están comprometidos a trabajar bien con el programa Prosperidad. En la foto vemos  a las señoras el día del desembolso felices en su comunidad acompañadas de sus hijos disfrutando de un pequeño compartir.
texts.en:
“El Progreso del Vallecito“ is a new community bank that has seven members who are all enthusiastic about the 'Prosperidad' (Prosperity) program.  Esther was elected president as her fellow bank members put their trust in her.

Esther is 35 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children who are dependent on her and her partner.  She tells us that she sells food in a market in her community.  She has been doing this for six months.  She started her business with the idea of improving her income for the benefit of her family.  Esther also has a small grocery store in her home.  She is a hard-working woman who, thanks to her efforts, has been able to educate her two children and has managed to install her own electricity service in her home as her region doesn't have this service.  Esther's wish is to build her home and have basic services such as water and sewerage.  She is planning to use the loan that she has requested to stock her small grocery store with essential household products such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles etc.  The members of the 'El Progreso del Vallecito' community bank are grateful for the trust that has been placed in them and in their businesses and they pledge to work well within the 'Prosperidad' program.

In the photo we can see the ladies on the day they received their loans, happy in their community and, accompanied by their children, enjoying a little get together.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and noodles

loans.name: Rosas De Chijini Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE CHIJINI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, donde la señora Mercedes es secretaria. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de comida, trabajo en minas, venta de cosméticos, atención en Internet, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, atención de fotocopias, venta de ropa usada.

La señora Mercedes,  indica que es el primer ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer, e ingreso por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de tienda de barrio, que inicio hace seis meses atrás. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de mercadería para su tienda (compra de fideo, arroz, aceite, verduras, etc.), estos productos los comprará de la ciudad de El Alto y los venderá todos los días en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rosas de Chijini" will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer; they meet in the central office of Villa Adela.  This group has 8 members and is led by a board of directors; Mercedes is the secretary.  The women in the group have a variety of economic activities, including: clothing sales, food sales, working in a quarry, cosmetic sales, Internet services, neighborhood store, photocopies, and used clothing sales.

Mercedes says that this is the first loan cycle that she has been with Pro Mujer; she joined the organization by invitation.  Now she has a neighborhood store that she started 6 months ago.

She will use the loan that she will take to buy merchandise for her store (noodles, rice, cooking oil, vegetables, etc.)  She will buy these products in the city of El Alto and she will sell them every day in her store.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family; she contributes as much as she can to her household which includes her common-law husband and their 2 children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training and the health services.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, noodles, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena comes from the village of Ikalto, Kakheti Region. She is 39 years old and lives with her 18-year-old daughter who goes to school. Shorena works as a salesperson in a local store. She gets a monthly salary, but the main source of income for her family comes from agricultural activities. Shorena has a milk cow. She produces approximately 25 kg cheese per month and sells it to dairy product retailers. Also she owns one hectare of land where maize is grown. Harvested maize is used for feeding the cow. 

Shorena requested a loan to expand her dairy farm. She will purchase two additional milk cows and produce 75 kg of cheese monthly. It will significantly increase the income of the family. Increase of income is very important for Shorena, as she needs resources for her daughter’s education.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Solano Group

texts.es:
El grupo lo conforman  Hortensia, Silvana e Ulises tres personas trabajadoras provenientes del reparto Martín Castellón de Nindiri. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Hortensia,  ella inicio con la venta de variedades (chiverías, torta de papa, enchiladas, tacos…etc.) luego con las ganancias puso una comideria e inicio a prestar para levantar su negocio.

Ella junto a su esposo trabajan hombro a hombro para salir a delante en su pequeño local y distribuyen comida a distintas empresa. Hortensia con el crédito comparar arroz, aceite, frijoles, cebolla, carne…etc.

El señor Ulises trabaja en un microbús como cobrador y tiene una comideria la cual mira su esposa y Silvana  desde hace 16 años vende  mariscos.
texts.en:
This group includes Hortensia, Silvana and Ulises, three hardworking people who come from the Martin Castellon housing development in Nindiri.  Hortensia is the coordinator of the group.  She started a business selling a variety of food items (snacks, potato cakes, enchiladas, tacos, etc.)  Later with the earnings from that enterprise she started a catering business, and started investing to grow the business. 

Hortensia works side by side with her husband to make her business work; they deliver food to a number of different companies.  With this loan, Hortensia will buy rice, cooking oil, beans, onions, meat and other items.

Ulises works as a fare collector on a minibus, and he also has an eatery that his wife looks after.  Silvana has been selling seafood for 16 years.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is married with a teenage daughter. He and his family live in Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. Igor owns a private business of selling and installing wooden and armored doors and vinyl windows in his home town and the region. He used to manufacture wooden doors, windows, etc. However, later he decided to offer installation services. Presently, he orders door and window units from a local manufacturing factory as soon as he gets an order from his customers. Igor’s business is known for timely quality service which has helped him gain a solid reputation in town.  

Igor has been in business for twelve years. Currently, his monthly income amounts to about $1275. His net profit amounts to around half that. Igor’s wife is helping him with the business, working as a vendor in one of his stores in town. Moreover, he has four hired employees working for him. Igor is requesting a 10,000 UAH loan to meet the growing demand by ordering armored doors and vinyl windows at a manufacturing factory for further retail sale.  He is planning to purchase five armored doors and ten vinyl windows from the manufacturer. The business is the main source of income for the borrower’s family.

loans.use: to purchase armored doors and vinyl windows from the manufacturer.

loans.name: Jose Ramiro

texts.es:
Jose Ramiro tiene 23 años, es soltero vive con  los padres, no tiene hijos vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C VIRGEN DEL HUAYCO, esta conformada por 14 socios y se encuentra en el Recinto Loma de Guacalgoto a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frejol y algunos a la comercialización ya sea de harinas o de animales.

Jose  se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y frejol. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para seguir trabajando y tener dinero para estudiar

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
José Ramiro is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents, in Agua Clara, in Chillanes canton.  He does not have any children.

The Virgen del Huayco community bank has 14 members and is located in Loma de Guacalgoto, 20 minutes from our Chillanes office.  The members of this bank work in farming, growing corn and beans.  Some of them sell flour or animals.

José is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  He makes his purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and makes his sales in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

This loan will help José to buy supplies for his crops.  The loan supported him in increasing his crop production.  His dream is to buy a plot of land so that he can continue working and to make money so that he can study.

José enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his crops

loans.name: Municipal D-4 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUNICIPAL D- 4” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Gladys. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tienda de barrio, venta de estebia, distribución de productos, venta de cosméticos, comercio papa y arroz, venta de comida, elaboración de calzados, librería, venta de ropa, tienda de estuco, tejido de mantas

La señora Gladys, indica que hace dos ciclos que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que ingreso por invitación de la promoción en zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de estuco que aprendió de sus papás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de estuco), este material lo adquiere de las ferreterías y lo comercializa en la zona Lagunas, de lunes a viernes. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y  tiene dos hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud.
texts.en:
The "Municipal D-4" community bank is about to start its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office.  It has eleven members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Gladys.  The businesses that the members of the bank carry out are varied and include: running a neighborhood store, selling stevia, distributing products, selling cosmetics, selling potatoes and rice, selling meals, making footwear, running a stationery store, selling clothes, running a store selling plaster and knitting blankets.

Gladys tells us that she has been working with Pro Mujer for two loan cycles.  She joined through an invitation she received during some promotional activities in her area.  She currently has a business selling plaster.  She learned this business from her parents.

Gladys will use this loan to increase her capital (buying plaster).  She buys this material in hardware stores and sells it in Lagunas district, from Monday to Friday.  This work allows her to make money with which to support her family.  Gladys lives with her common-law husband and has two children.  When we asked her what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy plaster

loans.name: Samaritano Group

texts.es:
El grupo Samaritano está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Virginia Alejandra de 49 años quien inicio realizando tortillas y con los prestamos decidió invertir en la venta de nacatamales, comida típica a base de masa y cerdo. Ella con el crédito comprará materia prima para su negocio esto es cerdo, maíz, especie, leña, hojas…etc. 
Las otras integrantes son Ángela Francisca quien inicio en la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya desde muy joven ya que le ayudaba a su mamá y desde hace tres años se independizo y Osmar Antonio es agricultor e invertirá el crédito en poner una pequeña venta.
texts.en:
The Samaritano group has three members who are hard-working, determined and entrepreneurial.  The group's coordinator is 49 year-old Virginia Alejandra who started out selling tortillas and, with the help of loans, decided to invest in selling nacatamales (traditional food made from dough and pork).  She will use her loan to buy raw materials for her business such as pork, corn, spices, firewood, leaves (for wrapping the nacatamales in), etc.

The other members of the group are Ángela Francisca, who started out selling fruit and vegetables in Masaya market when she was very young as she used to help her mom (three years ago she started working for herself), and Osmar Antonio who is a farmer and will invest his loan in setting up a small sales location.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, pork, spices, leaves, etc.

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yuliya is single. She runs her footwear sales business in her home town of Berdyansk. Berdyansk is a resort town that is flooded with tourists and vacationers in summer. Yuliya works in a local marketplace offering a variety of shoes to potential customers. She is always polite and her smile only adds to the overall pleasant impression one gets when leaving her vending location. Yuliya started her venture over seven years ago. Her income amounts to about $2,550 a month.     

Yuliya is seeking a 10,000 UAH loan to purchase assorted summer footwear merchandise, i.e. sandals, flip-flops, heels, etc. Different female customers stop at her vending facility looking for casual and extravagant shoes every day. Yuliya wants to make sure she has a better selection of summer footwear merchandise to be able to meet the demands of various clients who buy from her.

loans.use: to purchase assorted summer footwear.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha comes from the village of Kisiskhevi, Kakheti District, East Georgia. He is 47 years old and lives with his wife, Ani and 18-year-old daughter. Ani is a housewife and their daughter goes to school. 

Vazha requested a loan to till and fertilize his plot, where vine tree saplings are grown. He grows saplings every year and then sells them. In addition, he has a 0.3-hectare plot of the land where he grows strawberries. The harvested strawberries are sold on the local market. Tilling and fertilizing is essential for the land in order to get quality saplings. 

In the future, Vazha plans to save for house renovation, as it is already old and needs some repair. In addition, he will pay the fee for his daughter's education.

loans.use: to pay for tilling of the land and to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ceramic tiles

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda, a market entrepreneur from Melitopol, lives with her brother and sister in their own private house. Nadezhda has been selling household and dishware items in the central market of her home town for 15 years. Setting a reasonable pricing policy which attracts potential customers who come looking for quality dishware items, she has 20,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital, while her income amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas a month.

Her determination and business-orientation helping her to set goals and seek further development of her enterprise, Nadezhda is now requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional dishware merchandise. One of her plans for the extra profits arising from the loan is to remodel her house, a long-needed project for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dishware for retail sale.

loans.name: Maria Sara

texts.es:
María Sara tiene 42 años, es casada vive con el esposo y  tiene 3 hijos vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C VIRGEN DEL HUAYCO, esta conformada por 14 socios y se encuentra en el Recinto Loma de Guacalgoto a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frejol y algunos a la comercialización ya sea de harinas o de animales.

María  se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y frejol. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Su sueño es dar la educacion a los hijos y dar la alimentacion.

Le gusta pasear por el campo con la familia.
texts.en:
María Sara is 42 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and has three children.  She lives in Agua Clara, in Chillanes canton.

The Virgen del Huayco community bank has 14 members and is located in Loma de Guacalgoto, 20 minutes from our Chillanes office.  The members of this bank work in agriculture, growing corn and beans.  Some sell flour or animals.

María is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  She makes her purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and makes her sales in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

This loan will help María to buy supplies for her crops.  The loan has supported her in increasing her crop production.  Her dream is to provide her children with an education and food.

María enjoys going for walks in the countryside with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her crops

loans.name: Fatima Maritza

texts.es: La señora Fátima tiene su cabina de teléfonos y realiza venta de celulares y tarjetas por mayor y menor en la zona de villa Fátima. Fue integrante del banco de emprendimiento buenas emprendedoras que ya finalizaron su crédito y no renovaron por falta de personas responsables la señora Fátima solicito el crédito de manera individual,  vive con su esposo y con su hijo en la zona 3 de mayo,  el crédito esta destinado a la compra de tarjetas pre pago por mayor para carga de celulares y compra de celulares por mayor de distintos modelos, es una persona joven amable con ganas de superación agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Fátima has a telephone booth and sells cell phones and phone cards wholesale and retail in Villa Fátima district.  She was previously a member of the 'Buenas Emprendedoras' community bank.  This group paid back their loan but did not request a new one as there weren't enough responsible people.  For this reason, Fátima has requested an individual loan.  She lives with her husband and son in 3 de Mayo district.  She will use her loan to buy pre-paid phone cards for cell phones wholesale.  She will also buy different cell phone models.  She is a kind young person who has a desire to improve herself.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy phone cards and cell phones wholesale

loans.name: Futuro En Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Futuro en Desarrollo lo conforman José Dolores, Martha Raquel y Miguel Ángel tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. El coordinador del grupo es el señora José Dolores de 28 años él se dedica a la ebanistería desde hace 6 años el primeramente trabajo en talleres particulares donde aprendió  la ebanistería y luego decidió independizarse.

En la actualidad tiene un pequeño y modesto taller, cuenta con cuatro trabajadores y su meta es tener un taller de alta calidad. Él con el crédito comprara madera principalmente y otros materiales como barniz, lijas…etc. 

Mientras la señora Martha Raquel de 22 años es comerciante de ropa desde hace 4 años y Miguel Ángel de 43 años vende leña desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The group Futuro en Desarrollo (Future in Development) is comprised of José Dolores, Martha Raquel, and Miguel Ángel, three hardworking, motivated, and entrepreneurial people. The group's coordinator is José Dolores, 28 years old. He has been a cabinetmaker for six years, first working in shops, where he learned cabinetry, and then working independently.

Now he has a small, modest shop. He has four employees, and his goal is to have an even better shop. With this loan he will purchase mostly wood, but also other materials, such as varnish, sandpaper, etc.

Meanwhile, Martha Raquel, 22 years old, has been a clothing saleswoman for four years, and Miguel Ángel, 43 years old, has been selling firewood for 10 years.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Jessica Katerine

texts.es:
Jessica Katerine tiene 19 años, es soltera vive con la madre y un hijo vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C VIRGEN DEL HUAYCO, esta conformada por 14 socios y se encuentra en el Recinto Loma de Guacalgoto a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frejol y algunos a la comercialización ya sea de harinas o de animales.

Jessics se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y frejol. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Su sueño es llegar a tener casa propia.

Le gusta escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Jessica Katerine is 19 years old. She is single and lives with her mother and son. She lives in the Agua Clara precinct of the Chillanes region.

The V.R.C Virgen del Huayco group is comprised of 14 members and is located in the Loma de Guacalgoto precinct, 20 minutes from the office in Chillanes. The group members farm corn and beans and a few sell flour or animals.

Jessica plants corn and beans. She makes her purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and sells her produce at the market in Chillanes on Sundays.

This loan will help her purchase tools for farming. The loan will help her increase her crop production. Her dream is to have her own home.

She likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for farming

loans.name: Paris Group

texts.es:
El grupo Paris lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y empoderadas una de ellas es  la señora María José de 22 años quien tiene un niño de 3 años y se dedica al comercio de ropa el cual inicio con una pequeña cantidad de dinero y poco a poco con su arduo trabajo empezó a salir adelante.
Ella invertirá el crédito en mercadería en ropa (camisas, pantalones, camisas…etc.)
Las otras integrantes son Iliana Patricia  de 42 años tiene una pequeña venta la cual inicio recientemente y Vilgen de 37 años vende comida hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The Paris group is comprised of three hardworking, entrepreneurial, and empowered women, one of whom is María José, 22 years old. She has a three-year-old son, and she sells clothes. This is a business that she started with a small sum of money, and little by little, through hard work, started to see succeed.

She will use this loan to purchase clothing for merchandise (shirts, slacks, etc.).

The other members are Iliana Patricia, 42, who has a small sales business that she recently started, and Vilgen, 37, who has been selling food for two years.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for merchandise

loans.name: Reina De Inglaterra

texts.es: Reina De Inglaterra tiene 54 años, su actividad es la venta de productos lácteos. Tiene más de 12 años cuando su esposo ya estaba por jubilarse de su empleo, empezó comprando queso al por mayor, luego lo ahumaba y puesto a la venta, luego introdujo crema y cuajadas, con el tiempo también empezó a comprar frijoles y los cocía y luego vendía frijoles cocidos, con los financiamiento obtenido ha comprado y mantenido su clientela ya que estos productos en la actualidad tiene un alto costo. Ahora solicita este crédito para la compra de cuajada, queso, crema, leche y leche agria.
texts.en: Reina de Inglaterra is 54 years old. She sells milk products. She started this business 12 years ago, when her husband was already retired. She started buying cheese wholesale, smoking it, and putting it up for sale. Later she introduced cream and curds. Over time, she also started buying beans and cooking them, selling baked beans. With other loans she received, she made purchases to maintain her clientele since these products now cost more. She is now requesting this loan to purchase curds, cheese, cream, milk, and sour milk (similar to buttermilk).

loans.use: to purchase curd, cheese, cream, milk, and sour milk

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El señor  Luis,  ingreso a la institución en el año 2004 con el grupo solidario "tokio"  del cual el Sr. Luis  ha seguido continuando  con el crédito individual trabajando  por  nueve secuencias, actualmente ingresa al programa Kiva. El es transportista de taxi que trabaja  independientemente con niños  de un  colegio, por contrato llevándolos y recogiéndolos de la escuela,  quienes exigen el buen estado de la movilidad por tal motivo necesita  el crédito para comprar llantas y  reparación de su vehículo, el  señor  es bastante dedicado  a su hogar  y a sus hijos que están en la edad escolar quien los solventa económicamente, es una persona responsable y trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Luis joined this organization in 2004 with the group Tokio. Luis has continued with individual loans, working through nine loan cycles. He is now joining the Kiva program. He is a taxi driver who works independently with school children. He is hired on contract to take them to school and pick them up. They demand his car be in good shape, and this is why he needs a loan to purchase tires and to repair his vehicle. He is dedicated to his home and his children, who are school age and whom he supports financially. He is a responsible and hardworking person. He is grateful to this organization for the support it provides.

loans.use: to purchase tires and brake pads for his vehicle

loans.name: Suhey  Esther

texts.es:
Suhey de 35 años,es originaria de la ciudad de Leon ,esta casada es madre de dos hijos,ella es licenciada en Farmacia, es dueña de una pulperia. Ella empezo con este negocio hace 3 años con un capital de $300 dolares los cuales se lo habia prestado su hermano,ella compro un pequeño estante,una mesa ,productos comestibles de consumo masivo,despues hizo otros prestamos y fue incrementando poco a poco su inventario de esta manera ella pudo adquirir activos fijos tales como vitrinas ,refrigeradora . Ademas su esposo la ayuda con un negocio que el tambien tiene el es dueño de un cyber cafe que le genera otra fuente de ingreso para su familia.Ella solicito el prestamo para comprar granos basicos tales como arroz,frijoles,azucar,aceite,productos de consumo masivo diario que los clientes demandan diariamente.Esta inversion en su inventario le ayudara a crecer su negocio,mejorar sus ingresos, ella dice que le permitara invertir tambien en compra de nuevos productos tales como pollo y carne comprar al por mayor productos de facil rotacion de venta. 
Ella en lo futuro quiere convertir su pequeña pulperia en una miscelanea(distribuidora),tambien establecer una pequeña farmacia.Su mejorar su negocio hacerlo sostenible,comprar un vehiculo para trabajo y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
35 year-old Suhey is from the city of Leon.  She is married and has two children.  Suhey has a pharmacy degree.  She owns a grocery store.  She started out in this business three years ago with $300 worth of capital which her brother loaned her.  She bought a small shelf, a table and some essential groceries.  She took out other loans and gradually increased her inventory.  In this way, she was able to acquire fixed assets such as display cases and a refrigerator.  Suhey's husband helps her with a business that he runs.  He owns an Internet cafe which is another source of income for their family.

Suhey requested this loan to buy basic grains such as rice and beans, sugar, oil and essential household products which her customers ask for every day.  This investment in her stock will help her to grow her business and improve her income.  She says that it will also allow her to invest in new products such as chicken and meat and buy products that have an easy sales turnover wholesale.

In the future, Suhey would like to turn her small grocery store into a general store.  She would also like to set up a small pharmacy.  She would like to improve her business and make it sustainable, buy a vehicle for her work and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy basic grains

loans.name: Con Cristo Se Puede 1 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Yeta is one of the members of her group named Con Cristo se puede 1, 2 & 3 (With Christ we can). She and her group are Haitians citizens who have moved or emigrated to the Dominican Republic. It is s a group made up of 15 businesswomen dedicated to running different businesses from their homes or door-to door. They are located in a rural area outside La Romana, between sugarcane fields. She lives with her long term partner and their 2 children in a simple structure.

Yeta has been operating her Comedor (a kind of local restaurant for lunch) for around 2 years. Many people from the community have lunch there. She started with her own savings. She is excited to receive her third loan through Esperanza. She joined the program just 3 months after she started her business and she said this helped her get a good start. She plans to use this loan to buy items such as rice, meat, seasoning, canned meals, vegetables, flour and cooking oil.

She will use her profits to save as much as possible because she would like to have her own house, either by buying it or building it. Her story is generally representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for producing daily meals for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farm animals and chickens to butcher.

loans.name: Amancay Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMANCAY” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Eva. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de llaucha, venta de celulares, trenzado de mantas, venta de jugos y frescos, venta de verduras.
 
La señora Eva,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de llauchas, que viene trabajando hace ocho años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de las Llauchas (compra de harina, manteca,etc.), este material lo compra de la Ceja y por mayor, posterior a la elaboración lo distribuirá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Amancay” (Lily) will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer (Pro Woman) as a part of Centro Panamericana (Pan-american Center).  The communal bank is made up of six members and is run by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Eva.  The businesses run by the members of the communal bank are varied.  Among them we have: llaucha (a Bolivian hotpocket) sales, cell phone sales, blanket plaiting, juice and soda sales and vegetable sales.
 
Sra. Eva notes that this is the first time the communal bank has joined with Pro Mujer and that they were invited to join by an advocate.  Currently, Sra. Eva has a business selling "llauchas" (a Bolivian hot pocket), which she has been doing for the last eight years.

The loan that Sra. Eva is receiving is for the purchase of raw materials to make her llauchas (flour, lard etc.).  She purchases these products wholesale in La Ceja.  After making the llauchas, she distributes them as ordered.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, as she is single and has a son. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Sra. Eva responds that she likes the savings and health plans.

loans.use: to purchase flour, lard etc.

loans.name: Sol De Los Puentes Group

texts.es:
Éste banco comunal se llama “Sol de los Puentes” y está conformado por 18 emprendedores, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco, todos ellos se dedican a diferentes rubros específicamente corte y confección de ropa, además venta de mercadería en una feria libre.
Hada quien en la foto se encuentra de pie, viste una chaqueta color negro y se ubica en el tercer lugar de izquierda a derecha. Se dedica al corte y confección de ropa, específicamente la realización de cortinas, faldones, cenefas, reparación y costuras de ropas. Se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 1 año aproximadamente, comenzó ofreciendo y vendiendo sus servicios de costura en jardines infantiles, posteriormente se difundió la información de sus servicios en otros espacios como, consultorios y particulares ofreciendo cortinas para baño.  
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Angol en tiendas donde venden artículos de costuras, entre estos cierres, botones, hilos, cierres y telas. 
Con el crédito compró 37 metros de tela para cenefa (borde superior de una cortina), además compró lana, ya que se ha dedicado a realizar bufandas y a venderlas, le ha ido muy bien. Comenta que siempre tiene pedidos, ya sea de clientes particulares o de establecimientos de servicios a la comunidad. 
Sus metas son instalar su negocio en un local establecido, donde pueda tener diversidad de productos, como fundas de cojines, cortinas, cenefas, faldones, entre otros. 
Sus sueños son comprarse una máquina de coser overlock, ya que por ahora solo cuenta con una máquina de coser costura recta. 
Hada vive junto a su esposo y su hija de 15 años de edad. 
Ella está muy agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza y se encuentra muy contenta con las demás socias del grupo del banco comunal, ya que la relación es muy grata y ellos como grupo son muy unidos y solidarios. Además le ha servido como distracción de sus labores domesticas y de trabajo. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This community bank is called "Sol de los Puentes".  It has 18 members who live in the city of Temuco.  They all work in different fields, specifically dressmaking and selling merchandise in a street market.

In the photo, Hada is standing up and wearing a black jacket.  She is the third person, counting from left to right.  Hada is a dressmaker.  In particular, she makes drapes, christening robes and borders.  She also repairs and sews clothes.  She has been in this business for approximately one year.  She started out offering her sewing services in nursery schools.  She then gave out information about her services in other places such as medical centers and provided information to individuals, offering to make shower curtains.

Hada buys her merchandise in the city of Angol in stores that sell sewing supplies, including fasteners, buttons, threads and fabric.  She used her loan to buy 37 meters of fabric for making borders (the top edge of a curtain).  In addition, she bought yarn since she also makes and sells scarves.  Her business has done very well.  She tells us that she always has orders, whether it be from individual customers or establishments that provide services to the community.

Hada's goal is to set up her business in established business premises where she can offer a range of products such as cushion covers, drapes, borders, christening robes, etc.  Her dream is to buy an overlock sewing machine as, right now, she only has an ordinary straight line machine.

Hada lives together with her husband and her 15 year-old daughter.  She is very grateful for the support provided by Fondo Esperanza and she feels very happy with the other members of her community bank since they have a very good relationship and are very united and supportive as a group.  In addition, the group has served as a distraction from her housework and her business.

Temuco is the capital of Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  In the surrounding areas are a series of lakeside resorts (Pucón and Villarrica).  The native flora and fauna are very colorful and are concentrated in nearby nature reserves.  This region is home to 50% of the Mapuches (our country's indigenous people).

loans.use: to buy 37 meters of fabric for a border (the top edge of a curtain) and to buy yarn

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier es una persona trabajadora este es su octavo ciclos con  Adim en los cuales ha mostrado ser responsable y emprendedor. Además de ser beneficiado con crédito él ha participado en las capacitaciones las cuales le han ayudado a administrar su negocio.
Francisco se dedica al comercio de calzado desde hace 5 años negocio que poco a poco fue creciendo además tiene una pulpería la cual atiende su esposa mientras él trabaja directamente en la compra y venta de zapatos, sandalias…etc.
Él invertirá el crédito en la compra de mercadería para ambos negocios pero un poco más al de calzado.
texts.en:
Señor Francisco Javier is a hard-working person. This is his eighth loan cycle with ADIM, in which he has shown himself to be responsible and entrepreneurial. In addition to benefiting from the loan, he has participated in the training that has helped him to administer his business. 

Francisco has sold shoes for five years, a business that has been growing little by little. In addition, he has a grocery store which his wife tends to while he works directly in the purchase and sale of shoes, sandals, etc.

He will invest this loan in the purchase of merchandise for both businesses, but a little more will go to footwear.

loans.use: to stock his shoe business and his grocery store.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is 42 years of age and married with four children. Eseta owns & operates a business venture, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business. Eseta needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase new items to expand product offering.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Eseta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Eseta's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, de 49 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Haydee de 24 y Carlos de 15 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana Reyna abre las puertas de su tienda de abarrotes para atender a sus clientes, ella es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes de llevarse algo a su casa. Su tienda es muy concurrida, ya que es la mejor equipada de su barrio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que así se puede enterar de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir. Para el Futuro de su negocio, espera arreglar la infraestructura de su tienda. Este será el décimo primer crédito con MFP, por lo que espera la ayuda de todos para cumplir con sus objetivos. En su banco comunal es una socias muy repelada por el oren que pone en le grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Reyna, who is 49 years old, is very sensible and hardworking. She lives in her own house with her two beloved children, Haydee, who is 24, and Carlos, who is 15, to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. Every day, very early in the morning, Reyna opens the doors of her grocery store to attend to her customers. She is a very persuasive seller, and she always convinces her customers to take something home. Her store has a lot of customers, since it is the best-stocked in her neighborhood. What she likes most about her work is conversing with her customers, since this way she can find out the things that are happening in her neighborhood. She has had this business for 10 years and finds that the most difficult part is having to stay inside her store all day, without being able to go out. 

For her business in the future, she hopes to improve the infrastructure of her store. This will be her tenth loan with MFP, for which she awaits the help of everyone to complete her goals. In her communal bank, she is a very respected member for the order that she brings to the group. With the 2000 PEN that she is applying for, she will buy more products to stock her grocery store better.

loans.use: to buy various products to stock her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Don Ismael, de 60 años de edad, habita en el departamento de León, pero nació en el Sauce municipio  de León, esta casado, es padre de 3 hijos todos ellos ya son adultos, el se dedica a manejar un bus escolar, hace recorridos para niños de primaria. El inicio en este negocio por medio de un cuñado que le presto para comprar  un bus, después vendió el bus y compro un carro para trabajar como taxi, después vendió el carro y posteriormente  decidió adquirir un bus escolar y trabajar en transporte escolar  a veces realiza  recorridos privados, pues su experiencia en el área de manejo empezó desde los 18 años.     
Solicito el préstamo para darle mantenimiento mecánico al bus. Con esta inversión espera poder mantener  en perfecto estado mecánico a su bus pues es su medio de trabajo, brindarles un medio de transporte seguro a sus clientes , también brindar confort y comodidad a sus pasajeros. 
Dentro de sus planes futuros comprar otro bus, para hacer viajes por toda Nicaragua, convertir sus recorridos en viajes expresos alrededor de todo el país. Le gustaría hacer contratos con hoteles y empresas  para ofrecer sus servicios.
texts.en:
Don Ismael, who is 60 years of age, lives in an apartment in León but was born in the El Sauce municipality of León. He is married and is the father of three children, all of whom are adults now. He earns his living driving a school bus, making trips for elementary school children. He started in the business thanks to a brother-in-law who gave him a loan to buy a bus. Afterwards he sold the bus and bought a car to use as a taxi. Later he sold the car and then decided to buy a school bus and work in school transport, sometimes making private trips. In all, his experience in the area of driving started 18 years ago. 

He requested this loan to do mechanical maintenance work on the bus. With this investment he hopes to be able to maintain his bus in perfect mechanical condition because this is his means of work and because he wants to provide his clients with safe transport as well as comfort and convenience for his passengers. 

Among his future plans are purchasing another bus to make trips throughout Nicaragua and changing his routes into express trips around the entire country. He would like to get contracts with hotels and businesses in order to offer his services.

loans.use: to do mechanical maintenance work on his bus.

loans.name: Motuli

texts.en:
Motuli is 39 years of age and married with six children. Motuli owns & operates a business venture, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.    Motuli needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase new items to expand product offering.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Motuli joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Motuli's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Charlott

texts.es:
En la Foto estan doña Charlott con su niña de dos años.

La señora Charlott  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 32 años quien hace tres años que se dedica a la venta de frijoles cocidos y leña y poco a poco ha ido creciendo su negocio.
Ella tiene tres hijos de 9, 7 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, los dos mayores están en primaria. Ella invertirá el crédito en aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Charlott and her 2 year-old daughter appear in this photo.

Charlott is a hard-working and entrepreneurial 32 year-old woman who has been selling baked beans and firewood for three years.  She has gradually grown her business.

Charlott has three children aged 9, 7 and 2.  Her two eldest children are in elementary school.  She will invest her loan in increasing her business.

loans.use: to buy beans and firewood

loans.name: Jose Medardo

texts.es:
Jose Medardo tiene 36 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.
