She has been a member of the community bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because of the help that she is receiving. Thanks to the loans, she has a way of earning a living. Erika has a lathe (a machine for cutting 'tagua') which she uses to make buttons (but crudely). She delivers her products to salespeople in Manta who then export them abroad. She works from Monday to Saturday, from 8.30am to 3.00pm. She works six hours a day. She tells us that the work is hard but this is her way of starting to build something for her future. She buys her raw materials from a warehouse in her town which supplies this product. Erika will use this loan to buy 'tagua' and two more lathes so that she can increase her production. Her dream is to own a large company that makes finished buttons.

loans.use: to buy 'tagua' and two lathes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es:
Catalino tiene  57 años de edad. El vive en casa propia, es casado y su domicilio está ubicado en  la parte Rural de este distrito de Morrope.

Catalino cuenta con un terreno agrícola en la zona donde reside. Allí el suele sembrar frijol Bayo, con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de sacar adelante a la economía de su familia. El ya cuenta con varios años  dedicándose a esta actividad y debido a ello conoce mucho del manejo de estos cultivos.

Catalino  desea adquirir fertilizantes para poder asegurarse una buena producción de su cultivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. 

Catalino es una persona bastante hogareña y estimada por las personas de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Catalino is 57 years old living in his own house.  He’s married and his home is located in the rural part of Mórrope District.

Catalino has farmland near where he lives.  He tends to plant brown beans.  Income he earns from this activity is used to support his family.  El has been in this occupation for many years now and because of this he’s very knowledgeable about these crops.

Catalino wants to acquire fertilizer to insure a good crop yield so he’s thought it advisable to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to help him reach his goal.

Catalino is a man who is quite attached to his home and highly esteemed by people in his community.

loans.use: to acquire fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Joselo Ernesto

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí conversamos con Joselo, tiene 32 años,  está casado y de esta relación  tiene dos hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad, la mayor estudia en escuela, su esposa una muy buena ama de casa y también le ayuda en su trabajo.

El se dedica a la artesanía, tiene un torno (máquina para cortar tagua) con la que elabora botones pero en forma cruda, nos cuenta don Joselo que todos los fines de semana el lleva lo que ha elaborado a la ciudad  de Manta para entregar sus productos a comerciantes los mismos que se encargan de exportar a otros países donde les dan el acabado para luego ser comercializados. Trabaja de lunes a viernes ocho horas diarias con la ayuda de su esposa, la materia prima la compra en su localidad en un deposito que le deja a buen precio.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar tagua para la fabricación de los botones. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cinco ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos.
 
Su sueño es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en: Every two weeks, the Virgen del Rosario community bank meets in Colorado, in Montecristi canton. This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts which are nationally and internationally renowned. Most of the people work making buttons from 'tagua', making handicrafts and engaging in general commercial activities. Here we chat to 32 year-old Joselo who is married and has two children aged 7 and 2. His eldest child is in school. Joselo's wife is a very good homemaker and she also helps him in his work. Joselo makes handicrafts. He owns a lathe (a machine for cutting 'tagua') which he uses to make buttons but crudely. He tells us that every weekend he takes what he has made to the city of Manta and delivers his products to salespeople who export them to other countries where they are finished off and then sold. Joselo works from Monday to Friday, eight hours a day, with the help of his wife. He buys his raw materials in a warehouse in his town where they sell at a good price. Joselo will use this loan to buy 'tagua' for making buttons. He has been a member of his community bank for five loan cycles and he likes it because the loans are quick. Joselo's dream is to continue growing in his business.

loans.use: to buy 'tagua'

loans.name: Aleida

texts.es: “El Trasnochosn del sabor” es el nombre que Aleida puso a su negocio de comidas ràpidas, ubicado en el barrio Olaya Herrera de la ciudad e Cartagena, donde vive con su esposo y su hijo de 6 años de edad. Su negocio se ha convertido en un punto de reunión de sus vecinos y transeuntes, a quienes encantan los perros calientes, las hamburguesas, los deditos entre otras delicias que prepara Aleida con el gran sabor que imprime a estos alimentos; Aleida vende diariamete pero los fines de semana sus ventas repuntan, porque es un barrio alegre de gente que se sobrepone a cualquier circunstancia para divertirse y conversar, y  esto es lo que justamente encuentran en el “Trasnochon del Sabor”. Desde que  Aleida está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace 2 años, se notan muchos cambios en su vida, trabaja con su esposo y viven de este negocio, planean juntos salir adelante con su familia y logran poco a poco lo que se proponen, aprovechando bien el capital de trabajo que le brinda esta organización en calidad de préstamo. Su mayor desafio es tener el suficiente capital para adquirir un local propio y diariamente se levantan a trabajar teniendo esta meta   asegurarle a su hijo un futuro prometedor y esto es su mayor motivaciòn. Su credikiva es el tercer financiamiento que hace a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materias primas como salsas en mayor volumen, carnes, embutidos, para lograr mayores descuentos con su compra de contado y poder trasladarle buenos precios de venta a sus clientes, porque cada dia aumenta la competencia y debe ser asertiva en sus dececisiones.
texts.en:
“El Trasnochón del sabor” is the name that Aleida gave her fast food business which is located in Olaya Herrera neighborhood, in the city of Cartagena, where she lives with her husband and 6 year-old son.  Aleida's business has become a meeting place for her neighbors and passersby who love her hotdogs, burgers and 'deditos' (literally 'little fingers') and other delicious food that she prepares.  Her food is very tasty.  Aleida sells her food every day but on weekends her sales pick up because hers is a cheerful neighborhood whose people take advantage of any opportunity to go out, have fun and  chat.  This is exactly what they can do at "Trasnochón del Sabor".

Since Aleida started working with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, two years ago, there have been a lot of changes in her life.  She works together with her husband and they live off this business.  They both plan to get ahead with their family and gradually achieve what they set out to achieve, making the most of the working capital that our organization provides them with through loans.

Aleida's biggest challenge is having enough working capital to acquire her own premises.  Every day she gets up to work with the goal of ensuring that her son has a promising future.  This is her biggest motivation.  This Kiva loan is Aleida's third loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy ingredients such as sauces, meat and cold meats in bulk so that she can obtain larger discounts when paying cash.  This will enable her to pass on good sales prices to her customers because the competition is increasing every day and she must be assertive in her decisions.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sauces, meat and cold meats in bulk so that she can obtain larger discounts

loans.name: Areliz Elizabeth

texts.es:
Areliz, tiene 30 años de edad, es originaria de León, es madre de 2 hijos, de 10 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, ella es dueña de un salón de belleza  y vende ropa, lleva 4 años en el negocio.
Ella empezó con el negocio de salón de belleza con el apoyo de su hermana que vive en los Estados Unidos, ella le ayudo a pagar unos cursos para que aprendiera belleza, ella tenia 25 años después de terminar sus cursos fue que inicó a poner su propio salón de belleza y posteriormente  a vender ropa como otra fuente de ingreso para su familia, de esta manera es que ha sobrevivido ella y su familia.  
Solicito el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza como shampoo, cremas, cosméticos, tintes. Con esta inversión tener  surtido su salón con nuevos y mejores productos, que le permita atraer más clientes, mejorar sus ingresos. En sus planes futuros esta tener su propio local.  
Su meta próxima es construir su casa y poner su salón de belleza en su casa.
texts.en:
Areliz, 30, is from León.  She is the mother of two children who are 10 and 2 years of age respectively.  She owns a beauty salon and sells clothes.  She’s been in business four years.

She started the beauty salon with help from her sister who lives in the United States.  She helped her pay for some courses so she could learn the beauty trade.  She was 25 years old and when she finished her courses she started to set up her own beauty salon.  Later on, she started to sell clothes as another source of family income.  This is how she and her family have survived to date.

She asked for the loan to buy beauty products like: shampoo, creams, cosmetics and hair coloring.  She hopes this investment will help her have her salon stocked with new and better products that will attract more customers and improve her income.  In her future plans is owning her own locale.  Her next goal is to build her house and install her beauty salon there.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Wilber Edwin

texts.es: El joven wilber tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero vive en casa de su padre, wilber se dedica a manejar una moto taxi, viene realizando esta actividad durante 1 año aproximadamente, esta labor la realiza solo de lunes a viernes y los sábados, domingo y feriados se dedica a trabajar en el campo, generando así otros ingresos, el dinero del préstamo será invertido en comprar una moto taxi , y con ello poder ahorrar para poder estudiar una carrera corta, los desafíos que enfrenta es tener que salir a trabajar muy temprano para ganar un poco mas de dinero, el sueño de wilber es comprarse en un futuro no muy lejano un automóvil y así eso le genere mayores ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida, wilber esta muy contento con confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Wilber is a 21 year old young man.  He is single, and he lives in his father’s house.  Wilber drives a “moto taxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle).  He has been doing this for approximately one year.  He only does this on Monday through Friday.  On Saturday, Sunday, and holidays he does field work.  This generates other income.

He will use the money from the loan to buy a moto taxi.  With the moto taxi he will be able to save in order to be able to study for a career.

The challenge he faces is having to leave very early in order to earn a little more money. 

Wilber’s dream is to buy a car in the not so distant future.  It will generate greater income, and he will have a better quality of life.

He is very happy with the confidence placed in him.

loans.use: to buy a moto taxi.

loans.name: Bertha Piedad

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Bertha, tiene 65 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció y la dejo sola con sus seis hijos los mismos que en la actualidad ya son mayores de edad, el menor de ellos aun vive en su casa.
 
Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que busco la forma de sacar adelante a sus hijos,  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, trabaja los tres últimos días de la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y nos cuenta que la mayor parte de sus ventas las hace bajo pedido, en estos tres días  ella  realiza las ventas, entrega los pedidos y cobra ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Compra su mercadería  en Guayaquil ya que allá consigue más variedad de productos. Lleva tres años en este negocio, antes se dedicaba a otra actividad pero no le fue tan bien como con el negocio de ropa.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar jean de mujeres y hombres, camisetas y blusas ya que tiene muchos encargos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por las reuniones educativas ya que aprende mucho.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener un almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
The Virgen Del Rosario Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Colorado in the Montecristi canton.  It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture.  It is also known for its handicrafts, which are recognized on a national and international level.  Most of the inhabitants here devote themselves to making buttons out of “tagua” (Tagua has been called 'vegetable ivory' because the hard tagua nut has a white endosperm similar to elephant ivory), handicrafts, and general commerce.

This is where we meet Bertha, age 65.  Several years ago her beloved husband died.  His death left her alone with their six children.  Now they are adults, and the youngest still lives in her house.

She is a very good housewife who searched for the way to get her children ahead.  She sells all types of clothes.  She works the last three days of the week, and she sells door to door.  She tells us that the majority of her sales are done through orders.  On these three days she makes sales, delivers orders, and collects because she extends credit.  She collects every two weeks.  

She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil because that is where she gets a greater variety of products.  She has had this business for three years.  Before that she had another business activity, but it did not go as well for her as her clothing business.

She will use this loan to buy women’s and men’s jeans, t-shirts, and blouses because she has a lot of orders.  She has been in the communal bank from its inception.  She likes the educational meetings because she learns a lot.

Her goals are to get ahead in her business and to have a clothing store.

loans.use: to buy women’s and men’s jeans, t-shirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina vive en su ciudad desD. hace más D. 30 años, es viuda, permanece en su casa con la compañía D. sus 3 hijos. DesD. hace 5 años venD. ropa D. bebe, es así que cada fin D. semana ofrece en la feria comercial D. su ciudad. Siempre se abastece D. mercadería D. manera constante porque  siempre hay ventas  que le permiten recuperar lo invertido, algunas prendas D. lana las teje a crochet,  para “nunca perder el tiempo” como ella misma lo dice. Cada 15 día o dependiendo D. la situación viaja a la ciudad D. Lima para poder comprar mas mercadería, buscando siempre novedades en confecciones y los mas cómodo que le permita vender en su ciudad ofreciendo ofertas y rebajas a su clientela. Tiene la ayuda del menor D. sus hijos que la acompaña frecuentemente en sus ventas, Doña Cristina tiene el deseo D. incrementar su capital  porque sabe que es vital para el crecimiento D. su negocio. Ya son 21 veces que tiene un crédito con MFP, con este admirable record y trayectoria en la cuales ha sido una cliente muy puntual D. sus pagos disfruta D. trabajar D. manera grupal porque confía en cada una D. sus integrantes y han demostrado su solidaridad en todos estos años. Con el crédito que solicita, va a renovar su mercadería e incrementar su capital D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Cristina has lived in her city for over 30 years.  She is a widow, and she lives in her house with her three children.  She has been selling baby clothes for five years.  She sells in her city’s commercial fair every week-end.  She always stocks her merchandise in a constant way because she always has sales that allow her to recoup her investment.

She crochets some garments, but “never wastes time”, as she herself says.  Every two weeks, or depending on the situation, she travels to the city of Lima to be able to buy more merchandise.  She is always looking for clothing that is new and the most comfortable.  This allows her to sell in her city and to offer her customers special offers and sales.

Her youngest child helps her and frequently accompanies her when she goes to make sales.  Cristina has the desire to increase her capital because she knows that it is vital to the growth of her business.

She has had 21 loans from MFP.  She has an admirable record and experience.  She has been a good client and very punctual with her payments.  She enjoys working as a group because she trusts each of the members, and they have demonstrated their solidarity in all of these years.

She will use the requested loan to bring her merchandise up to day and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy varied colors of wool.

loans.name: Cielo Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Cielo lo integran tres personas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas. La coordinador es el señor Santiago quien desde hace 4 años se dedica al comercio de ropa y calzado. El con el crédito comprará mercadería como camisas, pantalones, zapatos…etc.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son la señora Mirna quien tiene un taller de costura y vende su mercadería en el mercado oriental y María Teresa vende nacatamales.
texts.en:
The Cielo group is made up of three hard-working, entrepreneurial and determined people.  The group's coordinator is Santiago who has been selling clothes and footwear for four years.  He will use his loan to buy merchandise such as shirts, pants, shoes, etc.

The other members of the group are Mirna, who has a sewing workshop and sells her merchandise in the Mercado Oriental market, and María Teresa who sells nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales).

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear

loans.name: Ana Viviana

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 27 años  de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 12, 8 y 4 años de edad, los mayores estudian en escuela y el menor en jardín de infantes. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Está  en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios,  es la fiscal de pagos del banco y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a personas como ella para sacar adelante sus negocios y su vida.

Es una muy buena madre que para que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas).  También se dedica a la elaboración y venta de harina de pescado. Trabaja todos los  días de la semana en ambas actividades, nos cuenta que ella se desplaza a Manta para comprar la parte del pescado que no se utilizan para fabricar el atún, para luego trasladarlos hasta su casa y procesarlos para hacer la harina de pescado, la misma que luego entrega a comerciantes que la exportan al extranjero. Lleva 8 años en esta actividad y le ha ido bien.

Este crédito lo va a ultilizar en sus dos negosios, una parte para comprar perfumes, cremas, bisutería y otra parte para comprar pescado para elaborar la harina.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos tengan un buen porvenir.
texts.en:
The Virgen Del Rosario Community Bank meets every 15 days in Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts that are recognized nationally and worldwide. In this town, the majority of the residents make buttons out of tagua nuts and handicrafts, as well as participate in general commerce.

Here we meet Ana. She is 27 years old, a single mother with three children who are 12, eight, and four years old. The older ones go to school and the youngest is in preschool. She live in her parents' home. She has been with the community bank since it started. She is in charge of making payments to the bank, and she likes the organization for the help that it gives people like her to succeed in their businesses and in life.

She is a very good mother who never lets her children lack anything. She sells Yanbal products (beauty, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). She also makes and sells fish flour ***. She works every day of the week doing both businesses. She tells us that she travels to Manta to purchase the part of the fish that they don't use for making tuna, and then she takes it back home and processes it to make fish flour, which she delivers to merchants to export. She has been doing this for eight years, and it has gone well.

She will use this loan for both her businesses. One part for buying perfumes, creams, and costume jewelry, and the other part for buying fish to turn into flour.

Her dream is that her children will have a good future.

***Fish flour (harina de pescado) is a high-energy feed for a variety of farm animals. It is rich in proteins and amino acids.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, costume jewelry, and fish

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María vive en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde radica en una casa alquilada y en la compañía de sus  2 hijos. tiene 6 años de experiencia en ventas de ropa y cosméticos, se inicio en este negocio vendiendo al menudeo y ofreciendo a sus amistades y poco a poco ha ido creciendo en este negocio con el apoyo financiero de los prestamos anteriores que en la actualidad tiene un mejor capital de trabajo. Hoy iene un puesto estable de ventas en la ciudad de Huancavelica, una ciudad próxima a la que actualmente radica y donde viaja  todos los fines de semana de manera infaltable para vender su mercadería en la feria comercial de ese lugar. Por el crecimiento sostenido de su negocio ha decidido abarcar un poco más en sus anhelos de crecimiento por lo que desea aumentar su capital de trabajo. Este es su crédito número 24 con MFP, tiene un historial de crédito limpio porque en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal que integra por muchas razones pero principalmente porque recibe útiles consejos que le permiten crecer. En esta oportunidad con el dinero incrementará su capital de trabajo ya que comprará mas pendas de vestir y de mejor calidad.
texts.en: María lives in the city of Huancayo, where she resides in a rented home with her two children. She has six years' experience selling clothes and cosmetics. She started this business selling a few little things to her friends, and little by little has grown this business with the financial support of previous loans. She now has better working capital. Now she has a stable place of business in the city of Huancavelica, a city close to where she currently lives and where she faithfully travels every weekend to sell her merchandise in the local market. Because of the sustained growth in her business, she has decided to go a little further with her ambitions because she wants to increase her working capital. This is her 24th loan with Kiva partner MFP. She has had a clean credit history this whole time because she has been punctual with her payments. She is grateful to be part of the community bank that she participates in for many reasons, but chiefly because she receives useful advice that helps her grow. With this loan, she will increase her working capital and purchase more clothing items that are of better quality.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing items

loans.name: Lourdes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Lourdes lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas una de ellas es la señora Claudia quien se dedica al comercio de gallinas en el mercado. Ella cría gallinas y luego las vende desde hace varios años  y en este negocio es que invertirá el crédito en purina y vacunas etc.
Los otros integrantes son Manuel quien tiene un taller de costura hace 8 años  e invertirá el crédito en telas e hilos y Gloria se dedica al comercio de gallina.
texts.en:
The Lourdes group is comprised of three hardworking, entrepreneurial, and driven people, one of whom is Claudia. She sells chickens at market. She has been raising chickens and selling them for several years. She will use the loan for purines ***, vaccines, etc.

The other group members are Manuel, who has had a tailor shop for eight years and who will use the loan for thread and fabric, and Gloria, who sells chickens.

***Purine is an organic compound found in meat. Plant-based diets (like chickens would have) are generally low in purines.

loans.use: to raise chickens

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda radica por más de 20 años en Huancayo, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Hace 11 años aprovecho la oportunidad de la ubicación estratégica de su casa en su barrio y la necesidad que hay de un establecimiento ferretero  así que decidió invertir sus ahorros en este negocio. Se ocupa de la administración y ventas en  su establecimiento que en la actualidad se mantiene estable porque también vende agregados (arena y piedra) cuyo almacén es el patio amplio de su casa. Sus 4 hijos y su esposo  colaboran con Yolanda en la atención y compra de más mercadería. Toda su familia tiene como meta mejorar este negocio y ser un gran abastecedor de productos de construcción. Ya tiene un amplio historial crediticio y record de ser un cliente puntual en sus pagos, pues este será su 24 crédito con MFP. En todo este tiempo los créditos han sido una gran aliada para el mantenimiento de su capital y el crecimiento de su negocio. En esta ocasión con el dinero comprará artículos de tuberías al por mayor.
texts.en: Yolanda has lived in Huancayo for more than 20 years. She lives with her husband and four children. Eleven years ago, she took advantage of the strategic location of her home in her neighborhood and of the need for a hardware store in the area. She decided to invest her savings in this business. She is in charge of making sales and managing her business, which is now stable because she also sells extra items (sand and gravel) . Her warehouse is on the large patio next to her house. Her four children and her husband help Yolanda with monitoring and ordering more merchandise. The whole family shares the goal of improving the business and being a major supplier of construction materials. She already has a long credit history and record of being punctual with her payments. This will be her 24th loan through Kiva partner MFP. Over all this time, the loans have been a great help in maintaining capital and business growth. This time the loan will be used to purchase pipes wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase pipes

loans.name: Guadalupe Dionicio

texts.es:
El señor Guadalupe Dionicio es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor propietario de una pulpería la cual inicio con la venta de dulces y chiverías, poco a poco fue surtiendo el negocio hasta vender gas propano y recargas. El con el crédito comprara azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aceite, gas y recargas…etc.

El señor Guadalupe está casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales en su tiempo libre le ayudan en el negocio.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Dionicio is a hardworking and entrepreneurial man who owns a grocery store that he started by selling sweets and dairy products. Little by little he grew his business until he was (also) selling propane gas and refills. With this loan he will purchase sugar, rice, beans, (cooking) oil, gas and refills, etc.

Guadalupe is married and has two children who help him with his business in their free time.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, beans, cooking oil, propane gas and refills, etc.

loans.name: Liliam

texts.es: Liliam es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien tiene una pulpería la cual inicio con la venta de chiverías y además comercializa ropa al crédito este último lo inicio hace poco. Ella es casada tiene dos hijos por los cuales labora arduamente. El crédito lo invertirá en mercadería para ambos negocios como granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, maíz), chiverías y ropa (camisas, pantalones, vestidos…etc.)
texts.en:
Liliam is a hard-working woman, who is both vigorous and enterprising. She has a general store that she initiated to sell dairy products. Now, she sells many products, including clothing on credit. She began to sell clothes only recently.

Liliam is married and has 2 children on whose behalf she labors arduously. This loan will be invested in merchandise for both parts of her business: basic grains (rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, corn, dairy products), and clothing (shirts, pants, dresses, etc.).

loans.use: buy basic grains (rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, corn, dairy products), and clothing (shirts, pants, dresses), to sell.

loans.name: Marjorie Alexander

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Marjorie, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 3 y de 1 año de edad. El marido es artesano.
 
Ella como buena mujer ayuda a su esposo en su negocio y es para quien solicita el crédito, ellos tienen un taller en el cual fabrican botones hechos con tagua. Allí en su taller ellos se encargan de cortar este material tan duro pero gracias a  un torno (máquina para cortar tagua) las cosas se le facilitan y elaboran este producto pero en forma cruda, producto que luego entregan en Manta a comerciantes que los envían al extranjero para que allá les den el acabado necesario para su venta. Trabajan de lunes a viernes ocho horas diarias, nos cuenta que tienen su pequeño taller seis años y que gracias a Dios siempre les ha ido bien.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar tagua para la fabricación de los botones. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cuatro ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos ella colabora para salir adelante con su familia.
 
Su sueño es tener una casa propia ya que viven con familiares.
texts.en:
The Virgin del Rosario Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Colorado, Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and handicrafts which are recognized at the national and international level. The majority of the local inhabitants make “tagua” buttons, handicrafts, and are engaged in general commerce.

Here we meet Marjorie, 21 years old, who is in a common law relationship and has 2 children, aged 3 and 1. Her husband is an artisan.

Good woman that she is, Marjorie helps her husband in his business, and it is for their business that she solicits a loan. They have a workshop in which they make buttons from 'tagua' nuts. In the shop they cut this very hard material, thanks to a lathe that makes the job easier. They make buttons in a crude form, then deliver them to merchants in Manta who ship them abroad to be finished and sold. They work from Monday through Friday, 8 hours a day. They have had their little workshop for 6 years and, thanks to God, things have always gone well for them.

This loan will be used for buying tagua nuts to make into buttons. Majorie has been a member of her communal bank for 4 loan cycles and she likes it because with these loans, she and her husband can collaborate and advance her family.

loans.use: buy tagua nuts from which to make buttons.

loans.name: Petrona De Los Angeles

texts.es: Petrona De Los Ángeles se dedica a una pulpería. Tiene más de 6 años, es una persona muy trabajadora. Inicio este medio de vida como una alternativa de trabajo, porque no tenía el medio de ingreso necesario para mantener a su familia y necesitaba proporciónale el pan de cada día. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, detergentes, granos básicos, jugos, gaseosas entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar cada día sus ingresos pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar y proporcionar lo necesario.
texts.en:
Petrona De Los Ángeles has had a grocery store for over six years.  She is a very hard-working person.  She started this way of life as a work alternative because she did not have the means to get the income needed to support her family.  She needed to provide them with their daily bread.

The reason for the loan is to buy products like sweets, detergent, basic grains, juice, soft drinks, and others.

She dreams of improving her income each day.  She has always liked to work and to provide what is necessary.

loans.use: to buy products like sweets, detergent, basic grains, juice, soft drinks, and others.

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Felipe, de 59 años, habita en la comunidad Santa Teresa ubicada en Condega municipio de Estelí, esta casado, tiene 6 hijos , el es agricultor. El empezó en esta actividad gracias a su padre quien le enseño el oficio de la siembra, preparar  terrenos para cultivar, al transcurrir los años se independizo de su papa trabajando muy duro desde tempranas horas de la madrugada  el logro comprar su propia finca donde siembra maíz y frijoles, también tiene otros ingresos como es el ganado el vende leche, el lo comercializa dentro de su misma comunidad, tiene a trabajadores que le ayudan a sembrar.  
El solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de tres manzanas de frijol, compra de abono, pago de mano de obra, compra de fertilizantes. Con esta inversión espera poder sacar una buena producción y obtener mejores ingresos. En lo futuro le gustaría tener en su finca con un buen sistema  de pasto que le permita sacar una alta producción leche.
texts.en:
Felipe, 59, lives in the community of Santa Teresa located in Condega, Estelí.  He’s married and has six children.  He’s a farmer.  He started this occupation thanks to his father who taught him how to farm and prepare the soil for planting.  In time, he became independent from his father working hard from very early in the morning.  He managed to buy his own farm where he grows beans and corn.  He also earns additional income raising cattle; he sells milk in his own community.  He hires laborers to help him plant.

He is asking for the loan for maintenance of his three manzanas (Central American unit of land measurement) of bean crop, to buy manure, to pay labor costs and to buy fertilizer.  He hopes the investment will lead to a good harvest and better income.  In the future, he’d like to have a farm with good pasturage so that he can increase milk production.

loans.use: to care for his bean crops, purchase manure, pay labor costs and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy computer replacement parts.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en: Loida, 39 years of age, is married to a farmer and is blessed with 1 child. Loida has been operating her food vending business for almost 2 years. She's asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional frozen foods to sell in the public market. Her net income is 12,000 PHP a month. She would like to continue receiving loans of larger quantities in her next loan cycles to further assist in the growth and development of her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Aurenila

texts.en: Aurenila is 45 years of age, widowed, and a mother of three. She has been engaged in the livestock business for almost 21 years. She's asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed to supplement her hogs. Her net income when she sells a hog is 20,000 PHP every three months. She is glad that her livestock business income now is enough to support her children’s education. She wants to thank Kiva lenders for their financial assistance in availing the loan and hopes that lenders will continue to fund her loan requests in the future.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Junnior Alonso

texts.es: El joven junnior, es soltero, trabajador  y vive en casa de sus padres quienes también trabajan y juntos están en la lucha de llegar a crecer y mejorar su calidad de vida, junnior se dedica a vender hamburguesas y salchipapas en las noches teniendo una gran acogida, y también se dedica a otra activad que es la crianza de cerdos, con lo cual le genera otros ingresos, junnior esta solicitando el crédito para comprar unas mesa y sillas para su negocio además de comprar algunos utensilios e insumos para el mismo, el sueño de junnior en el futuro es crecer mas en su negocio además de invertir en comprar mas cerdos y así tener mas ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida, junnior esta muy agradecido por la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Junnior is single, and he is hard-working young man.  He lives in his parents’ house; they also work.  They struggle together to grow and to improve their quality of life.

Junnior sells hamburgers and “salchipapas” (a traditional dish made from fried potatoes, fried sausages and condiments).  He sells at night with great success.

He also has another business activity, raising pigs.  This business generates other income.

Junnior is requesting the loan to buy tables and chairs for his business.  He will also buy some utensils and supplies for the business.

Junnior’s dream for the future is for his business to grow more.  He also wants to invest in buying more pigs.  That way he will have more income in order to improve his quality of life.  Junnior is very grateful for the trust being placed in him.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and utensils for his business

loans.name: Hernane

texts.en:
Hernane is a married man with 5 children. He is a farmer who tills land in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. Hernane grows rice and vegetables. He works hard to earn money and feed his family.

Hernane plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes for this loan to help increase his harvest. Hernane's dream is for his children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 39 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 16 years old. 

Joy is a farmer who tills land in Surallah, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for 9 years. Joy plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her farm to be productive. She also hopes for her children to finish college and to be successful.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 38 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 19 years old while the youngest is 15. Luisa’s husband works as a farmer and a local photographer.

Luisa is engaged in farming. She helps her husband till their land and cultivate it for cropping. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Luisa does her best to support her family. She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

In the future, Luisa hopes for her children to finish college and be successful.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a 40-year-old married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 20 years old and the youngest is 11. Melanie’s husband works as a farmer and carpenter.

Melanie is also a farmer. She helps her husband grow rice crops. She also grows root crops like taro. Melanie plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 44 years old and is a married woman with 5 children. Her eldest is 17 years old and the youngest is 5 years old. 

Mercy is a farmer. She grows corn, rice and vegetables. Mercy sells her harvest at her town’s local market. She works hard to feed her children and send them to school. Mercy has requested a loan that she plans to use to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is 29 years old and is a married woman with a 1-year-old child. She is a farmer who tills land in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. Michelle needs farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers so she applied for a loan to fund her farm. She hopes to earn more and to be able to save for her child’s future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 56 years old, married and has two children. She is engaged in farming. She primarily grows rice to sell. Nida needs fertilizers and other farm inputs. She requested a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. so she could fund her farm. Nida hopes to have a productive farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Petronilo

texts.en:
54-year-old Petronilo earns a living through farming. He grows rice, corn and vegetables. He sells his harvest at his town’s local market.

Petronilo plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and dry goods. He hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and dry goods

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 32 years old, married and has two children aged nine and seven. Richard is a farmer form the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. He tills his own land where he grows corn and rice crops. He plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Richard hopes for this loan to help improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rodito

texts.en:
Rodito is a 51-year-old married man with 5 children. He has been engaged in farming for 30 years. He grows corn and rice crops. Rodito also raises chickens and sell their eggs.

Rodito will use his loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to improve his family’s living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Silverio

texts.en: Silverio is 57 years old, married and has 4 children. He is a farmer and tills his own land located in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. Silverio grows rice and vegetables. He sells his harvest at his town’s market. Silverio works hard to provide for the needs of his family. He requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. Silverio hopes to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with 2 children. She lives in Surallah, South Cotabato with her family.

Susan is engaged in farming. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. She also raises chickens to sell their eggs. Susan plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and chicken feed. Susan hopes to have a progressive business. She also wishes for her children to finish college and to have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and chicken feed

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ligia es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo e hijos , los planes hacia un futuro es poder brindarle una mejor condición de vida , apoyando en sus estudios para que logren ser profesionales , doña Ligia sus créditos anteriores los invertía en su negocio de ropo ahora quiere mejor la vivienda , realizando una división y el repellado de la misma; agradece Afodenic  atrávez de  fondo Kiva , la confianza que le brinda para que puede cumplir sus sueños ya que es de escasos recursos y no puede comprar de una solo vez todos los materiales de construcción .
texts.en:
Ligia lives in the Ticuantepe municipality with her husband and children.  Her future plans are to be able to provide them with better living conditions, and to support their education so that they can become professionals.

Ligia used her previous loans to invest in her clothing business.  Now, she wants to improve her home.  She will build a partition and plaster it.

She is grateful to Afodenic and the Kiva funds.  She is grateful for the trust shown in her so that she will be able to make her dreams come true.  She has scarce resources, and she is not able to buy all of the construction materials at once.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Thelma is 58 years old and has one child who is in school. 

Thelma has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. 

Thelma has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Thelma would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 52 years old and married with one child. 

Sandra is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Sandra requested a 19,500 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

In the future, Sandra would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rolando Concepcion

texts.es: El señor Rolando, es un pequeño agricultor del municipio de Ticuantepe , los planes hacia su familia es poder apoyar a su hermana en sus estudios ya que desde que falleció  su mamá él se hace responsable de los gastos del hogar  , don Rolando la mayor afectación  que se le presenta en el cultivo de aguacate es la falta de fertilizantes e insumos para poder sacar calidad y así de la misma manera tenga una buena paga . Agradece Afodenic  atrávez de fondo Kiva la confianza y el apoyo. Ya que si esto no fuese posible no podría salir hacia adelante como un pequeño productor .
texts.en: Rolando is a small farmer from Ticuantepe who supports his family since his mother passed away. In order to meet expenses, Rolando grows avocados for the local market, but needs fertilizer and supplies to grow better quality produce to sell at a better price. He is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for their support and trust.  Without access to credit, Rolando would not be able to prosper as a small farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer supplies

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 54 years old and married with four children. 

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Amelita is borrowing 29,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. 

Amelita has been farming sugarcane for 20 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Heyling Carolina

texts.es: La señora Heyling , es una pequeña agricultora del municipio de Ticuantepe , los planes hacia su familia es brindarle una mejor condición de vida a sus pequeños hijos , doña Heyling desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de pitahaya la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden el cultivo ya que estos carecen de insumos necesarios para combatir las mismas .Ella agradece Afodenic  que atrávez de los fondo Kiva obtiene un financiamiento para inducir las plantas y darles un mejor cuido ya que esto favorece de mucho obteniendo frutas de muy buen tamaño , color y sobre todo su sabor natural .
texts.en: Mrs. Heyling is an agricultural worker from the town of Ticuantepe. Her family plans consist of being able to offer her small children a better quality of life. For many years she has been growing Dragon fruit, or pitaya. Her biggest obstacles are the plagues that invade her crops since it costs her more money to battle them. She thanks Afodenic for, via Kiva funds, will obtain a loan to grow and better maintain her plants since it would be very beneficial to have fruits of favorable size, color, and most importantly natural taste.

loans.use: buy fertilizers for her dragon fruit crops.

loans.name: Erdenee

texts.en: Erdenee is 42 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His two children go to a local secondary school and his wife is a salesperson at a small, private store. He manages a woodworking business in his town. He started his business in 2003 and has gained much experience. He makes all kinds of household goods such as tables, chairs and kitchen furniture. He is a polite and hardworking man who says, "I will build many gers, Mongolian yurts, this coming summer so I want to buy large amount of wood with the loan." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Anna Maria

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Anna Maria works hard to support her family. 

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Anna Maria is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase a fishing net and other fishing equipment for her business. 

Anna Maria has been sustaining her business activities with her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: La señor a Maria , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo eh  hijos , el esposo labora en una empresa privada para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , con el primer crédito logro realizar las divisiones de  la vivienda , ahora quiere que se le apoye para la compra de piedras , cemento , arena , etc . Ya que con esto va a construir el muro delantero de la vivienda .  Agradece Afodenic ya que atrávez de los fondos Kiva sus condiciones de vida van mejorando poco a poco  según sus posibilidades.
texts.en: Maria lives in the town of Ticuantepe, together with her husband and children.  Her husband works for a private company in order to support her with their household expenses.  María's plans for the future are to improve her living conditions.  She used her first loan to split up her house into separate rooms.  Now she would like your support in buying stone, cement, sand etc. to build the front wall of her home.  She is grateful to Afodenic since, through Kiva funds, her living conditions are gradually improving in accordance with her means.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Norjmoo

texts.en:
Norjmoo is 51-year-old widow who lives with her three children in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her older two children help with the family business and the youngest one attends the local secondary school. 

She manages a construction materials business and a pool service in her town. She started her business in 2007 and has been able to build a strong customer base. She purchases her construction materials 1-2 times a month from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. During summer she conducts her construction business. She also manages a household goods trading business to supplement her earnings during winter. Now she is one of the experienced businesswomen in her town. She is a polite and kind woman who says, "I am planning to expand my business in order to better my life." She is requesting a 350,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 42 years old and married with two children. 

Edna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a 50,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her store. 

Edna has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her store for 16 years and also earns an income from renting a sound system and the retail of rice. 

Edna aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family and send her children to college.

loans.use: To puchase materials for the repair of her store

loans.name: Oreste Javier

texts.es: El señor Oreste, es un pequeño agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe , al igual que se esposa e hijos ,  su esposa le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que labora por si sola , los planes hacia un futuro es poder brindarle una mejor condición de vida , don Oreste desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presento que fue estafado con el producto lo cual lo llevo al incumplimiento de su crédito . Ahora se siente muy contento por la confianza y el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva para    seguir con su cultivo.
texts.en: Señor Oreste is a small farmer.  He lives with his wife and children in the Ticuantepe area.  His wife, who works alone, helps him with the household expenses.  His plans for the future are to be able to improve his living conditions.  Don Oreste has been growing pineapple for several years.  He suffered a  major set back when he was cheated with the product which caused him to default on his loan.  Now he is very happy because Afodenic and Kiva have placed their trust in him and given him the support he needs to continue farming.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea is 32 years old; his wife, Mon, is 31 years old. They live in a village off National Road number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1999 and have three daughters. All of them are in school.  

Sophea sells kitchenware. He buys kitchenware from Phnom Penh market and sells in other places around Phnom Penh. His wife grows vegetables. Sophea is asking for a loan of $1,000 to expand his business by buying additional kitchenware for sale.   

Photo: Sophea and his wife.

loans.use: To expand his business by buying additional kitchenware for sale.

loans.name: Jose Feliciano

texts.es: El señor José , es un pequeño agricultor de la zona de San Ignacio , junto a su esposa e hijos , los planes hacia su familia es poder brindarle un mejor bienestar , don José desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de pitahaya , la mayor afectación son las plagas que invaden el cultivo , el financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos que requiere la plantación , para que pueda dar una mejor fruta tanto en el tamaño, color y maduración . Agradece Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva el apoyo que le brinda ya que sin esta ayuda las personas de escasos recursos no podrían salir adelante.
texts.en: Mr. Jose is an agricultural worker from the San Ignacio area. He lives with his wife and children. His family plans consist of being able to offer them a better quality of life. For various years he has been growing dragon fruit, or pitaya. His biggest obstacles are the plagues that invade his crops. He wants to use the loan to buy fertilizers and supplies he needs for the plantation so that he can grow fruits of favorable size, color, and ripeness. He thanks Afondenic, via Kiva funds, for the support offered since without their help individuals with scarce resources would not be able to succeed.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco , es un pequeño agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa e hijos , don Francisco su planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , la mayor afectación que se le presenta en el cultivo es no poder contar con suficiente capital para estar dando el mantenimiento necesario al cultivo , para que este salga en tiempo forma sin tener perdidas en tamaño , color , sabor y sobre todo en lo natural .Agradece Afodenic  atrávez de los fondo Kiva  el apoyo que le brinda a los productores para que puedan realizar su manteniendo de piña  ya que es su recurso para poder sobre vivir .
texts.en: Francisco is a small-scale farmer from Ticuantepe.  He lives together with his wife and children.  Francisco's plan for the future is to improve his living conditions.  The biggest problem he has in growing his crops is not having enough capital to provide the maintenance the crops need so that they grow on time without their height, color or taste suffering, above all, that they grow naturally.  He is grateful to Afodenic who, through Kiva funds, provide support to producers such as himself.  This means that he can provide necessary maintenance to his pineapple crops since this is how he makes money to support himself.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is 48 years old and is a married woman with 5 children. The oldest child is 27 years old and the youngest is 17. Vicky has had a sari-sari store for 2 years. She sells items like noodles, detergent soap and purified water. She earns about 2000 PHP per month from the store. Vicky also cooks viands that she sells around the neighborhood during lunch time. 

Vicky requested a loan of 5000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as noodles, shampoo and purified water. Vicky hopes to earn better and be able to expand her store.

loans.use: buy more items to sell

loans.name: Miguel De Los Santos

texts.es: El señor Miguel es un pequeños agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe,  junto a su esposa e hijos , los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Miguel desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña la mayor  afectación es no poder contar con el capital suficiente para la inversión de fertilizantes e insumos y darle un buen mantenimiento agrícola  a su cultivo . Agrace Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva la confianza que le brinda para poder salir hacia adelante y algún día poder llegar a ser un gran agricultor.
texts.en: Señor Miguel is a small farmer.  He lives with his wife and children in the Ticuantepe area.  His plans for the future are to be able to improve his living conditions.  Don Miguel has been growing pineapples for several years.  The biggest challenge he faces is not having enough capital to invest in fertilizers and supplies to maintain his crops properly.  He is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for the confidence they place in him so that he can get ahead and some day become a large scale farmer.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 34 years old and is a married woman with 2 children aged 10 and 9. She has had a sari-sari store for 6 years. Beatriz sells items like noodles, canned goods and detergent soap to the people in her community.

Beatriz requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as noodles, sugar, coffee and detergent soap. She hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: buy more products to sell

loans.name: Rafael Arturo

texts.es: El señor Rafael , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la mayor afectación que se le presenta son la alza de los productos y la impuntualidad de pagos de sus clientes , los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , el financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de pacas de ropa de segunda y así vender , ya que la ropa nueva muy poco la vende . Agradece la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva para mejorar las condiciones de vida y crecer como comerciante .
texts.en:
Rafael lives in the town of Ticuantepe together with his wife.  The biggest problems that he faces in his business are rising product prices and customers who don't pay on time.  His plans for the future are to improve his living conditions.

Rafael would like this loan to buy bundles of second-hand clothes to sell, since he doesn't sell very many new clothes.  He is grateful for the trust that Afodenic are placing in him by providing him with access to Kiva funds in order to improve his living conditions and grow as a salesman.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Pilagia

texts.en:
Pilagia is 51 years old and married with three children. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Pilagia is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

Pilagia has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and the buying and selling of livestock. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 52-year-old married lady. She is an excellent mother of her four adult-aged children. Esther established a buy and sell business eight  years ago. Then she established a new additional business: a motorcycle with sidecar. She has been engaged in this business for five years with a monthly income of PHP 15,000. To develop her business further, she requested a loan of PHP 50,000 from GDMPC to purchase a brand new motorcycle.

Esther has been a member in good standing of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Esther wants to become a businesswoman who owns a transportation service business.

loans.use: To purchase a brand new motorcycle.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 47 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Fe works very hard to provide for them. 

Fe runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines; she requested a 29,500 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for it. 

Fe has been in this business for 16 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, sardines, noodles, etc. 

In the future Fe would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en: Marcelo is 52 years old and is married to an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker). They are blessed with 2 children. He has been engaged in a livestock business raising hogs for almost 10 years.   His net income is 12,000 PHP every three months.   He is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional feed for his hogs. He hopes that KIVA lenders will continue to assist him in the business so that he can further improve it and support his family with enough basic necessities.

loans.use: purchase feed for his hogs

loans.name: Mema

texts.en:
Mema is 45 years old and married with four children. 

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice shop in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. 

Mema has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her rice shop for eight years and also earns an income from being a motorcycle operator. 

Mema hopes to build and expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Josué Ovidio

texts.es: Josué Ovidio de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive con su compañera de vida en casa propia. El posee una carnicería como negocio y es con la cual mantiene su hogar; Su carnicería es muy conocida por las personas de la localidad pues vende las mejores carnes, de mucha calidad a un buen precio además el negocio siempre se mantiene muy higiénico y la amabilidad de Josué es incomparable. El es una persona  emprendedora, sabe que el triunfo de un verdadero hombre viene del sudor del duro trabajo que realiza cada día, siempre está con la mejor disposición de seguirse superando es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mas mercadería carnes de todo tipo para siempre satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela. Josué tiene la confianza que al crecer su negocio podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y cumplirá su sueño de mantener en su hogar una seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Josué Ovidio is fifty-one years old and lives with his life partner in his own house.  He owns a butcher shop and this is how he supports his household.  His butcher shop is very well-known by the people in his town since he sells high quality meats at a good price.  He also keeps his business very clean and Josué's friendly nature in incomparable.  He is an enterprising person.  He knows that an honest man's success comes from the sweat of his brow.  He works with the best attitude so he can continue to excel.  It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan through Integral which will allow him to buy all types of meats so that he will always satisfy his customer's needs.  

Josué trusts that he will be able to grow his business, give his family a better quality of life and fulfill his dream of being financially secure.

loans.use: purchase meats for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Ric Marcial

texts.en:
Ric Marcial is 42 years old and lives in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental Philippines. He is a married man and a father of two school-age children.

Ric Marcial has a retail store that sells basic food items like, rice, corn, oil, milk and sugar. He has been engaged in this business for more than two years with a monthly income of PHP 10,000. Ric Marcial requested a loan of PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to purchase assorted food products to sell.

Ric Marcial is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and allow customers to have a greater choice.

loans.use: To purchase assorted food products to sell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 55 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family. 

Margie runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like sugar and groceries to sell. 

Margie has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, bread, sardines, and other groceries. 

In the future Margie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosary

texts.en:
Rosary is a married lady and a mother of three school-age dependents. She is 30 years old and lives in Carmen Annex, Osamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Rosary owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the motorcycle transport business as a way of generating extra income of PHP 12,600 per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for two years.

Rosary requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

Rosary has been a good member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Rosary wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 52 years old and married with four children. 

Lucia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling firewood and charcoal and requested a 10,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to replenish her stock.

Lucia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running her business for 10 years and also earns an income from fruit vending, a general store, and selling candles. 

Lucia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional firewood and charcoal to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
50-year-old Cecilia has had a vegetable farm for five years. She is single and lives in the village of Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Cecilia is a farmer. She developed the vacant area in her backyard. To earn a living, she plants and sells different kinds of vegetables like eggplant, tomatoes, cucumber, string beans and bitter gourd. She earns PHP 2,000 every month for doing this type of farming. Cecilia intends to use the money from the loan of PHP 2,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer.

Cecilia is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Cecilia wants to have a hectare of land for vegetable farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 32 years old and married with four school-age children. She lives in Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Minda owns and operates a "Habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business. She has been engaged in this type of service because it is used to travel in mountainous areas. She has earned PHP 3,000 per month by doing this type of business for more than five years. She wanted to request a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase tires and spare parts for her motorcycle.

Minda has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She hopes that she can purchase additional motorcycles for transport.

loans.use: To purchase tires and spare parts

location.town: santa cruz tangub city misamis occidental

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is 44 years old and married.  He and his wife are blessed with 2 children.  Noel has been in livestock business (hog-raising) for almost 15 years. His net income last month is 11,000 PHP. He is requesting a loan for 23,000 PHP to purchase additional feed for his hogs. He would like to continue receiving loans to aid the growth of his business and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: purchase more feed for his hogs

loans.name: Jossie Jo

texts.en:
Jossie Jo is 54 years old and widowed with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. for her variety store.

Jossie Jo has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for two years and also earns income from buying & selling rice.

Jossie Jo aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Anna Liza

texts.en:
Anna Liza is 31 years old and married with two school-age children. She lives in Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, Anna Liza has a home-based business making and selling native food, a Filipino delicacy called "suman" (sticky rice wrapped in banana leaves or coconut leavesf). She makes and sells "suman" for merienda or snacks around the village. Anna Liza has had this type of business for two years with a monthly income of PHP 3,000. She wanted to expand her business, so she requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to buy ingredients for "suman" making.

Anna Liza has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She hopes that someday the "suman" business will be economically in demand by the public and she can continue her business with a refreshment building.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make "suman"

location.town: Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a widow with two adult-age children. She is 61 years old and is from the village of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To make a living, Fe owns and operates a business planting rice and producing palay (unmilled rice) to sell as an additional source of income. She has been doing this type of work for 10 years with a quarterly income of PHP 60,000. Fe requested a loan of PHP 35,000 from GDMPC to pay for labor costs for soil preparation for the coming planting season.

Fe has been a member of GDMPC for more than four years. In the future, Fe wants to become a member in good standing in GDMPC and continue her business.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for soil preparation

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 60 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell.

Anita has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the ready-to-wear clothing business for eight years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. 

Anita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Gulzada's Group

texts.en:
Gulzada, 53, is the leader of this group.  Together with her husband who is a pensioner, she has raised a daughter and two sons.  Her daughter and older son are working in Russia and her younger son is taking care of his parents and working as a taxi driver.  

Gulzada and her husband are farmers. They have been cultivating agricultural products almost all their lives.  With this work, they earn money to meet their daily needs. Gulzada has applied for this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Rocher

texts.en:
Rocher is 32 years old, single and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Rocher is an excellent cosmetics entrepreneur who sells body makeovers like make-up, perfume, cologne, lotion and powder. She earns PHP 15,000 from her beauty products business. She has been engaged in this type of business for more than six years. Rocher wanted to this business more so she requested a loan of PHP 35,000 from GDMPC to purchase cosmetics products to sell.

Rocher has been a member of GDMPC for three months. In the future, she hopes to have her own cosmetics store in the city.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics products to sell

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is 65 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a married lady and a mother of five adult-aged dependents. Encarnacion has a backyard cattle raising business for many purposes. She raises cattle for fattening, for meat, for milk and for breeding purposes, to earn a living. She has been engaged in this type of business for more than 30 years, with a monthly income of PHP 4,000. She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to buy additional cattle for breeding.

Encarnacion has been member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Encarnacion hopes to have a cattle ranch.

loans.use: To buy additional cattle for breeding.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 42 years old and lives in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a married lady who has never been blessed with a child. Erlinda has an excellent way of farming in her backyard: a container garden. It is one way of growing vegetables in the city and uses just enough space to grow crops. Erlinda finds alternative, simple, and practical ways of growing crops to earn a living. She has been engaged in this farming system for five years with a monthly income of PHP 2,000 by planting and selling vegetables and spices like spring onion, bell pepper, tomatoes, and leafy vegetables. She requested a loan of PHP 3,000 at GDMPC to purchase polyethylene bags and plastic containers.

Erlinda is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Erlinda hopes to continue the excellent way of farming to gain more profits.

loans.use: To purchase polyethylene bags and plastic containers

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is 32 years old and lives in the small village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of five school-age dependents. Jelly owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. She developed her vacant land for a vegetable garden to earn a living. She has been planting and selling vegetables like root crops, green and leafy vegetables, squash, and eggplant for three years. She earns PHP 1,500 every month in cultivation. Jelly requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to pay the labor costs for plowing her land.

Jelly has been a member of GDMPC for more than one year.  In the future, Jelly hopes to expand her vegetable farm and generate more income.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs for plowing her land

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun is 51 years old and lives with her son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in Tuv province in Mongolia.  Her son, who is 19 years old,  attends college. 

Oyun manages a shoe-making business in her town. She started this business in 2010. Before her shoe-making business, she operated a children's play center for 3 years. Now she makes all kinds of Mongolian traditional shoes that have become popular among her customers. 

Oyun is a polite woman who says "I want my son to get educated and have a better job in the future."   She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for her business.

loans.use: purchase materials to make shoes

loans.name: Tumurbaatar

texts.en:
Tumurbaatar is 63 years old and lives with his wife in an apartment in Tuv province in Mongolia. He manages a grocery store business in his town with the help of his wife. He started this business in 2009 and is planning to continue it in the future. They sell a variety of grocery items such as flour, rice, fruits, vegetables, etc.
