Tumurbaatar is a polite and hardworking man who says, "I want to have more inventories in order to increase my business sales." He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase grocery items for his business.

loans.use: purchase grocery items

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 44 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a married woman and mother of four school-age children. Gina has a backyard hog raising business as a secondary source of income. She established this home-based fast-growing business, which generates potential high profits in a relatively short period of time to earn a living. Gina earns PHP 2,000 every month for doing this business. She has been engaged in this business for three years. Gina requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to buy feed and piglets. Gina has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Gina hopes to have a large-scale piggery in her town.

loans.use: To buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Bundhorol

texts.en:
Bundhorol is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. Her older daughter, age 8, attends secondary school and her younger son, who has not yet reached school age, stays home. 

Bundhorol manages a food cafe in her town with the help of her husband.  They started this business in 2004 and are planning to continue it in the future. Since its opening, the business has been quite successful.  This has allowed them to expand their building recently.  

Bundhorol attributes her business success to the good location of her cafe, which is situated along the main road of the center of the province. Many customers who travel through the center of province stop by and enjoy eating the delicious meals served at her cafe. 

In the future, Bundhorol is planning to expand her building again in order to add a grocery store business at one corner. She is a hardworking and honest woman who says, "We are working hard in order to open our grocery store too."   She is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials to expand her building.

loans.use: buy construction materials to expand her building

loans.name: Enhtungalag

texts.en:
Enhtungalag is 30 years old and lives with her husband in a house in Tuv province in Mongolia. Her husband works as an officer in a government organization. She manages a grocery store business in her town.  

Enhtungalag started her business in 2004 and has gained much experience. Now she sells all kinds of fruits, meal appetizers, vegetables, etc.  Over many years of business operation, she has been able to stabilize her business and build a strong customer base.  Her recent business sales have been extremely high. She has managed to buy a car for her family's use. 

Enhtungalag is polite woman who says, "I am planning to have my own store in the future." She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.use: purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur is 61 years old and lives with his wife and son in a house in Dornod province in Mongolia. His son, who is 24 years old, attends college. 

Gantumur manages a meat trading business from a rented stall at a trading center in his town. He started his business after working as a butcher for several years. His son helps with the family business by collecting animals from herders in the countryside.  Gantumur's  products are well-known among his customers for quality and reasonable prices.  He has been able to build a strong customer base. His working capital has now reached 2,500,000 MNT and he is planning to expand his business in the future.   

Gantumur is an open-minded and delightful man who says, "I am trying hard to better my living condition."  He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase livestock for his business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit lives in Yerevan with her son. She is divorced and she brings up her son herself. Lilit is a chemist and she has worked as a laboratory assistant for a long time.

Because chemistry was not profitable, Lilit decided to start her own business. Since 2009, Lilit has run a confectionery, producing in her own place. She is producing eastern confection and other candies, with the help of her son. Lilit distributes her production to Yerevan food shops, and thanks to profit from her business, she paid for her son’s education and makes their living conditions better.
 
In the next week, Lilit is going to see off her son to the Armenian army, so she said it will be difficult to cope with business alone, but she is confident that she will manage her job well until her son returns from the army.

Lilit asks for a 600.000 Armenian dram loan to buy a new oven, flour and sugar supplies for her production.

loans.use: to buy a new oven, flour and sugar supplies for her production.

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora is 51 years old and is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 18 years old. Adora's husband is a farmer.

Adora helps her husband till the land where they grow rice crops. She also raises chickens and manages their small sari-sari (variety) store. Adora plans to use her loan to purchase four sacks of fertilizers, one sack of chick grower and farm equipment such as a water hose. She hopes to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of fertilizers, one sack of chick grower, and farm equipment such as a water hose.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.en:
Ainagul lives in Osh city, in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 46, married and has four children. Ainagul graduated from the Pedagogical University and worked at the school of Achy village as a librarian. 

Unfortunately, her salary did not cover the expenses of her household at all. That’s why, in 2004, using her start-up capital of 10,000 KGS, Ainagul started her business in trade. Year in and year out, she managed to broaden her business and earn about 30,000 KGS in a month. Her loyal customers were attracted by her optimistic attitude and cheerfulness. 

But in June 2010, when violent clashes caused by the deposed political regime broke out in the Osh city, Ainagu lost her business. Her sales place was robbed and looted. 

However, Ainagul isn't giving up and is ready to resume her lost business and continue to work. For this very reason, Ainagul is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her activity. She plans to purchase more dried fruits and nuts to resell at the local market. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fruits and nuts.

loans.name: Sendmaa

texts.en:
Sendmaa is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in Tuv province of Mongolia. Her two children, age 6 and 15, both attend local secondary school. She manages a furniture-making business with the help of her husband in her town.

They started their business in 1997 and gained much experience. Now they make all kinds of furniture such as tables, chairs and hangers. Their business is operating so successfully that they have been able to employ one more worker. Now they have many regular customers who are happy with the quality of their products.

With profits from the business they have been able to buy a workshop for the business and afford repairs to their house. Sendmaa is a kind and polite woman who says, "I am planning to expand my business and hope to have a factory someday." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase wood for her business.

loans.use: to purchase wood for a carpentry business

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda is 35 years old, married, and has two children aged 12 and 11. Her husband is a farmer. Amanda helps her husband grow rice. She also raises pigs in their backyard. Aside from farming, Amanda also manages a sari-sari store (a small general shop) where she sells items like canned goods.

Amanda has requested a loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizers, one sack of pig feed, and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a stable income that will sustain her family, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pig feed, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen, 46 years old and a talented lady, operates a handkerchief-making & selling business. She does this work to earn a living. She is divorced and lives with her mother and brothers. Her mother is also an earning person in the family. She does decorative embroidery. Nasreen has two brothers and a sister. Her elder brother has a welding shop while the 2nd one operates a lathe machine. Her sister sews clothes. Nasreen has a 17-year-old daughter who is studying in class 10th.  

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her handkerchief-making business. With the loan, she will buy thread & cloth that will allow her to make a larger number of handkerchiefs to sell. She has been operating her business for the past 8 years and is confident that she will be able to successfully improve it after the investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy thread & cloth for handkerchief-making.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
36-year-old Analyn is a married woman with three children. Her oldest child is 15 years old.

Analyn is a farmer. She primarily grows rice to sell. Part of her harvest is also used for family consumption. Analyn works hard to support her family. Like any other mother, she wants her children to finish college and be successful.

Analyn plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. Analyn hopes this will help improve her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Batchimeg

texts.en:
Batchimeg is 37 years old and lives with her three children in her older brother's house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her three children all attend local secondary school. She manages a construction-material trading business at a rented stall at a trading center. Her older daughter helps with family business during her school vacation. 

Batchimeg started her business in 2000 and has been able to stabilize her business since then. She sells all kinds of work clothes, especially work gloves. Her work gloves imported from Korea are popular among her customers due to their quality and durability. Batchimeg is a polite and diligent woman who attributes her business success to her good accounting skills. She says: "I want to expand my business in order to earn more. Also I want my daughter to be educated and have a better job in the future." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase work gloves from Korea.

loans.use: To purchase work gloves from Korea

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 27 years old and married, with 2 young children. She is a farmer working in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for 5 years. Annie also owns cows that help in tilling the land.

Annie has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. She hopes for this loan to help increase her harvest.

In the future, Annie hopes to have a productive business and successful children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is 32 years old and married with four children: a daughter and three sons. Her husband is a bus driver and provides transport services to passengers. Two of her sons are rickshaw drivers while the 3rd one is a cobbler.  

Kosar is very supportive by nature. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients for profits. The income she earns helps her to manage other household expenses. She also performs her household duties very well along with her business. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother-in-law who is also a rickshaw driver. With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw to be able to provide better quality transport services to his passengers. He is 24 years of age and Kosar is hopeful that with the increased profits she will be able to save some money for his marriage in the near future. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kosar.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife is a tailor who owns a clothing-making business. His older two daughters, age 11 and 13, go to a local secondary school while the youngest, who hasn’t reached school age, stays home. 

Lhagvasuren manages a welding business in his town. He started his business in 2007 and is planning to expand in the future. In addition, he manages a taxi service business and uses his own motorcycle to supplement his earnings. Lhagvasuren is planning to buy a container, which can be used as his workshop, to increase his business sales and service new customers. He is a hardworking man who says, “I want to buy more equipment in order to provide quality service for my customers, so I can expand my business.” 

Lhagvasuren is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment

loans.name: Lutfiya

texts.ru: Лутфия жительница района Рудаки. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж находится в России. Сама Лутфия после отъезда мужа занялась животноводством. Она разводит мелко - рогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить количество скот.
texts.en: Lutfiya lives in Rudaki.  She is 41 years old, married, and has three children.  Her husband is in Russia.  After her husband left, Lutfiya started working as a herdsman.  She breeds small livestock (sheep or goats) for sale.  She has been doing this work for ten years.  She is taking out a loan to buy small livestock to expand her herd.

loans.use: to buy small livestock (sheep or goats)

loans.name: Harapan Jaya 8 Group

texts.en:
Saniah is one of the members of this group. She is married and has three children.
She requested 2,000,000 Indonesian rupiah to buy vegetables like beans and spinach, which she will sell in her kiosk.
Because her education was only until elementary school, she hopes she can enable her children to reach a higher education level.

loans.use: to buy vegetables like beans and spinach.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is a farmer from the town of Banga, South Cotabato.  He tills his own land where he grows rice crops.  He also raises pigs to sell. 

He plans to use his loan to purchase 1 sack of feed, 4 sacks of fertilizers and 3 sacks of seeds.  Carlos is hopeful that this loan will help his businesses.  He wants to earn more and support his family financially.

loans.use: to purchase 1 sack of feed, 4 sacks of fertilizers and 3 sacks of seeds

loans.name: Sainhuuhen

texts.en:
Sainhuuhen is 22 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia.  Her husband is an accountant in a private company while her daughter, age 1, goes to a kindergarten.  She manages a clothing sales business in her town. 

She started her business in March, 2011.  At first she started her business with a loan from her husband.  Now she is planning to expand and continue her business in the future.  She is a polite and kind woman who is planning to improve her living condition and to buy a house for her family.  She says, "One can earn big by selling large amount of products."  She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more summer clothes from China.

loans.use: To purchase more summer clothes from China

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 43 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like shampoo, toothpaste, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Amalia has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Amalia aspires to build and expand business to secure a future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Usaha Jaya 8 Group

texts.en:
Elli is 39 years old, is married, and has three children. She lives with her family in Kalibaru, Cilincing, Jakarta.
She makes and sells "green banana" foods with bananas as the main ingredient, cooked with with angel hair and flour. She requested 2,000,0000 Indonesian rupiah to buy more ingredients such as bananas, angel hair, and flour for her business. 
She hopes to continue making and selling this food to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as bananas, angel hair, and flour.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Arlene is 32 years old and all four of her children are in school.

Arlene has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional  fish to sell.

loans.name: Shiiter

texts.en:
Shiiter is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Tuv province of Mongolia.  Her two children, ages 3 and 5, both attend kindergarten while her husband works as an engineer at a Telecommunications Company. 

She manages a grocery trading business at a rented stall at a local market.  She started her business in 2010.  She sells all kinds of vegetables planted and harvested in Mongolia.  People like to buy Mongolian organic vegetables.  Therefore her business sales are quite high compared with other salespersons. 

She is planning to broaden the variety of her products in the future.  She is a polite woman who attributes her business success to her good managerial skills.  She says, "I want to have my own house."  She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna is 44 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by raising hogs in the Philippines. Digna is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vitamins and feed for her pigs.

Digna has been raising hogs for six years and also earns additional income from rice farming.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional vitamins and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 55 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a Sari-Sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like sardines, sugar, coffee, groceries, etc. to sell.

Dominga has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the Sari-Sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from salted cashews and peanuts.

Dominga aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Uitumen

texts.en:
Uitumen is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia.  His three children, all attend the local secondary school.  

He manages a dairy product trading business with the help of his wife in his town.  He started his business in 1990 with several livestock in his possession.  In order to expand his business he wrote a business plan to increase his milk sales and bought four cows which have been funded by Xacbank, one of the biggest banks in Mongolia. 

He is planning to supply all secondary schools in his province with his milk produce.  He is a hardworking man who says, "I am planning to supply all the milk demands of our province."  He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase cows to produce more milk.

loans.use: To purchase cows

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 2 children. 

Charita has a shop that sells canned goods, breads, snacks and biscuits.  She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Charita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Charita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 29 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Edna works very hard to provide for them.

Edna runs a buying and selling "nipa" business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional "nipa" to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Edna would like to save enough so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase additional nipa  (palm frond mats) to sell.

loans.name: Jay

texts.en:
Jay is 18 years old, single and lives in Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Jay has a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He invested in this type of service because motorcycles use much less gasoline than four-wheel vehicles, are easier to maintain, can park anywhere and are flexible in traffic. Jay has had this type of business for two years as a sideline work after school. He earn every month of PHP 2,400.00 doing these business. He requested a loan of PHP 25,000 from GDMPC to buy a brand new motorcycle for transport. Jay is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Jay hopes to have more motorcycle transport services.

loans.use: To buy a brand new motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is 41 years of age and involved in sewing clothes. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. She receives orders from her neighboring clients and earns well after completing the orders.  

Her husband is a professional driver. He drives a taxi and provides transport services to his passengers.  Nusrat is the mother of four children. Her elder two daughters left their education after completing the 8th class. They help their mother in completing the clients' sewing orders on time. 

Nusrat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to repair his taxi. This will help him save his business asset and also enable him to continue providing better quality transport services to his passengers. He has been operating his business for the past 30 years and Nusrat hopes that an investment will help her husband to increase his profits and also improve the condition of his car by repairing it. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a blue booklet (an Asasah passbook) is Nusrat.

loans.use: To repair a taxi.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 45 years old and married with two children ages 19 and 21. She is a farmer working in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. Clarita grows rice to sell and she also raises pigs in her backyard.

Clarita is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, seed, and feed. She hopes to be a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seed, and feed

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. For the past five years, Vergie has run a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and bread. 

Vergie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, Vergie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 35 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and a mother of two school-age children. Jocelyn has a motorcycle transport services business. She chose this type of service because it is an affordable common form of transport and is demanded by travelers in the mountainous area. She has been doing this type of service for two years with a monthly income of PHP 3,000. Jocelyn requested a loan of 6,000 from GDMPC to purchase motorcycle spare parts and tires. Jocelyn has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to have more motorcycle transport services.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a young man from Qalqilia- Palestine. He is married and a father of two sons. Muhammad runs an electronics store selling irons, hair dryers, mixers, etc.

Muhammad wants to have a better income as the current one is barely enough, so he took out a loan from FATEN to redecorate his store so as to have the items exhibited in a better arrangement and attract more customers.

Muhammad is photographed in FATEN's branch in Qalqilia.

loans.use: to refurbish the electronics store to exhibit electronics better and attract customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Ilhomidin

texts.ru: Илхомидин проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст, 24 года. Он женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Илхомидин имеет среднее образование. Он более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Ilhomidin lives in Rudaki.  He is 24 years old, married, and has one child.  His wife is a housewife.  Ilhomidin has a secondary education.  He has been working as a herdsman for more than five years.  He breeds livestock at his home.  He is taking out a loan to buy goats to increase his livestock.

loans.use: to buy goats

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with children and has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Rosemarie has had her business for three years.

Rosemarie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy snacks, bread, and beverages to sell. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, bread, and beverages

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. For the past ten years, Elsie has run a shop that sells beverages, snacks, and canned goods.

Elsie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy snacks, beverages, and bread. In the future, Elsie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, and bread

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is 46 years old, married with five children: three sons and two daughters. She couldn’t educate her children due to poor financial circumstances. Her eldest son has a construction supplies business while the other two are laborers. Her husband is a farmer. He grows different seasonal crops to earn income for his family. He also has some buffaloes and he sells their milk to earn extra income. 

Kosar is a housewife, staying at her home and doing her household responsibilities. She also supports her husband in his milk-selling business by milking the buffaloes and keeping their stalls clean. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to grow better crops and make more profit from his business. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years. Kosar is hopeful that an investment will help him increase his income by growing better quality crops. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She has established a good credit record in previous loan year and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kosar.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for agriculture business.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a vegetable and spices vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 24,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetable and spices to sell for her vegetable and spices vending business.

Elma has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from rice farming.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business and send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing nets, gasoline and other fishing gear.

Erlinda has been in this business for seven years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets, gasoline and other fishing necessities.

loans.name: Demna

texts.en:
Demna is 49 years old and is a married woman with a 14-year-old child. She is a farmer working in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She grows rice crops to sell. Demna also buys coconuts and makes copra.

Demna has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This will help Demna improve her harvest.

In the future, Demna hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is 51 years old, widowed, and a mother three sons and three daughters. Her need to survive with her family has led her to start a retail business selling clothes; she started buying clothes from wholesale parties and sells them by the piece and makes a profit out of it.

Now Siham is applying for this loan to buy more goods and have some variety in the products she sells so she can satisfy most of her customer’s tastes.

loans.use: To buy more goods (clothes) and have some variety in the products she sells.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 46 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Gemma works very hard to provide for them.

Gemma runs a Direct Selling business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 49,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of Avon, Natasha, and MSE products to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as perfumes, dresses, lipstick, cologne, etc.

In the future Gemma would like to save enough to purchase of lot to build house on for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional Avon, Natasha, and MSE products to sell.

loans.name: Gloriosa

texts.en:
Gloriosa is 52 years old, married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gloriosa has a buy & sell dried and fresh fish business in the Philippines. Gloriosa has requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dried fish to sell.

Gloriosa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Gloriosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children in college..

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ulfat's Group

texts.en:
Ulfat is 32 years old and a married lady. Her husband operates a grocery store where he sells daily-use household items such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc. He is very good in his dealings with the customers and makes good sales every day. He is also a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his passengers. Ulfat helps him by taking care of his grocery store when he goes away for his driving business. 

She is the mother of five sons: two of them are daily wage laborers while the others stay at home. Ulfat couldn’t educate her children due to financial constraints. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will purchase groceries in bulk quantities that will allow him to fill his customer orders and earn better profits. Her husband has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Ulfat is confident that he will successfully be able to improve it after investing the loan in it. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ulfat.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Mekdad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married, and has one child.

Mekdad has owned a barber shop since 2008. He has five years' experience and has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to make a sliding door and install a ceiling for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and install a ceiling for his shop.

loans.name: Olim

texts.ru: Олим женатый мужчина. Ему 52 года. Он проживает в Яванском районе. У него пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Олим создал все условия для расширения своей деятельности. Он берет кредит для закупа дойной коровы.
texts.en: Olim is a married man.  He is 52 years old.  He lives in Yavan.  He has five children.  His wife is a housewife.  He makes a living breeding cattle.  He breeds cattle at home.  Olim has done everything possible to expand his business.  He is taking out a loan to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 48 years old, married, and has three children.

Ahmad has had an auto repair shop since 1989. He has long experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2500 loan for tiling floors and walls of the shop. He is aiming to gain more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: For tiling floors and walls of the shop.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is a caring lady who carries out her responsibilities as a housewife by staying at home. She is also a very good mother and takes care of her children very well. Her husband is a farmer. He owns a small piece of land where he grows different seasonal crops. He is a very hard worker and puts a great effort in growing good quality crops. He has good business contacts and he earns a reasonably good income from his business. 

Zubaida has given birth to seven children. Her eldest son works in a factory for a low income while four of the remaining six children are getting their education. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially support her husband who wants to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides, etc. to make his agriculture business more profitable. Zubaida is hopeful that after the loan investment. her husband will be able to grow better crops and earn more profit. Her husband has been in this work for the past 10 years. 

Zubaida is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In her previous loan year, she paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a  book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zubaida.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for agriculture business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. For the past five years, Emelie has operated a food shop where she sells rice and cassava cakes. 

Emelie is a new member of HSPFI. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional rice  to sell and ingredients for making and selling snacks like cassava cakes . In the future, Emelie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional rice and ingredients for making cassava cake

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase accessories to include among the items sold in his store.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 45 years old and lives in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of five school-age dependents. Susan has a snack vending business. To earn a living, she sells snacks everyday like pancakes, sweet potato and banana cue, and rice cakes around her village. She has been running this business for more than nine years with a monthly income of PHP 3,000. She established the snack vending business as a way to generate extra income to be used in family consumption and education for her five children. Susan requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to buy ingredients for snack preparation. Susan has been a member of GDMPC for three months. In the future, Susan hopes to have her own snack stall in the market and sell freshly prepared snacks.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare snacks to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. For the past ten years, Emma has operated a retail shop where she sells fish such as sardines and milk fish. 

Emma is a new member of HSPFI. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hair weaves, a blow dryer, and fruit to make juice

loans.name: Shafeeqan

texts.en:
Shafeeqan is a married lady. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He has two rickshaws, one he drives himself while the 2nd one is rented out, through which he earns handsome amount of income every month also.

Shafeeqan has three daughters. All of them are young and haven’t started their education yet. She herself is a housewife and does her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is also a very caring mother and is raising her daughters with great care. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to pay the remaining installments of his rickshaw. By paying the installments, the rickshaw will become his property and he will be able to run his transport business better. 

Shafeeqan is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that the loan will bring good profits to her husband in result.

loans.use: To pay the remaining installments on a rickshaw.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a married man who lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato with his family. He is a farmer and tills his own land. Edwin grows rice and corn to sell. He works hard to provide for the needs of his family.

Edwin is requesting a loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizer, two sacks of seed, and other farm inputs. He hopes to be successful someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seed, and farm inputs

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. For the past five years, Genevieve has owned a retail shop where she sells used clothing, known as ukay-ukay. 

Genevieve is a new member of HSPFI. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase bundles of used clothing to sell. In the future, Genevieve hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. For the past five years, Victoria has owned a retail shop where she sells dried fish.

Victoria is a new member of HSPFI. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional dried fish. In the future, Victoria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as tin and sheets of iron

loans.name: Hermelina

texts.en:
Hermelina is 44 years old and married with 3 children.

Hermelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a Sari Sari (general) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like shampoo, sardines, grocery items, etc. to sell.

Hermelina has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the Sari Sari (General) store for 6 years and also earns an income from rice farming.

Hermelina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. For the past five years, Richard has owned a meat shop where he sells pork and beef. 

Richard is a new member of HSPFI.  He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy pigs to butcher and sell. In the future, Richard hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy pigs to butcher and sell

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra is a 58-year-old widow who is living in a rented house. After her husband passed away she decided to fill her time by opening a small grocery store to have a regular monthly income.

The grocery store has been running for three years now. It has an outstanding number of daily customers who keep on coming back to buy from her store because of the smile she welcomes her customers with. 

Now Yusra is applying for a loan to buy more goods for her store based on what her customers asked for.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her grocery store, based on what her customers asked for.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. She has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & bread. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Elizabeth is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Enelita

texts.en:
Enelita is 49 years old and is a married woman who lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She and her husband are both farmers. She helps her husband till their land and grow rice crops.

Enelita has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes this loan will help increase their harvest.

In the future, Enelita hopes for her children to be successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. He has a vegetable garden and sells eggplant, okra & string beans. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.

Rogelio is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rogelio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada works hard to support her family. Iluminada is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Iluminada has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in her fish stall.

Iluminada has been in this business for 20 years .

In the future, Iluminada would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a 48-year-old lady and operates a power loom business at her home. She is very much an expert in her work and makes cloth from it. She is also a very good housewife and a mother. She tries to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

She is the mother of five children. Three of them study while another stays at home. Her eldest son who is 21 years old left his education after 10th standard and started sewing and embroidery work to share the financial burden with his parents. He is now an expert in his work. 

Saira has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her own business. With the loan, she will repair her power loom and also buy some thread that will allow her to continue her work and finish the orders quickly and more efficiently. 

She has been operating her business for the past 15 years and hopes that a loan investment will help her improve her business further.

loans.use: To repair a power loom and also buy some thread.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a 51-year-old, married father of seven children. Ronald is a landlord in Kilifi, Mombasa. Ronald's business has been in operation for 20 years and has been a success. 

He has been a KADET client and this marks his third loan to finance his business. With this loan he plans to purchase iron sheets to renovate some of his rental houses. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay back the loan and to gradually expand his business.

In future Ronald hopes to own more rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets to renovate some rental houses.

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel is a 32-year-old single mother who lives with her daughter and mother in a small house in the outer ger (Mongolian yurt) districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her mother stays at home while her daughter attends public secondary school.
Odgerel started a business in 2006, at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market of Mongolia, selling underwear and slippers, with 750,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) of working capital. Since then, her business has expanded and her current working capital has increased to 1,080,000 MNT.

With her business earnings, Odgerel started building a new small house as the old house is damaged and close to collapse. She bought cement, sand and other necessary materials with 3,500,000 MNT.  Odgerel is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy more necessary building materials such as, windows, doors etc., to finish her housing project before the end of this summer. Ogderel is a high-motivated and responsible woman who wants to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials to finish the the building of her house

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages & bread. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy candies, biscuits & bread.

Julieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy candies, biscuits & bread.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 35 years old and lives in Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a married lady and a mother of one school-age child.
Marilyn owns a tricycle, a three-wheel vehicle for transport, to earn a living. She lets her tricycle be rented everyday to transport passengers. She earns PHP 2,000 every month from tricycle rent. She has been engaged in this type of business for two years. Marilyn requested a loan of PHP 8,000 from GDMPC to purchase a brand new tricycle for transport.

Marilyn has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Marilyn hopes to own and operates more tricycles in her area.

loans.use: To purchase a brand new tricycle.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a retail shop, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. Her greatest challenge is dealing with price fluctuations in the market. An increase in the price of goods makes buying and selling products challenging. She dreams of establishing a cereals shop in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, rice and sugar for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, rice, and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a fridge

loans.name: Wajed

texts.en:
Wajed is a 44-year-old married father of two. He lives and works in Aley. Wajed started his own business 11 years ago; he has 27 years of experience in photography. 

He first started this business when his brother discovered his talent and bought him a special gift, as he describes his first camera, and his journey began. 

Wajed is well-known in his region; he's requested at almost all the weddings in his area and neighboring villages. He's talented and treats his customers in a very polite and special way. 

Wajed loves his family a lot, and seeks the best for them. He is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua, in order to buy an improved and updated Canon camera, which is necessary for his business. 

Wajed hopes to buy an updated editing machine with special effects that will help a lot in editing the wedding photographs he takes.

loans.use: To buy a new improved Canon camera necessary for his business

loans.name: Honiwel

texts.en:
Honiwel is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Honiwel has a shop that sells cell phone accessories & electronic loads (prepaid cell phone minutes). He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional cell phone accessories. In the picture is Honiwel, his wife, and their son. 

Honiwel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Honiwel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional cell phone accessories

loans.name: Senzokwethu 2 Group

texts.en:
Ntokozo is 31, single, and has two children who are two and five years old. Her five-year-old attends school. She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. In the photo she is pictured raising her hand. 

She has been in this business for two years selling perfume, airtime and bath towels. She also receives income from the government's child support grant. 

She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy perfumes and airtime. She says that the main challenges to her business are customers who buy on credit and fail to pay on time. Ntokozo adds that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her life and her family because now she can put food on the table. 

In her comment she thanks WDB and Kiva for lending her money as she is unemployed.

loans.use: To buy perfumes and airtime

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with three children, ages 28, 23, and 20. She is a farmer who works in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. Evangeline grows rice crops. She sells her harvest at her town's market. Evangeline works hard to support her family. She requested a loan to purchase eight sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs.

In the future, Evangeline hopes to have a stable business. She also wishes for her children's success and for them to be God fearing.

loans.use: to purchase eight sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samuel has been in the mining industry for the last 23 years in the town of Naivasha. He is 54 years old and married to Pamella. They are blessed with six children.

Samuel was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, who is also a KADET client. This will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) in full and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy another extraction site and add more manpower.

In the future, Samuel hopes to own several extraction sites in the outskirts of Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy another extraction site and add more manpower

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the utilities for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Liwayway

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Liwayway works hard to support her family.

She has a buy & sell of dried and fresh fish business in the Philippines and also earns an additional income from raising hogs.. Liwayway is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dried & fresh fish to sell for her business.

Liwayway has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to purchase a motorcycle for her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of dried & fresh fish to sell,

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 41 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising hogs in the Philippines. Liza is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. Liza has been raising hogs for ten years, and also earns an additional income from her electric supply and  billiards hall.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Bethuel

texts.en:
Bethuel has practised farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last seven years. He is 48 years old and married to Elizabeth. They have four school-going children.  

Bethuel was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his fourth loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer. He hopes to get a good harvest and sell the produce in the local market.

In the future, Bethuel hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nimaneno

texts.en:
Nimaneno is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from her home to neighbors and passersby. The major challenge she faces in her business is seasonality. Her dream is to sell wholesale in the future.

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 53 years old and lives in Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband Andres is a machine operator, and they have several children, all of whom are working. She makes a living by running a variety store and a food stall. She also rents video karaoke machines and earns at least PHP 624 a day.

She is applying for a loan for PHP 21,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory, and to maintain her video karaoke machines. She expects to increase her income as she expands her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay loans.

loans.use: to restock her variety store.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines with his wife and three children. For the last five years, he has made a living by providing taxi services and is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools and pay for maintenance of his vehicle. Eric has been a member of HSPFI since 2007 and is making good use of his membership to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 21 years old, single and lives in Tyre, where he has made a living by selling clothes since 2005. He sells items to men, women and children and works hard to keep his customers satisfied and meet all of their clothing needs in one place. He takes pride in low prices and is applying for this loan from Kiva Partner Al Majmoua, where he has a good credit rating, to buy summer clothing to sell to his customers. He is working hard to expand his store and eventually open a larger one in the future.

loans.use: To buy summer clothing to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann, 31, a resident of Silang, Cavite in the Philippines. She is single but works hard to sustain herself. At this time, she is working hard to continually make enough for her everyday expenses. 

Mary Ann operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, where groceries, toiletries and beverages are sold piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five Philippine pesos' (PHP) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. 

Mary Ann earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also earns money through an electronic cellular phone loading station. What she does is to buy electronic cellular phone loads (minutes) in bulk, then resell them at retail. Her profit depends on the network's dealership policy. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 610 PHP in sales every day. 

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also invest some of the loan to buy electronic loads from different local networks. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mary Ann hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to support her sister up to college level. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store.
